name: Ferrara Camping
description: Established campground near Ferrara.

name: Montemare Campground
description: Nice campground with a view over Mittelmeer and some Mountains. We stayed two nights and payed 26€ per night (2 adults, 1 camper). Each place has it's own sink with drinkable water. Market, bar and Swimmingpool.

name: Camping Venezia Village
description: It's a nice established campground with beautiful showers, a restaurant, a small shop and just 15 minutes away from Venice itself! We payed 24€ for a VW van and 2 persons, included camper service, shower and electricity! A 24h wifi is available for 2€!

name: Camping Fusina
description: Nice place to stay if you want to visit Venice. Big grassy area with view over the city of Venice. The ferry leaves next door with reasonable prices (13€ round trip). All facilities are in good shape and clean. Might be busy during high season, April was totally fine. I paid 5€ per person plus 15€ for the van. Seems average in Italy.

name: Limone Mountain Trail
description: Pretty extreme 4x4 driving to get to the top of the trail. Guess not allowed to camp, however should try this road as it is just fantastic.

name: Parking lot in Sirmione
description: Free parking lot oposite a therma. Close to the center of Sirmione.  Perfect gateway to the old town. If you have a bike, it takes 10 Minutes to the end of the island. Much faster then by car in busy times. Very quiet place! No facilities.

name: Parking lot in Borghetto
description: Large parking lot on the left side after the Visconti bridge. Oposite the R.V. park. If you drive to the upper end of the parking lot there is a fenced space for R.V.'s in the green. Very quiet. No facilities. Within walking distance to the village of Borghetto. 5 € for 24h.

name: Camping Serenella
description: Nice campground by the beach. All facilities, restaurant, shop. 17 € with ACSI card off season.

name: Parking lot in Arco
description: Parking lot in the heart of the climbing meka of Arco. Nice village with lots of outdoor stores and Gelaterias. Right after the bridge in the right side. 10 € for 24h. No facilities. 4 km from Lago di Garda.

name: Camping Piantelle in Moniga
description: Very nice 4* campground next to the beach of Lago di Garda. Large sites, all facilities incl. restaurant and grocery store. Good price off season with ACSI-Card for a 4* camping (19 € for 2). Very nice employees!

name: Isola dei gabbiani
description: Beautiful spot on little "island" perfect for kitesurf. But very expensive for what you get. High season crowded, loud (lots and lots of kids), and not that great facilities. Basically you are paying for location.

name: Camping La Mariposa
description: City camping right on the beach walking distance north of town. Shady / grassy pitches. Clean facilities & nice coin operated hot shower. Pizzaria & minimart.

name: Tirrenia Ferry Ticket Office
description: Hours 8-12p, 4-8p. Small office on angle behind gas station across the street from water

name: nube d'argento
description:
Nice Campsite very close to the city center. Toilets and showers are clean. There are a few spots with sea view. It’s definitely busy here. There’s a pool and a restaurant. 
We payed 33€ pn with our camper, they told us they charge 4€ more in July and August. Wifi available for 1€/3days. 
You get a 10% discount if you’re a member of the German Auto Club ADAC.

name: La Timpa
description: Relaxing little spot sort of on a cliff overlooking the ocean. Very close to etna volcano and nicer than etna camping slot I looked at. Seems like mostly "cabins" but there were a handful of big rigs and tents around. Tent area not huge but grassy and shady (even a few citrus trees). Also little terrace with pizzaria & huge dessert menu and local wine with great view of the ocean. Path leads down to cove if you want a swim.  Friendly staff

name: Ferry to malta ticket office
description: Ferry to malta ticket office. virtuferries

name: Ferry to Malta Port Entrance
description: Ferry to Malta Port entrance is here. multi-day parking storage available, but no sleeping in vehicle is allowed.

name: Camping
description: Perfect spot to catch Malta ferry and you can leave your vehicle if you want. A "work in progress" by nice old Italian owner. Large grassy field adjacent to beach with a few small trees and a couple of old boats. Solar shower hot hot hot. But don't expect things like doors/roof on the shower/toilet. Maybe they will have been installed by the time you get here. Very relaxing rustic spot.

name: Ferry to Albania
description: Note ticket office is about 2km north along waterfront in bedouin style tent camp. Ferries to Montenegro and Croatia also in same place but less crowded, more frequeny, and cheaper via Albania, at least with moto today. Hope it's not that bad

name: Refugio Auronzo - Drei Zinnen/Tre Cima
description: Parking lot next to Refugio Auronzo just in front of the 'Tre Cima' mountains. From here starts the walk around the 'Tre Cimas' on 2'300 m.a.s. You pay a toll fee for the road (24 €/car or 36 €/camper for 24h).  No more overnight fees. Great view, restaurant and toilet nearby.

name: Parking lot Paso Tre Croci
description: Parking lot on top of Pasp Tre Croci. no facilities but nice view and free of charge. Perfect starting point for some hikes. For ex. no. 215 to Lago di Sorapis.

name: Campeggio Eden
description: Nice Campground at the beautiful lake Iseo, under trees, gravel beach and meadow. Just next to the town center with restaurants and bars.

name: Camping Europe, Dervio
description: Camping mainly for longterm rental, we did not feel very welcome. But it was ok for one night as there are not many options on the eastern side of Lake Como. Nice restaurant with lake view, around 500m north at the promenade.

name: Camping Deserto, Domaso
description: Nice Camping, mainly families and kiters. Grass ground and trees. Good infrastructure, friendly.

name: Camping Rocchetta
description: Nice camping site with various shady options. Hikes up the mountains straight out the front gate. On site shop for bread, milk, beer etc. Wifi only around shop/reception. Under 10 euro a night for 1 adult, tent, car.

name: Camping Firenze
description:
Moden build campsite with big pitches you can park motorhomes in. Water/power at each site. free Wifi across most of the camp. Washing machines available. No shade as currently trees are still a bit small. 29 euro per pitch/site. Includes 2 people, power and water. A short walk away is supermarket and bus stop to city centre.

Update: we paid 52 for a site 2 persons and rooftop tent. ( september 2020)

name: Albero d'oro
description: Nice little camp ground with plenty of shade on the edge of Levanto. Close to the train station for trips to the Cinque-terre. Wifi only around reception/cafe/shop. You can park you car next to your tent here. Two other sites we checked we funny about this.

name: Bolzano street parking
description: parking is not allowed during most hours. but after 9 pm and before 8 am it is okay (within white lines) if you find blue lines it's 7pm to 7 am you can park. next to railroad with train running through the night. some drive by traffic too.

name: Hill Top Wild Camp
description: Hill top wils camp with 270 views of the sea. It is an exposed site and can get windy. Access is via steep twisting, narrow road and then gravel track. There are a few drainage ditches to cross. So only recommended for 4x4 or small vans with high ground clearance.

name: Arezzo street parking
description: free after 8 pm till 8am calm street with some drive bys. no big vehicles. there is a car park for RVs outside of town (north) don't know if it's free but I saw it from the hill watching sunset. small vans for flat street parking. there is a casino around the corner thar i used for a Kate night bathroom

name: all vehicles welcome
description: all rigs fit. easy parking. lots of rvs.

name: Zoggler Stausee- Retaining Wall
description: Drive over retaining wall of Zoggler Stausee. There is a parking spot. Picnic bench nearby. Nice walking path along the lake. Mobile internet.

name: Caravan Park Schneeburghof
description: Quit caravan park on gravel. Crowded during high season. Nice setting. 30 minutes walk to Meran City. Mobile internet, 23 EUR per car pn. Extra fee for internet.

name: Zoggler Stausee- Upper End
description: In The Woods,end of Zoggler Stausee, quiet, you hear the mountain creek, but not the traffic. Parking options on both sides of the bridge.

name: Parking Lot Weissbrunnsee
description: Parking lot near retaining wall of Weissbrunnsee. Very quiet. Steep, narrow access road from St. Gertraud, restricted to trucks < 8 m. Restaurant with good local dishes 200 m up the road. There is another big parking spot in front of the restaurant and there were other campers on the grasslands at the lake. Starting point of nice hiking trails.

name: Zumis, Lower Parking Lot
description: Big flat parking lot at starting point of hiking trails to Rodenecker Alm. Even in high season we were alone here. ( all other people parked at upper parking area). Restaurant 10 min walk. Toilets at upper parking lot.

name: Pe De Börz (near Würzjoch)
description: Big parking lot at road to Würzjoch / Jü de Börz; quiet at night, if you park in the corner opposite the road; starting point of hike to Maurerberg

name: Ansitz Wildberg
description: Nice campground in beautiful landscape, friendly stuff, only a few minutes walking distance from city of St. Lorenzen (restaurant "Alte Post", supermarket), in high season 36 EUR for 1 car, 2 persons w/o electricity. Extra charge for showers. Washing machine and dryer 4 EUR each. Swimming pool (free), sauna (fee). Wifi (fee), but free wifi is available in town! Note: Some access roads are restricted to 3,30 m heights, but eastern access via coordinates  N 46,781095; E 11,905834 is  not restricted.

name: Kasern
description: Parking spot at end of road. Fee max. 18 EUR per day. Quiet. Starting point of several hiking tours. Restaurants in village.

name: Camping im Park, Glurns
description: Communal Campsite, clean facilities, 16.40 EUR for 2. In peak season, be early as it fills up quickli. Have a stroll in historic Glurns.

name: Camping Sarathei, Lago di Santa Croce
description: Nice, large camping at Lago di Santa Croce. Popular for Kite Surfing. May there is always an empty pitch for you. Check-in till 7pm. EUR 30.50 for 2 inlc. electricity and shower

name: Jausenstation Säge
description: Parking lot almost at the end of the valley, very quiet apart from mountain creek! opposite of restaurant/ pizzeria (very good lokal food and pizza/ friendly host!). We had dinner there and asked for staying over night, which was not problem at all. Dumping station and water 2 km away at RV site in Rein.

name: Camping St Josef Am Se
description: Menu pricing. High season 7.8 euro per person, then depends on pitch type. We had pitch D for tent with motorcycle for 9.2 euros. High season so totally packed. Fine for a night and the bathrooms were very clean. All the things: wifi, hot water, little store, restaurant, dish area, laundry area. Was surprisingly quiet by 11pm.

name: Rein In Taufers Parkplatz
description: Dumping station and fresh water. Free wifi. Toilets and shower for 5 euro

name: Talschlusshütte
description: There are several  parking lots around all marked with "no camping". So you can only stay *in* the car which is not very charming. Some restaurants nearby.

name: Pardoi Pass
description: Huge flat parking lot at top of Pass Pardoi. As always "camping not allowed", but many RVs stood  there overnight (no camping activities, everybody stayed in his car). Not very charming, but if you stand at the edge nice panorama and practical as starting point of hiking tours.

name: Campeggio Miravalle
description: Beautiful campground with stunning views to the Dolomites. Well maintained, clean and tidy. Washing machine and dryer ( 5 EUR each). There are lots of hiking opportunities around. Only a few minutes walking to city center of Campitello and ropeway station.  Neat village center with shops, restaurants etc. In July/August it is overcrowded! 40 EUR for 2 persons + 2 car.

name: Parking Lots
description: Big day parking spot in front of the Druso stadium. Many places vacant even in high season, if there is no event ongoing. Walking distance to city center.

name: Kappl/ Langtauferer Tal
description: Parking lot almost at the end of the Langtauferer Valley.   Quiet. Restaurants nearby. Lower level is restricted to less than 3.20 m height. (Note: at the very end of the valley it is not allowed to park overnight.)

name: Camping Internationale Manacore
description: Great Place for camping. Directly at one of the best beaches i know in Italy.

name: Colle Basset
description: Good overnight spot at the Strada dell'Assietta, no facilities, Free

name: San Giuliano Park
description: paid parking 18€ each 24h with water and bathrooms.  4 € more with electricity. You can walk in the park and cycle, plus at the entrance there is a kiosk where you can buy tickets to go by bus to Venice (3€ go and back), the bus stop is 10 min walking and then 10min to arrive to venice.

name: Area di Sosta Orvieto
description: Open all year. Camper Rest Area. 18 EUR/24h incl. Toilet and hot shower. Laundry available. Go to the nice town with the funicular, we were for dinner. Next to railway, noise. Nothing fancy but good for a night.

name: Lido Alexander
description: Open all year. Basis camp at the beach. 10 EUR incl. electricity. Hot shower with 1 EUR coins.

name: Sosta Camper Prajola, Palmi
description: Open all year. Basic camp. Only solar shower. Run by friendly family. 10 EUR incl. electricity.

name: Camping La Focetta Sicula, Sant'Alessio Siculo
description: Open all year. Campsite at the beach. Old but clean infrastructure. Friendly staff. Laundry available. 19 - 25 EUR incl. electricity.

name: Camping Jonio, Catania
description: Camping at the sea with clean facilities, laundry and restaurant. Friendly and helpful staff. Supermarket just round the corner. 25 EUR incl. electricity. wifi is extra

name: Agriturismus Il Gigliotto
description:
Open all year. Camping area at a winery, also rooms available. Hot shower and electricity. Pool. Nice view over the wineyards. Set menu dinner EUR 25.
Great location. But do not expect a small family run farm, it's big business. Recomendable. EUR 20 per night.

name: Parking Von Platen, Siracusa
description: Open all year. Area for campers at the parking. EUR 1.50 per hour incl. electricity. Shower and toilette crepy. But convenient for visiting Siracusa, archeological park and old town in walking distance.

name: Camping Sabbiadoro, Avola
description: Open all year. Very nice, neat and clean camping. Internet, hot shower and laundry at extra cost but good quality. Acess to own sand beach. With plants and trees almost like a garden. Friendly staff. Acess road a bit narrow... In winter only EUR 25.

name: Parking at lago Martignano
description:
It looks like an official parking place, but I'm not sure. 
The surroundings are nice with acces to the lake an a few walking tracks. Quiet in after season. Also water but out of order.

name: Camping Piccadilly, Donnalugata
description: Open all year. Nothing fancy but clean and functional. Superb hot shower. Access to nice sand beach. EUR 15.00

name: Camping Valle dei Templi, Agrigento
description: Open all year. Nice campground. 1km to Valle dei Templi, bus around every half an hour. 500m to beachfront with nice restaurants. EUR 22.50 incl. electricity. Recomendable.

name: Camping Lilybeo, Marsala
description: Open all year. Surprisingly nice camping. Run by very friendly and helpful couple. 20 EUR incl. electricity, hot shower and good internet. Less if you stay longer. NO street dogs! We recommend.

name: El Bahira, San Vito lo Capo
description: Open all year. Large, nice camping beautiful located. In offseason many empty longtermers, restaurant closed. Hot shower for €0.70, electricity, wifi only at bar/pool. 12 EUR in offseason.

name: Area Attrezzata Play Time, Catellammare del Golfo
description: Open all year. Basic camp 500meter from  town center, sea view. Toilet and shower basic but clean. Washingmashine. Friendly family. EUR 10 incl. electricity.

name: Hostel 7 Santi
description: Clean hostel, big and buffet dinner 7€ and breakfast 5€. Can park bike inside premises

name: Mio Hostel
description: 17€ dorm room, including breakfast and dinner. Can park motorbike inside the premises.

name: Caravan Camping Club
description: Seems to be a storage place for caravans and campers with some camping spots for travellers. A little tatty but great value - €15 for 2 incl vehicle.  Wifi at bar, electricity extra €1.50 I think.

name: Camping Terre Rosse
description: In the woods behind the restaurant Fermin, nice little campground.  €7 pp plus €2 for car (or €11 for motorhome).  Not flash but nice spot away from crazy roads and good value with all that you need.

name: Free camp in Calci
description: For enclosed campers and toilet dump in cute little town.  We parked inside our land cruiser (no tents allowed).  No facilities but coop is 3-400m and has toilet (open 8am).

name: Cinqe Terre camp ground
description: The place is basic with water, electricity and wifi. The location has very nice view. One restaurant is just across the road. Owner David offers transfer to and from Monterosso, you can also take bus or walk. Rate is 25€

name: Monterosso al Mare parking
description: €20 per 24hr in winter or €25 in summer.  Couple of toilet options in town.  Not sure about roof top tents as all we saw were campervans.  We didn't stay here but many many people were when we visited.

name: Tronchetto Camper Parking
description: This is a great location for visiting Venice! Open air parking lot for buses with a section specifically dedicated for campers. There are even electricity outlets and water faucets. It's a concrete lot but with some bushes and trees. 21 Euros for the first 12 hours and 16 Euros for the following. For 1,50 Euros there's the "people mover" train nearby that brings you straight to Piazzale Roma. Dogs are allowed (with muzzle supposedly but no one cared).

name: Parking Indipendenza
description: Free parking lot, walking distance to city, reasonably quiet. Good for 1 night.

name: Greenpark, Palermo
description: Caravan park, walking distance to city, reasonably quiet, dumping for water and toilet, good for 1 night, 2 EUR/ h, 20 EUR / day.

name: Parking in front of church, Novara
description: Parking lot in front of church, narrow access, follow signs, quiet

name: Montalto
description: parking lot with spectacular view to Mt Etna. Absolutely in the nature. Not accessible in April because of snow!

name: Diga del Menta
description: Small Parking Spot near dam wall of Diga del Menta,  200 m further down starts the trail to the waterfall (50 min one way). Beginning of April there was plenty of water. Take of your shoes to wade through the river :-)

name: Sea + mountain view
description: In front of the gate of a picknick area. Beautiful view over the mountains to the sea. Water well. Access via party bad gravel road - 4x4 recommended. But there are also some nice spots right at the beginning of dirt road.

name: Picknick Area Nicholas Green
description: Parking lot in gravel at picknick area. Toilets not to use! Starting point of hiking tour to Marmarico Falls. Restaurant in 800 m.

name: treviso
description:
free parking at 500m of the town center
30 parking fields. Some trees and shadow.  clean unless the disposal area. Not busy in the first week of September.

name: Harbour parking
description: Good for 1 night, quiet, not too idyllic. in April free of charge and totally empty. Restaurants near by.

name: Parking at beach near Le Cannella
description: For us one of the most idyllic spots around the Capo Rizzuto. Out of season empty.

name: Sosta Camping Rossano
description: Practical parking lot with dumping station and water. We parked in the corner because of the traffic noise. Restaurants in town.

name: Picknick Spot in The Woods
description: 0ne of a few parking/ picknick spot along the way to Abbazia Santa Maria del Patire

name: At the beach Scanzano Ionico
description: parking area at a nice beach, some visitors during the day, absolutely quiet during the night

name: Madonna delle vergini
description:
Grassy panorama point with great view to ancient city and gorge.  Gravel road access. 
Further places with tar road access opposite the gorge at 40°40′00.54″N 16°37′17.88″E resp.  40°39′50.01″N 16°37′03.55″E

name: Montescaglioso
description: Parking spot with nice view at edge of the village, narrow access

name: Beach parking
description: Wonderful spot on sand directly at beach, off-saison empty

name: Punta prosciutto
description: Small strip directly at the sea, off-saison empty and totally quiet.

name: Punto Pizzo
description: Parking lot at entrance of the Parco Naturale Punto Pizzo. Direct at beach,  during season bar nearby, which was not open in April. Nice walks along the coast.

name: Bagni san Filippo
description: Free parkingspots on the side of the road, wallingdistance from beautiful hot waterspring (free). Good for one night, little traffic.

name: Capanna Messapica
description: Parking in grass next to rupestrian church, hiking path nearby. Unknown whether restrooms are open all day. There was a festival when we were,  there because of the Liberation Day.

name: South of Riserva Naturale Statale di Popolamento Animale Le Cesine
description: Parking lot in the dunes, directly at sandy beach. Off season almost empty. Very quiet.

name: Grottaglie parking
description: Parking in the city, not very charming, but good for 1 night. Water tap and restaurants near by.

name: Caravan park Alberobello
description: Parking on gravel/grass between olive trees, walking distance to city. Quiet. Dumping station for toilet and gray water. Restaurants in town. 18 EUR/ 24 h.

name: Cala del Platano
description: Parking ground on gravel, directly at rocky coast. Campsite and restaurant near by.

name: Brezza tra gli ulivi
description: We were not there, but we camped 250 m away at the coast, owner came and gave us his card.

name: Castello del Monte
description: Caravan park on grass next to big parking area. Nevertheless not too bad and quiet. Walking distance to the castle. 7 EUR.

name: Picnic Spot Montenero
description: Picnic Spot in the woods, during the night absolutely quiet.

name: Foresta Umbra
description: There are a lot of picknick spots along the road. At this spot you can park a little bit off the road. Off- season the restaurant was closed, so it was not a problem to park there for the night.

name: Il Trabucco
description: Parking spot of the Trabucco restaurant. Eat there and ask owner, if you can stay overnight. Optimal place for sunset and sunrise. Great view to Pischici particularly at night. Off season we were alone during the night.

name: Caravan parking Montelupone
description: Parking next to city center, but also next to road. Traffic noise! Water tap where locals fill up there bottles. Nice restaurants in city. Dumping station.

name: Dumping Montecosaro
description: Dumping station on inclined parking lot.

name: Monte Paderna parking
description: Parking on gravel, in the nature. Walking paths to Mt Paderna with great views to the mountains. Access via small roads, especially last 10 m (!) from the road up to the parking spot steep and eroded. 7 km drive to Bologna. Quiet, no traffic at all, every now and then a plane.

name: Parking Via Sabbioni 1
description: When we entered the gate, we thought we had no chance for our camper, but 300 m to the right there was plenty of space. Nice situated in the park. Approximately 1.5 km to city center. 1.50 EUR/h. Water taps in the park. Mobile internet.

name: Via Amando Díaz
description: Parking Via Amando Díaz / Mercato, quiet at night, market on tuesday

name: Parco Enzo Ferrari
description: Free parking for camper vans with power and water (unfortunately broken), approximately 1.5 km to city center. Mobile internet.

name: Certosa monastery
description: Parking at monastery Certosa, corner for campers at the edge of a big parking area, small trees with little shade, picknick benches on grass, very quiet during the night, busy at day because of tourist busses and cars. Dumping station. Bakery, restaurants in town  less than 1 km. WLAN worse than mobile internet😏. 10 EUR per day.

name: Caronte Public Hot Spring
description: parking lot right next to a free hot water spring; also paying thermes across the street. There are some restaurants nearby.

name: Sossogna
description: beautiful forest campsite, 2 RV stands, plenty of smaller Campervan / smaller over landing vehicles. electricity, WiFi at the main house, mountain spring water, drinkable potable ... showers, Middle Eastern toilets. low mobile connection. stayed 2 nights, could hav stayed forever!!!

name: Camping Nettuno
description: Small campground in Nerano. If your up for the drive from Naples to Nerano it's worth it! Nice beaches small market. Limited wifi. Checking across road

name: Varazze small parking
description: We stayed here for One night. Two other cc with is. Is a small parking on the street. Quiet until 7 am then road traffic starts and becomes noisy. The place is literally 10 meters from sea and beaches.

name: Aqua Dolce Camp
description: Good size terraced camp ground with shaded pitches. Restaurant onsite.  Good amenities, laundry facilities. Wifi covers all campground.

name: Arsie Belkin
description: Very nice, tidy and quiet Camp ground in the eastern alps

name: Camping in Casella
description:
Quiet, nice parking area close to the village.
....

name: Stange
description: Huge parking places, close to sport/soccer field, quiet.

name: Neviglie next to Alba
description: Bar parking in a nice small village with overview 360°.

name: Camping Smeralda
description: Beautiful location with parking available right next to the water. Full facilities available and a great restaurant on site. Challenging to navigate a big rig in and out but it is possible. Max height allowed is 3.2m due to a tunnel just before the camping.

name: Parking Lot
description: Grassy parking lot. A bit dirty. Pay for parking during the day, stay at night for free. Free cold shower and drinking water on the beach. A lot of noise from trains really nearby. Nice view of the sea. Acceptable for 1 night.

name: View over lake
description: Drive to the end of this tarred road(GPS point not 100% accurate). Quiet spot with picnic table and bench and an incredible view. Odd runners came past in the morning and evening but otherwise quiet. The road up is narrow with many switchbacks, but our Landcruiser got up easily.

name: koshner
description:
dump station not free.
you can full out the wc

name: dump station
description: dump station for 12€ personne 30 minutes.

name: Van Parking Space Sauris
description:
Unbelievable but true: It doesn't cost nothing but you get a toilet, shower, electricity and water on the first two terraces. Above there are more terraces without electricity. Water is in the Bathroom at the corner of the nearby building. The place is run by the company Wolf next to it who is maybe interested in Tourists buying their ham and sausage (but I'm vegan, haha!)
In high season it might be full or nearly full but maybe you find a place anyway.

name: Punta Sabbioni
description:
Closed over winter

Punta Sabbioni is quite a good start to visit Venice. It's an official place for about 30 camper. It costs 20-23 EUR for 2 persons and one van, electricity is 3 EUR extra. The strand is quite near. Also quite near is the public ship to Venice which departes every 30 minutes.

name: Parco Salmagina. Caravan parking
description:
1 km from downtown of Staffolo, this park is prefect for resting. A quiet place close enough from the supermarket. Thursday morning there is a market inside the walls.
There is a bbq, table and drinking water fountain

name: La Calcina
description:
Ein wunderschönes Hotel am Canal de Grande!
Das Essen war perfekt

name: Valtremontina Camping
description:
Nice campground. Beside river in the mountains. 
Almost no one here end of August. Closing 17.09.

name: Closed on Wednesday and Saturday
description:
This route is closed for cars every wednesday and saturday from 09:00 Am till 05:00 Pm
Motorbikes are allowed

name: NewHostel
description: Hostel...central Florence near train station

name: Villa Barbaro
description: Parking lot of "villa barbaro". A museum with wine shop. you can spend the night here for free. Calm parking in a dead end street with some trees for shade. Probably best to come after closing time and leave before opening time as to not spoil this place. It is open every day except Monday from 10:00 to 18:00

name: Close to Livigno
description: There is a little man-made hill right next to the road, you can drive behind it and be fully out of sight, the track continues trough the river - don't know where but we did not see any other people. Little fast flowing (some noise..) stream. Beautiful Alp towering above you. Convenient stopover on your way to/from Livigno or Stelvio

name: Hot showers
description: 0,5 euro for a hot shower. Clean and modern. Free hairdryer. It is the wooden cabin behind the bus stop. Free wifi too

name: Pineto Beach Camping
description: Big Campground directly at the Beach. Big Pool. A little noice of the trains passing by. Good for a few days relaxing. We paid 17 Euro for a camper and 2 Persons.

name: San Biagio (Argenta)
description:
Halfway from Ferrara to Ravenna on the SS16 just south of Argenta.  
Small parking lot in residential area, not too much traffic at night. 
Suitable for night stop with dining out: Bar Ristorante "Da Poldo" (literally next door) and Pizzeria "Nuovo Meister" (1 minute walk).

name: Parking close to Macari
description: Big parking, close to the beach and park , quite a lot of campers using it .

name: park lot Freilichtmuseum
description:
park lot for just over night

gravel almost even

name: Agricamping Il Colono in Pomarance
description: Nice,lovely and quite campsite in the olivetrees and view of landscape. Rates 16 euros/day(Camper and 2pers.) 2.5 euros electricity/day

name: Pietra di Bismanova in Castelnovo ne'Monti
description: Beautiful place in the rocks with great view. Parkingarea. Rockclimbing and walkings.

name: Baia-Verde
description: Quiet place in the low season. Open from early March to mid-October. Has supermarket, restaurant, butcher, bakery. In low season free place choice in a pine forest located on a beautiful sandy beach.

name: Fiume Trebbia
description: Discreet place not far from the road, near a river.

name: Small forest green ground

Good public toilets available at the transport hub.

parking piscine gratuit WC et eau potable dans le jardin public à 150 m 500 m du centre ville
car Park municipal pool free restrooms And drinking water 150 m public gardent 500 m down town

description:
Very big camper parking parking in Bobbio. Open all year, 10 Euro per 24 hours, paying machine on site. 
Quiet place, but don't park too far on the south side, the truck company directly next to the parking has a lot of dogs that love to bark at everything that moves.

name: Michele Autuori  Shipping Office
description: Receiving company when we shipped from Egypt. Located near the port area, but gate is next to roundabout at SW corner of port.  Paid 141.10 euros to receive. +39 089 230332 agency@autuori.it

description: entry point for retrieving car. Once inside, go to Salerno Auto Transport office, just to left of gate

description: Nice car park next to tiny harbour and beach. Probably busy in summer but was near deserted in January. There is probably water available if you ask at the fishing places. Fish for sale if the boats are out.

description: Nice view on this established camping full of caravan & campers (I’m the only rooftoptenter). All commodities (supermarket, swimming pool, WiFi (3€/day), kids area). Lots of trees even if there is no separation between the places.

name: Espresso hotel
description: Nice basic hotel with secure parking that can take big vehicle. Nice location

description: Official RV park. Provide water and electricity. But you need RV type plug to use that.

description: Parking place of these Castle with view on these Castle and mountains

description: parking place with great view at thé voeder of a smalle town

description: verry clean camping place with vertrek nice views over the mountains of the Parco Nazionale de Monte Sibillini. We paid 21 euro die 2 persons and big camper. Village with shop on walking distance.

name: Angeli Azienda Agraria
description: biologische cheesemaker, there is a smalle shop where you van nut all sports of cheese and fresh ricotta. We stoppen here die lunch.

name: Pie ze
description: It’s a free parking. Silence place to sleep. No water and power!

name: Next to the established cam ground
description:
Haha. Perfect site to camp a few days. Just don’t sit in front of the van and show that you’re staying overnight. But a good basecamp for Mont Blanc and all the other beautiful mountains and trails.
There are some boulders on a meadow behind the campground. Pizza place is next to the other camp ground on the other side of the river

name: Senigallia
description:
Camperparking, 5 min walk grom thé beachclub and grom shops. Verry noisy (road AND train) bit safe spot. 10 euro for 24 hours. Good spot if you have toch wait for the f
ferry in ancona

name: Night before the ferry
description: Exit the roundabout offroad on the westside into the bushes to find a hidden spot within the vegetation. The site is a lot more quiet and green than the nearby concrete parking lot at the ferry port. As the track leading away from the roundabout is soft and sandy, I recommmend using it with a 4x4 only. A small bistro/restaurant is within walking distance.

name: Fordside camp
description: 50 meters from the street you can camp behind trees.

name: Rena Majore Beach
description: Parking directly at the wonderful beach, nice scenery, absolutely quiet. Nice walks through the dunes. Free between Jun 15- Sep 15. No beach bars and facilities off season, but we were accompanied by some other campers. Mobile internet.

name: Beach Paradiese at Spiaggia Sa Curcurica
description:
Wonderful spot directly at the beach with view over sea and mountains. Off-season absolutely quiet at night. 1st night we chose a spot at the cliff (end of road, no shade), next night we hid between some trees. Follow the tarred road to the parking lot (40.451361, 9.794175) and then the dirt road. Mobile internet. Beach bars some 500 m south were not open in April. Big rigs can camp at the parking lot. 
In High season from 1.6. to 31.08. parking fee per day 5 €

name: Lago Endine
description: Just a small space near the road on the quiet side of the lake. Good to stop for a night. No signs saying that you cannot stop. Adjacent is a plot of land with a ramp but the terrain is a bit soft and ideal for smaller vehicles or 4x4. Quite difficult to find a spot in this area. Spent the night here without problems.

name: Archeopark Parking
description: Ample free parking near Archeopark. Two ways of getting here. Best access is from the north because the road is wider and easier. From the south there is a small winding road and also a short tunnel that passes under the main road. We still managed to pass from the south route with an L3H2 Peugeot Boxer.

name: La Marinedda Beach
description:
In the dunes north of la Marinedda Beach you will find some pull-outs next to the dirt road. Absolutely remote and quiet, very scenic, nice walks through the macchia and rocky landscape to the peninsula north of here. Mobile internet. 
Big rigs can park at 41°00′58.13″N 08°53′21.72″E on a parking lot. At both spots it’s not forbidden to stand for a night, but as all wild camps on Sardinia we would recommend these places only off season.

name: Well in Tempio Pausania
description: Fountain with potable water. Big parking lot in front. We saw local people tap the water here.

name: Agriurismo muto del gallura
description: Excellent Sardinian food with friendly service. If you have dinner there, they allow you to stay on their parking lot for the night. Free.

name: Castel Doria
description: Parking lot at Castel Doria, absolutely quiet, nice view over the mountains. Mobile internet. Free.

name: Monte Colmo
description: Parking near a helipad :) A rest / bbq area on the way up Monte Colmo with an amazing view. Altitude 1550m above sea level. A long way up but worth the drive!! Various walking trails start from this point.

name: Parcheggio Spiaggia Rena Majori
description: Great view over sea and hills from this parking lot. Access to the beach. Off season absolutely remote and quiet. No prohibitions. Mobile internet. Free. Narrow access not suitable for big rigs.

name: In the Woods
description: Nice parking lot in the woods. Remote, quiet, free. We were here during the day, but found it a wonderful spot for a night.

name: Picnic spot at Chiesa di San Maurizio
description:
Picnic spot in the mountains, tables under shady trees. Fantastic view. Mobile 3G internet. Water taps, but no water, when we were here. Steep and narrow 1-lane concrete access road. No problem for our 4x4 Ford Ranger. 
There is a big house near by (accommodation?) with a fire pit and an outdoor kitchen sink, but the water was not running and everything was closed, nobody there off season.

name: Well Ittiri
description: Potable water opposite of the gas station. Locals filled up water there.

name: Novate Mezzola
description: A piece of flat land with grass by the lake. Ample space and you can walk by the lake. A bit busy on weekends but weekdays are much calmer. One of the best spots we found in the area.

name: Marina di Torre del Lago
description: A street along the beach with numerous parking lot. if you are not too big (maxi 6m) you pay 10 for the day and 5 for the night.

name: Spiaggia di Torregrande
description: Large flat area along the beach. Off season all the beach bars were closed and only 2 other campers stood there for the night. Very quiet. Free. Mobile internet.

name: Spiaggia di Gutturu Flumini
description: Wonderful spot at the coast in the dunes. When we passed by, 5-6 other campers stood there and we decided to join them. Some officials passed by, but off season it was no problem to park there for a night. Access was out-washed. 4x4 and high clearance recommended. We saw a 2x2 camper getting stuck. Respect the nature and do not drive off-road! Free. Mobile internet.

name: Nuraghe la Prisgiona, Sardinien
description: Parkinglot near Thema entrance ans Ticketoffice. Shadow from the trees.

name: Biella parcheggio
description: Just Free park. No energy, water. Quiet and security

name: Potable well beside the road.
description: Very tasty fresh water. Local people fill up water there. Attention: local people told us , that the well at 39.54958, 8.590819 , one kilometer from here is not drinkable!

name: Sunset spot at Spiaggia Scivu
description: Flat wide parking area on top of the cliff at Spiaggia Scivu. Beach surrounded by green hills and red cliffs, beautiful! Ideal place for sun set. Wonderful landscape on your way down from SS126. Off season no beach bar, free. Mobile internet. Waste bins.

name: Parking near the castle
description:
It is a parking place.
Nice view (castle and village) 
Playground for children.
Water available
Very quiet.

name: St Andrea Prio
description: Quiete Parking Lot near the Office, fresh drinking water. Toilette and Shop, smal Restaurant at the Ticketoffice.

name: Arena communale staranzano
description: Free camper parking next to sports centre and camper club parking.  1€/3h electricity - 2€/100 L water.

name: Conegliano
description: Perfect campsite to visit Conegliano. Cheap (12 €)

name: Camping a Lago
description: Pure Nature, clean sanitaries, Pool, Lake and a lot of shadow

name: Cala Sinzias
description: Parking lot at the sandy beach, Restaurant

name: Marina de Orosei
description: Parkinglot near (200m) the sandy Beach,  at this time no Restriktion. Restaurant.

name: San Giovanni
description: Close time Beach, parkinglot ans Restaurant

name: Agriturismo S’Ortu Mannu
description: Agriturismo with Sardinian food slightly above the Olive Orchard S’Ortu Mannu. After dinner you can park there for the night. Ask the owners. Dinner was a 4-course menu with 5(!) different plates as a starter, ravioli, kid stew and pastries as dessert. 30 EUR including wine and digestive. Excellent! Mobile internet. Free.

name: End of Martell valley
description:
Parkinglot surrounded by Mountains.
Starting point of many hiking treks.
The Place is a big,leveled parking lot .
a clean,open and cost free toilet is included.
very tranquil at pre saison.
Attention: you have to pay 10.- euros per camperday at the parking fee machine.
The road to this "end of valley" only for Campers below 3.5t and 22% going up....

name: Torrette di Fano
description:
Camping Stella Maris
At the beach, Pool, restrooms, free wifi. "loud due to the nearby train. Prices can be found at http://www.campingstellamaris.it/en/" .

name: Parcheggio Monte Baldo
description: A section of the big parking closest to the old town is reserved for motorhomes. 1 service station for campers to empty water tank and chemical toilet. Paying toilet on the parking, closed at night. No other facilities. Sirmione is less crowded in the evening when the day tourists are gone. 21€/24h

description:
An informal, silent and comfortable stop for a maximum of 2 campers. In the heart of the Ligurian hinterland of Levante, just half an hour from the beaches of Tigullio. 
10 km from the Chiavari motorway exit and 8 km from the Lavagna motorway exit.
Private property:
For reservations and availability please contact via whatsapp Gabriella:
0039 3313880678

name: Chapel campsite
description: Peaceful place up the mountain, end of paved road. An Offroad Trail continues up and brings you to a beautiful Gras valley. Campsite provides flat ground, wooded Picknick tables and a designated fire spot. Beautiful views!

name: Magneti Marelli
description: Very very very nice guy. Mega helpful. Changed my bike tyre here and he did not charge us money.

name: Campeggio Obelisco

name: Chianocco - Grangia
description: Campersite next to wild steam. Campfire, water, dump station, shady. Shops nearby, good place to recover from long trip. Max height 3.70m !

description: Beautiful and large campground at the beach, large and clean bathrooms, pool, free wifi, close to the shopping mile with lots of restaurants. The rates depend on the season.

name: parkinglot next to football field

name: Vacanze

MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

for check-in writer at maurizio.guelfo@gmail.com

name: Alpine stream camp

name: Informal campsite at the sea
description:
Informal campsite with a lot of place for campers, tents, of rooftents. In the front there is a parking for people who come to swim in the front is the camperplace. 
There is water, a toilet, showers. The sea is a few meters away.

name: au bord de la rivière
description: Nice spot by the river, fire possible. Road nearby but not very busy in the evening and at night.

name: Mottarone
description:
beautiful camp overlooking Lake Orta and Lake Maggiore. More than fifteen places. Toll of 8 euros to access this private road but it's worth it! possible hikes

name: il Cavallone
description:
Camping on the farm in an olive grove with views of the hills and town below. Grape vines, horses, chickens, goats, dogs, etc. Friendly Francesco has his wine and olive oil for sale and will cook a great Tuscan dinner, shared over a long outdoor table with other guests and friends. Stayed one night with motorcycle and tent and with the dinner, served at 8:00 and Includes wine, was charged 24€. Worth every penny!

Water, toilet, shower is basic but fine. Walk to train for Florence, Pisa or Sienna. *Very steep hill* 20% grade.

It's peaceful, free and an authentic Tuscan experience... so please support Francesco by having dinner or purchasing something. 

Push button on main gate to open. If he's not at the farmhouse, just continue past and to the right to park under the olives on flat ground.

name: parking lot falzaragopass

name: parking lot in a wonderful region

name: Riverbed camp
description:
Enter riverbed from the east on your right of sp263 just before bridge. Look for gap in guard rail.
Park just of road and check that track is not to steep if you have bigish rig. Track was gravel and in good condition when we were there.
Drive down and under bridge. Not visible from road. Quite at night.
Water available from pipe under bridge (probably not potable).

name: Longobucco car park.
description: Public car park beside creek, lower edge of village. Spent a week here waiting for vehicle part. You will need your own toilet. Locals friendly.

name: Mountain View.
description: Car park for view point and walk, quiet, other picnic spots nearby. Beautiful forest area cool on hot days. In the night you will have a view of the lights from a distant city. Very peacefull and beautiful.

name: Piano Grande view.
description: Spectacular view of valley high on a ridge, flat car park also below at old ski lift site for less adventurous or if it's windy.

name: Frassino

Nice official camper place in the mountains. About 8 camper can have nice stay. 5 euro a night (parking fee), clean toilets, water and gray water dump.
Wonderfull restaurant 3 minutes walk with very good itian food and service ( risto bar spada reale).

au milieu des vignes un terrain plat non cultivé

Via Florentina Pâte fraîche Gnocchi et Ravioli et petits fours excellents

name: Lago Alto del Flumendosa

name: Segway Tours Meran, Winterpromenade 23
description: Here you can book a nice segway tour. Different Tours with guides

name: Picnic area
description: Very nice Picknick area with nice, twisty road. You can start several hiking or Mountainbike tours from that place. You do have Picknick tables and a lot of shade. Very nice spot to get away from the busy coast.

name: fossacesia marina
description:
it is a camper stop on the beach.
all services. 10€ out of season for 2+motorhome. +3€ if you need electricity. 14€ in season. very quiet. easy for big rigs

name: lago del turano
description: it is the parking of a picnic place. wonderful view on the lake and mountain. out of season very quiet. no services. fit big rigs.

name: The Beach (la Spiaggia) - Desenzano Del Garda
description:
So here we have a no frills little camp site RIGHT NEXT TO GARDA! It’s €15 for 24 hrs as a flat rate which is awesome because if you arrive late you don’t then have to leave at 11 the next day. You also don’t have to pay per adult or any of that crap. 

The guy that runs it is super friendly and if you pull up to the barrier he will let you in and show you where to park. 

The pitches aren’t huge but certainly enough to set up your awning etc.

There is a pizzeria right next door which I would totally recommend, it’s cheap and the pizza is molto bene!

The location is great because you’re right next to the lake but you will need to cycle about 10/15 minutes into town or get a quick bus/taxi (there are loads) down the road. This means it’s great to access the rest of the lake if you spend a day exploring.

Toilet and shower facilities were nothing incredible but totally acceptable (especially for the cheap price) and it has waste disposal + fresh water etc.

There is free WiFi available in a shelter by reception which is pretty decent but it likely won’t stretch to the rest of the site.

All in all I would definitely come again and totally recommend as a cheap way to stay and explore beautiful Garda!

name: Pietrasanta
description: This is a big Parking lot by the Supermarket COOP, with some shady Trees

name: Desulo Su Filariu

Very nice place for one week nearby Palermo. 15min with the train.
Friendly and helpful staff.

name: parking lot next to a climbing wall
description: nice place in cavalese free parking lot close to the climbing ealls. the city is close and the people are friendly good place to stay

description: a little village and next to the helicopter landingplace is a big parkingöot where you can overnight. no one cares...the street is quite at night...there are some fountains in the village and a small river beside. perfekt to sleep befor climbing next day

name: parking close to the aguila wall climbing

name: Pay for services or don’t for free.
description: 10 paid spots in a gate with paid services 50 cents an hour. Or park outside the gate in a large parking lot for free. We arrived in October at 4:30 and the paid lot was full and when we woke in the morning the free lot was as well, so a popular place. As long as there’s space you can pull in and use the dump and water and pull back out. No lake view but quiet.

name: Milano dead end
description: A dead end street next to a park in a good neighborhood. 5 minutes walk to two metro stations and ten minutes to the duomo on the metro. Free Sundays but 2 euros an hour other days between 8 and 7, like most of Milan. We paid but we noticed no one else seemed to. Also free neighborhood WiFi. We spent two worrifree nights here. Carrefour market two blocks away, short walk to Isola.

name: Mantova
description: Free spot in front of a big park, no facilities. Good for big trucks.

name: Old fort
description:
An old WW1 fort now in disarray.
can be accessed only using an off-road track.
Near a river, but in a very quiet spot because the track is almost never used (there is a tarmac road nearby)

name: Porto Pollo
description: Camper place / Parking for kitesurfing and beach live. Between 1 July and 1 September you have to pay around €18,- during the day. Between 20.00 and 08.00 it’s free of charge. Off season free 24/7

name: Forrest between the Wine Fields
description: This is a wild camping location just for tents. There is no possibility to park any car. So just for hikers and travelbikers. Its directly in the small forest (pictures).

name: nice parking next to ederacave
description: nice big parkinglot where you can get to the ederacave. there is a info of all the climbing and hiking in the region 10 meters down zhe road

name: parkinglot near dry river
description: nice parking lot where a lot of overlanders overnight. there is a lot of space. its close to the street but it didnt bothered us at night it was quite.

name: nice place woth a view
description: just before you come to this curve there is a parkinglot where you can sleep. its quite big...there is a fountain up in the little village and the climbing spots are close to it. perfect view over the sea

name: Lozzole
description: for 4x4 only! water free. very outdoor place

name: Near train line between Luca and Pisa
description: Parking lot next to sports fields in San Giuliano, a small town about halfway between Lucca and Pisa. It’s a quiet parking lot overnight and near the main road.  We stayed here to avoid seedy Pisa, there are so many bad reviews about people being broken into and we didn’t want to drive around aimlessly hoping to find somewhere we felt confident. 5 minute walk to the station. To Pisa it’s 10 minutes and €1.50 I imagine it’s not much longer to Lucca.

name: Large parking lot in Pistoia
description: Loads of campervans here as it’s advertised as such. There’s a dump and water in the small lot across the road (where the photo is taken). Less than ten minutes off the A11 on big roads. Big playground in the park next to the lot. We just used it as an overnight so not sure about convenience to town.

name: Parking Di Monte Sant’Angelo
description: A parking next to the sea. Only free to the low season. It’s very hard to find a good place on this coast.

name: Quiet parking
description: A quiet place with water and grass. You can do all with walk... Supermarket, bar, restaurants, and the beautifull village.

name: Monster Park overnight
description: Nice parking lot with a view. You can’t park overnight at the Monster Park’s lot so this one is just above next to the town. Nice playground next to it as well. No amenities just a lot.

name: villa franceschini
description:
hostel well organized , 66 beds , open all year, the crew is very polite and the cook is great with tipical dishes from lazio region here you can became spoiled.
it is a good base camp ,if have got a veichle , to visit Rome and gran sasso national park because is in between, or discover the unknown valle reatina valley  where san Francis in the past (1200) invented the nativity. Also Terminillo mountain have lot of activity inside.

name: IPM parking lot
description: 24 hour guarded parking lot in Naples. Good spot. 15 minute walk to the metro but we walked into town as it took about 20 minutes downhill. 22 euros for 24 hours is expensive but as we read about people losing everything right down to their underpants we chose the safe option. You can plug in (same price for not plugging in). Dump and fresh water.

name: Lido Urlamare Saline
description:
in the after season quiet place at the sea, steep descent but attached, great view of the lighthouse and coast
in der nach Saison ruhiger Platz am Meer, steile Abfahrt aber befestigt , toller Blick auf Leuchtturm und Küste

name: Parking lot is residential area- free
description: Free parking lot in a residential neighborhood, about 15 minutes walk into town. No services. There were a few parked here so it’s a known spot. Park nearby and a poorly stocked grocery store.

name: Brunnen
description:
Fountain on the street, locals come to get water
Brunnen an der Straße,einheimische kommen um Wasser zu holen

name: Harbor side in Cefalù
description: Nice spot in the harbor. Park in the white spaces not yellow. Apparently you can continue on and park in front of the coast guard as well. Short walk into town. Restaurant in harbor, small bit of sandy that our son played in but a big sandy beach in town.

name: (camper)parking Reggio Emilia
description: There is a large parking for campers here. We just slept here one night. The pizza place across the street is an absolute recommendation! (Pizzeria da Gabrielle)

name: Sicilian outlets
description: Popular spot for overnighting, at least twenty others here in December! Park at the far end (near Gucci, P3). No services, but there is a two if you just need a little water. Playgrounds either end of center though a much bigger one on the opposite end. WiFi available in the outlets.

name: Free marina parking
description: Free parking at the marina, large parking lot. Ten minute walk into the old town. No shade. Tap at the entrance but slow and not really useable.

name: Free beach side
description: Free along a sandy beach. The beach is dirty in the winter and the little town is abandoned but I imagine in the summer it lives up. Views of mount Etna and Cantana. Parking on the large tar lot at the beginning or a small lot at the end. Don’t follow google maps directions or it will take you round about for some reason, look at the map and use common sense.

name: Parcheggio Piazza Nassiriya
description:
Official motorhome and tour bus parking lot right next ti the river.
Good views over town and castle and the pedestrian bridge takes you straight in to the town. Secure and lighted ar night.
Can be very busy in peak season
Pizza joint on other side of the bridge plus many other restaurants and bars

name: Official Parking for RV and Campers
description: Very nice Place at The Lake but near the Road! Visible from the Road!

name: Cameroon embassy
description: Applied here for a 1 month touristic visa, usually it takes 2 working days, but I collected it the same day in the afternoon. 2 pictures and the name of a hotel in Cameroon, price 100€

name: Grotta su Marmura
description: Parkingarea near the Grotta  de Marmura and the Restaurant. Good View, quiet, Toilette at the Restaurant.

name: Montopoli di Sabina camping.
description: Municipal campsite. Free. Toilets available two levels up from camping area.

name: Fort Rocca Livernano
description: Very cool place in an old destroyed Fort in Italy

name: La Jolie Bergere
description:
Hotel located at the end of a main road, great starting point for walks and bike tours. The valley is amazing. 
Restaurant with great food, local cuisine. 
There is a parking lot near by, not sure can be used for bivouac overnight stay

name: Planaval
description: Wild camp area just after the Hotel next to the river

name: Lago d‘elio
description:
Parking in front of the reservoir, overlooking Lake Maggiore, a lot of wind in our time but a fantastic view of Lake Maggiore

Parkplatz vor dem Stausee, Blick auf Lago Maggiore, sehr viel Wind zu unserer Zeit aber ein fantastischer Blick auf den Lago Maggiore

name: B&B Giardino dei Suoni
description:
Beautiful B&B run by a really nice couple (Claudia & Salvatore) and Claudia's mum. Located in the (very big) family house, the B&B has its quarter with its own rooms (with bathrooms), own kitchen and own outside area. Everything is super clean and the inside decoration is simple and beautiful. Claudia & Salvatore are musicians so there is a lot of instruments around. They will help you with everything they can... And even more. They come and take breakfast with you in the morning, lots of choices, breads, jams, cereals, biscuits... It's even hard to choose. They add special things sometimes.
You will have an amazing stay here.
The double room + breakfast cost 50€ for 2.

name: Parking lot next to Outlet Mall
description: There is a parking lot for campers next to the Designer Outlet Mall in Seravalle. Electricity is available on the lots. Toilets and Wifi available at the mall durin opening hours.

name: Scenic spot by the beginning of Via Varda
description: Place for a few cars. No signs like no entry, camping forbidden, no parking - so you are able to camp here with you cars. A few pensions around but in the place you are hardly too be seen. This is starting place for walking trails so there can be a few passersby. And the view is superb cause you are a little bit above valley.

name: Campogalliano Modena
description: Informal campsite in the garden of moto rider. Facilities include hot shower and covered parking for moto only. Contact for availability and pricing. I paid €5 per night in March 2019. Cafe bar with WiFi 50 metres away. Recommended

name: on top of the cliffs
description: one night stay was no problem. Ground is hard and rocky, but flat and close to the cliffs. very nice views and sunset. Locals come to fish here.

name: Camping Il Melo
description:
Nice little campsite. Open very early in the season. Flat areas to park your vehicle. You can use a barbecue with coals and have a nice warming fire at night. 

Amenities are basic, but clean. Good place to stay a night an drive on to the next destination. One night, car with rooftoptent and 2 persons for about € 14,-.

name: camp by the river
description:
Nice big open camp with shade and fire pit. Check pictures. (Be sure to add as much helpful information as possible, please)

use the street ss125. after a bridge (at km 45) there is a sign for a hotel (sant angelo, it is closed). follow the sign on a gravel road going down. follow this road for about 6km.

name: Area Camper Kartodromo
description: Great site with all amenities and a free shuttle to Matera via the host Gianfranco who is a fount of local knowledge. It is the site above the Gokart track and below the restaurant, don't confuse it with another site about 100 metres along the road.

name: Garbagna
description:
Nice, family run, campground. the campground is spread over a terraced area, so not to good for big rigs. We stayed for a couple of nights. It is very quiet and tranquil (there where no other gasts, we happened to come in on the first day of the season). 

Clean amenities and plenty of hot water.

Very friendly staff and owner. The town's centre is about 15 minutes walk away.

We paid € 18,- a night including power (with ACSI card).

name: Ai Linchi
description:
Agrotourismo. € 25,- rooftoptent + car and 2 persons (€ 30,- for camper). including WiFi, very clean amenities, hot showers, fridge and freezer, common room, grill, electricity.

Nice quiet site, situated near Lucca. Warm welcome from the host. Continental breakfast is around € 6,-. There is also the possibility to have dinner (you need a reservation). A bottle of the house wine (own produce) was €7,-.

3 toilets each for woman and men and only 4 showers is too little for approx. 60 places. The lots are very small.

name: Ippocamper
description: Small campers top with 20 spaces, some under roof. Shuttle service into town €1 per person each way. All facilities and washing machine. Very friendly owners and open all year.

name: Agricamping Stone Vesuvio, Ercolano
description: Small secure campsite 20 mins walk from Herculaneum Archeological site. Very new with great facilities and excellent security. Owner will drive you to top of Vesuvius. 15 mins walk to main Street for shopping and restaurants. Ring from gate for access. Owners son Giovanni speaks a little English and Spanish.

name: San Lázzaro Agerola camping beata
description:
Good camping, good kitchen € 15 2 people, a shop, 2 motorbikes
Clean services and friendly people.

name: Est exit town ni
description:
Pentanure a small village has parking without service.  capital of asparagus --- Pentanure un petit bourg parking désaffecté tranquille Pentanure a small village an ils parking without service
capitale de l'asperge asparagus

name: Kastelruth / Castelrotto
description:
Campervan Site behind restaurant „Sporthütte“. Quite place with nice Mountain view and hiking possibilities. 
Free of charge but restaurant visit required. Electricity 5 € / day. Fresh water and dump station 4 €.
Restaurant closed at the time of our visit.

name: Parking Villa Costanza
description:
Parking for 24 hr:  10 euro for campervan, and 7 euro for a car. tramway station at 50 meters to the City center for 1,50 euros. Great to visit the city !

Parking 10 euros les 24h et tram à coté pour le centre pour 1,50 euros en 30 minutes. Idéal pour visiter la ville !

name: Etruria Camping
description:
One of the most beautiful camping i have never seen. A lot of threes, playground for the kids, swimming-pool and the sea at 100 meters.

Un des plus beau camping que je connaisse, sous les pins, place de jeux pour les enfants, piscine, magasins, resto et la mer à 100 mètres !

name: Torre de Corsari, Sardinia
description: Overlook completely isolated in the scrubland, above the sea. Access exclusively by 4x4.  Magnificent !

name: Corte Finiletto Agricamping
description: About 10 pitches, very close to the Strada Bresciana. A little bit noisy, but clean, safe and near to the busstop to town.

name: Lago di Mulargia, Sardinia
description:
Dead end path, with water front, left, and right . extremity of a small peninsula, gravel path.
Place for 2 or 3 cars, not more. Easy about turn,
Beatiful, calm and isolated, early May 2019, we are alone.

name: Monte Minniminni, Sardinia
description:
Place for 1 small cc between trees, at the foot of the TV antenna Monte Minniminni in Sardinia.  located on the ridge, fantastic panorama from 2 sides.  Shadow and sun well distributed.  The arrival from the southwest is only in 4x4, and from Castiades north-northeast, the track is shorter and easier.
Leave the place blank, there is not even a butt ...
Do not fire, risk of fire.
Very nice bivouac, also good for Trails type motorcycles.
Enjoy, respect, protect, nature give it back to you.

name: Parking at 1km of the city
description:
[ADMIN] Note that wild camping is generally illegal in Italy.

Free parking with nothing but really much better than the area of camping car at 200m.

name: Perfect place at 20 m of the sea
description: it's the end of the road, we stay at 20 m of the sea for the night.

name: Camping Val del Lago
description:
Nice old school camping at the lake. Really pretty, a little noise from the road. If this one is full there is another camping 100m down the road.
Paid 30€ for our l van and a family of four. Restaurant on site.

name: Cornaré
description:
If your want to disconnect of the travel and stay on idyllic place in the deep field side, sharing with a amazing family and the farm animals, this is your place.  

You can choose to stay in the family house’s, in your overlander, or in a private cabin, even you can camp (but you have to ask first). 

Watch out the RVs, to arrived to the house the road is gravel and narrow. 

You need to call to Enrico before to arrive to check availability!!! 

For motorcycles, you have workshop and tools to work on it. 100% recommendable, I was stay almost one week here!!! 

For contact to Enrico calls or Whatsapp at ‭+39 339 7203273‬

name: Conaré
description:
If your want to disconnect of the travel and stay on idyllic place in the deep field side, sharing with a amazing family and the farm animals.

You can choose to stay in the family house’s, in your overlander, or in a private cabin, even you can camp (but you have to ask first). 

Watch out the RVs, to arrived to the house the road is gravel and narrow. You need to call to Enrico before to arrive to check availability!!! 

For motorcycles, you have workshop and tools to work on it. 

100% recommendable, I was stay almost one week here!!! 

For contact to Enrico calls or Whatsapp at ‭+39 339 7203273‬

name: Is Arrutas Seaside camping
description:
There are three basic campgrounds right next to the sea. 
Water and toilets and perhaps electricity in the summer. Open and free in the off season.

name: water
description:
small water tab for refilling
located near beach

name: Pistis parking
description:
Nice Place on cliffs on a gravel parking space. Reachable for vans and RV shorter than 7m. Access to stoney beach over steep steps. 

Schöner Platz an den Klippen mit zugang zum Kiesstrand über treppen. Platz groß genug für 5-6 womos. Schotter. Zufahrt für grosse Mobile schwierig wegen Bodenfreiheit

name: Camping Montiggl
description:
On the campsite with 80 pitches - you will find a restaurant, cafe, pizzeria and a well sorted shop. Free WiFi on all pitches, fresh drinking water and waste water connection, free entry to our natural swimming pool, new sanitary facilities, playground for  little guest. Power connection with CEE plug  from 16Ampere/3,3kwh to 32Ampere/6,6kwh. The power will be charged with 0,70 €/kwh.
Local Tax: on departure we charge 0,85 € per person/day. Children under 14 are exempt from the tax. 
Immerse yourself in an idyllic world where the stresses of everyday life pale into insignificance.
Between forest, very closed to the two Montiggl lakes, starting point for countless hikes and bike rides.

name: Near Capo Pecora
description: This year the fine places directly at the capo have been closeby barriers and no camping signs over all. This place is located at the street a little up the hills with no signs. Wonderful view but can be crowded until noon and the last day visitor left the Capo.

name: Agricamper La GIULIANA
description: Family run farm camping. View of Mt Vesuvius from the site. Super friendly family. Lady of the house, Giovanna, speaks English. Electricity, water, warm showers, toilets and washing area (but for the number of Campers not enough). €25 for one Car, 2 persons

name: Toes into water
description: Wonderful place with toes close to water under Pine trees. At the end of a sealed road Place for 5~7 Campervans. Wonderful view and quiet.

name: Piscinas beach parking
description: Free parking overnight. Not really a nice spot but piscinas beach is worth visiting and this place is near the beach.

name: Verdrogno
description:
Fantastic view of Lake Como, narrow gravel road through the forest, 4x4 is not necessary but ground clearance is recommended.

Fantastischer Blick auf den Comer See, enge Schotterstraße durch den Wald, 4x4 ist nicht nötig aber bodenfreiheit empfehlenswert.

name: Wild camp in Tuscan hills
description: Grassy area off a gravel road. Stunning views over Tuscany. Access is off the gravel road to the right. it is difficult in wet weather as it can be muddy, 4x4 essential. If you follow the track it opens to a grassy area big enough for 3 or 4 vehicles.

name: Castellina in Chianti
description: RV parking area with free electric, has pay toilet and dump station. At the entrance of the small historical town. 12 Euro/night

name: B&B La Tartaruga
description: B&B close to Milan. Secured parking. Breakfast included. 39€ /night (1 pers). Nice people.wifi ok.

name: Camp Olivella
description:
Small campsite, with clean sanitaire, next to lake Iseo. The owner family is very friendly 
Big rigs are welcome.

name: Free roadside parking, 5 terra
description:
Free road side parking near a park. 2 free parking lots and road side parking on the road perpendicular to it. All are busy, arrive as early as possible.

20min walk to La Spezia train station. 
Water tap in park, no other facilities. No tents. Long vehicles will struggle.

name: Lampezia
description:
A nice place for the night. Between the sea and the railroad track. At this point, the trains run through a tunnel so, no noise. No services except local bar 150 m south. Beautiful view of the sea and plenty of beach to walk on.
Another location exists for the moment, about 1 km north of this location but, is exposed to train noise and the fact that erosion is taking out the parking area. It is sliding into the sea. Getting tight to turn around. This area is also being used by the locals as a garbage dump and toilet.

name: Free car park near centre
description: Only free car spot near centre we found where camping is allowed. On a side street near a farm and some housing. No facilities, okay view and 20min walk to centre.

name: Camping A Bunda
description: Ok place for a night, room for 10 RVs and or tents, terraced pitches, we paid $22 for 2 people, 1 tent, 1 space. expensive for what you get, clean toilets. wifi but we never got the password as no one is here after 7pm.

name: Alpe di Colono
description:
Beautiful place with partly view of the lake, bottleneck with 2.4m, protective hood with catering.

Schöner Platz mit teilweise Blick auf den See, Engstelle mit 2,4m, Schutzhütte mit Verpflegung.

name: Agriturismo Ruspina
description:
Comfortable farm-hostel with bedrooms for 2 to 6 people. Bathroom and toilet in each bedroom. Clim, mosquitoes net and electric repellant too. Lot of books available. 
It's a restaurant too. 
In touristic season it cost 48€ per pax for the night, the dinner and the breakfast. Everything on the table is produced in the farm and it's very good food.
Family ruled establishment, kind people. Italian speakers and some French and English.

name: Montarone
description: Parking lot for hikers on Montarone mountain high above Orta lake. Great view at day and night. Even in high season only a few people around. Weekends maybe busy.

name: Parking site in Rovenna high above Lago di Como
description: parking site at beginning of sentiero di lariani.

name: Case Opaco
description:
Halfisland in the middle of a river Anza. S

hort distance away from road. Meadow with enough space for 20 cars. Should be available for every car. Village with Bar and Restaurant near by.

name: Agriturismo Monte Majore
description:
the true Sardinian hospitality. Wonderful place in the Sulcis region, not far from Cagliari, Chia or Iglesias. rooms are big and clean, all with AC and big tv. prices are fair (35 euros). incredible cusine, all handmade and with local produces.
a culinary oasis in the south of Sardinia. Alessandro and Marco are super hosts and will treat you as member of their family.

name: Parking behind Dunes
description:
Free parking near the beach, no service, but near group of restaurant.

During the daytime, if you buy something, you can use the toilets of the nearby Lido.

name: Nice place at the river under the bridge
description:
Beautiful place with reachable water, which is about 1m deep at max. Enough to swim a little or bathe yourself. The sand-"road" is directly at the base of the Bridge. I could easly fit my WxLxH 1.8x6.2x2.8 meter van under it.
It is a large camping area. Highly frequented by families and retirees.

name: Camping Tesonis
description: Great camping with good facilities. right next to the beach. Very relaxed atmosphere and quite good prices. sSept in a huge teepee for 14 euros a night. Safe and clean

name: Camping Romantica
description: Camping ground with facilities. Also has apartments to rent.

name: Eremo Della Breccia
description: Meadow in front of small church high in the mountains at east coast of Lago di Como. Overlooking mountains and small part of Lake. Very quiet.

name: B&B La Tartaruga
description:
Very nice option to stay when you pick up/ give the car to the port. It’s very close to the port. A lot of good Restaurants are in walking distance. 
The owner Paolo is a very nice man. It’s very clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay. It was a shame we had just one night there.

name: Camping Park Valle Maira
description:
PONT DLA CEINO, CAMPSITE is a family-run, simple and functional structure along the Maira Torrent in the heart of the Valley.
It has spacious and comfortable pitches, equipped with electric connection, shaded or in the sun, for tents, caravans, campers and 4×4.
It is the ideal starting point for excursions on foot or by bike and the perfect boarding for the canoe descents of the Torrente.
A small and cozy BAR CAFE’ offers bread and local  products to order.
The customers of the campsite who intend to engage in multi-day excursions along the many paths of the Valley (GTA, Percorsi Occitani)
have the possibility to park their car inside our structure.

name: Crespi d’Adda
description:
Quiet residential area with a lot of shadow under tall trees.
We parked on the large area for buses, normally closed but was open and nobody asked us anything.

name: Camping Il Faggio
description: nice place. small area for tents. friendly for animals. restaurant own by the same people. Wi-Fi in restaurant available. for bike, tent and one person I paid 14€. can be hard to get there with long campers

name: Camping al Lago
description:
Official Campground directly on a beautful lake. Side in general not big as well as the parking lots. 
Clean facility. Reccomend place #100

name: Hill up to Genova
description:
Nice spot in the hills around Genova. the road from Genova is steep and narrow. we drive a 7meters motorhome and luckily we made it without meeting another car. the road coming from south of Genova is much bigger.
spot can be windy at night.
nice place in summer to escape the heat of the town
0 services but beautiful view!

name: Camping agrituristico carso
description:
Wild campsite under trees, romantic set up . only 20 site, with swimming pool (open 10-1pm/3-7pm)
electricity, ablution clean, you can buy agricultural products in there own shop.. wifi at office
only minus: bit noisy because of nearby train-line and road
Arround 40€/night (2adult/2kids)
As the campsite is positioned on cliff above the ocean, there is a nice scenic, steep walk down to the see..~3km

name: Belvedere
description: Large panorama on both sides, size for Max. VW Bus. Is one degree as wide as a road for a car. To all who spend a night here, to go up a lot of sun --- Zu beiden Seiten großes Panorama, Größe für Max. VW Bus . Liegt auf einen Grad so breit wie eine Straße für einen PKW. Allen die hier eine Nacht verbringen, viel Sonne daranzugehen oben .

name: Santa Margherita
description: Nice campground near to the city of Caorle. Usually free spots avaliable. Nice beach. 22 euro for the car. 11 euro per person.

name: Free Public Parking next to Road, San Casciano in Val di Pesa
description:
The parking is open and free and has water (tap is hidden under the hedge at the west side). There’s enough space, some places are perfectly flat. But there are lights and it’s next to a road. At night there’s not much traffic.

500 meters south-east there’s a big swimming pool. You can dive, there are swimming lanes and you don’t need a swimming cap. 

And 600 meters north-west there is a lovely center, that was not crowded with tourists. We had diner at Cantinetta del Nonno. Really good food and served with love and a smile. 

The Village felt like unspoiled, authentic Italy, in an overly crowded Tuscany.

name: Passo Picolo Dolomiten
description:
3 euros for 24 hours, perfect to recover in the evening from the ride and absolute peace. Great way to complete the holiday from the south.
---
3 Euro für 24 Stunden, perfekt sich am Abend von der Fahrt zu erholen und absolute Ruhe. Tolle Möglichkeit den Urlaub aus dem Süden abzuschließen.

name: Campeggio Gran Paradiso Cogne
description:
Very nice campsite with fantastic surrounding in Gran Paradiso National Park. Grassy sites with electricity and views on a waterfall, the mountains and glaciers of Gran Paradiso. Good facilities, small shop with bread etc, short walk to the village of Valnontey with restaurants, bars and shops. Lots of hikes possible, dogs are only allowed on the paths along the valley because of the wild animals further up (capricorns, marmots). Volleyball field, playground for children
Tel 0165 749204,
19€ for two persons and a camping car/night

name: Camping with great view
description:
Not possible in winter time.  it's the place where chairlifts arrive in winter.
1 place with stunning view,  other places possible but without the view 
1 km  of easy offroad to reach the place.

name: Camping Mabellini
description:
https://www.camping-mabellini.com/de/
Nice nee campground on a bio-apple-plantage-farm.

name: Camping Giardino
description:
Hugh campground close to the sea. 
Narrow pitches shadowed with trees. 
Facilities old and dirty (no toilet paper, no soap, need coins for shower)
Many pitches designed for permanent campers. Friendly staff on our arrival.

name: Parking lot Sta. Maria Navarrese
description: Actually the only parking lot for campers in the nearer region. Some trees, not suitable for tents. Good for 10-12 rigs. Great location, center 100m, marina 200m, public potable water source at park (100m). Nice restaurants and bars within 2 minutes walking.

name: Agriturismo Lago Le Tamerici
description: Campsite belongs to a farm. It has 45 pitches close to a lake. On our arrival good English was spoken. Last half km road is a bit bumpy.

name: Camp site with beautiful view
description:
Camp site in the hills with lots of forest around. The site is big enough to have multiple campers, even big rigs. 
The most beautiful part is the view, which is really awesome. Quiet as far as we can tell. Only occasionally some vehicles drive by on the dirt road during the day.
Access is super easy for every category including large and tall trucks.
The place has multiple fire pits and seating areas, even though some are not well maintained. The large shady chestnut tree makes the best spot to hang out and enjoy the sunset.

name: Field access dirt road
