description: A small field field access road. In between fields. A small river nearby. No passage. No no noise.

name: Camping Soal
description: The place is located in a beautiful scenery, but close to the main road, so it's pretty noisy. Campground is ugly and full of stones, it has no banks to seat and facilities are far. Also no kitchen to cook. There is a bar with fare prices. Also camping rates are the lowest of the area (€26 for two persons on a motorcycle per night).

name: Monte Cucco - Parking
description:
This is one of the most spectacular sites we have been so far. The space is basically a parking space during the day for tourists visiting the Monte Cucco Cave or for people enjoying hang gliding and paragliding. In the evening the place is empty and makes for an outstanding overnight stay.
Occasionally free running cows and horses will visit. The sunrise in the morning is as equally breathtaking as the sunset in the evening. A must-see! If one likes, a restaurant is in walking distance.

name: Camping Lago 3 Comuni
description: Small camping next to a lake. Parking lot included.

name: Camping Arrighi
description: Nice Camp near Barbarossa Bay - Safe, clean, quiet, friendly. Nice Restaurant near by.

name: Hotel Umbria
description: Small, clean, friendly, family run hotel on the outskirts of Orvieto. Don't try and stay in the old town, it's horribly overpriced, stay here and take the funicular 5 mins walk away to get up to the town.

name: Lago Orfu
description:
NOTE: Wild camping is in general forbidden in Italy. Do check local and current rules as well as using common sense.

There are ample of tracks around this lake and we saw other local people camp during the night. The lake is ice cool and therefore gives you a real refreshing evening bath. There are places in sun or shade. Gravel or gras.

There are no amenities, except some garbage bins.

name: Camping Clarke
description: Nice camp site with lovely view to the lake. Very friendly owners speaking English. you can get some beer, drinks and wine here. paid 25€ for a bike, tent and one person.

name: Monte Jafferau
description:
A mountain top as well as an old fort. I don’t know the age of the fort. But as far as I know it’s from WW1.

You can reach the fort with a SUV with good awd and ground clearance. Minimum 20 cm. Think Subaru. But I’ll would not recommend taking the western route. I recommend a proper 4x4, like Toyota Hilux or Jeep Wrangler for instance if you are going up or down that way. Opt for the southern if only awd (Subaru). Something more sturdy with proper 4x4 and low transfer gearing will make the trip much more pleasant and less hair raising.

The track is a fabulous trip and it will take the whole day. It’s gravel all the way around.

name: Self service refill water
description:
Cold, normal and sparkling water, bring your own bottle.
5 cents per liter normal, 6 cold, 7 sparkling.

name: Torre mozza
description:
Caravan park
Free from 20 to 8
All day 18€, you can pay also for half day or per hours

name: Camping Porticciolo
description:
Camping ground just at the edge of the lake. Maximum 100 meters walk. Lot of trees so more or less all spots are partially shaded.

They declare that there are washing machines, but they were out of order.

Third night we were there, there was a disco close by that kept us awake until 01:00.

There are some kind of WiFi, but we didn’t got it working.

BBQ set can be rented.

Hot water in the showers are solar heated. It was hot when we where there. But it might not be so in other parts of the year.

name: Marecchia Riverbank
description:
At the stony riverbank of Marecchia. Definitely recommend 4x4 or at least some kind of awd since you have to cross the river. A bit of ground clearance will help as well. The bottom is like loose cobblestones. Small and big. We did it in August and the water was not even one foot deep. But in springtime it might be a roaring rapid. We stayed at the middle river bank. About 300 meters NE of the marker there is a partly overgrown track heading SW on the middle riverbank from the track that at least at Pocket Earth is at the map.

There are room for many small rigs but you might have to be a little bit separate since the riverbank is littered with bushes and small trees. There probably is lots of driftwood.

name: Felicita
description: very nice and cute hostel in the old town of lucca, just in the main entrance nearest to the train station (10 minute walk away). cheapest and nicest place we found anywhere near! address via san girolamo 20, grey door, 3rd floor. contact via mail in booking sites for best rates.

name: Canale Cuori Intercluso Sud 1
description: A grassy spot with room for about two normal sized rigs. There are a muddy river next to it. Lots of sun if not cloudy. We where three rigs and it was just that we could fit there. Some traffic that just smiled and waved.

name: hidden parking lot
description:
Parking slot near the road with potable water at the beginnig of a village. There is a restaurant on the other side of the road.
Good to sleep for one night but a bit noisy.

name: Villar Focchiardo
description: Basic camp site with running water, soft green grass, close to river. 10 euro per night, 3 euro for electricity, nice little spot. very quiet

name: Picnic spot
description:
Picnic place with fresh water from a spring. Including information signs about the national park.
(Downstream the river are good spots for a [n]ice cold swim).

name: Camping Funivia
description:
Open from 15/5 - 31/8, while summer season.
Camping ground near the funicular to Campo Imperatore for hikers. Many trees and free use of the kitchen.
There are also restaurants nearby.

name: Picnic spot in the woods
description:
On the left side of the entrance are picnic tables. On the right side you can park between the trees to be offside the road. 
Be careful with the trail runs at the entrance (picture).
At some spots in this area are wild dog packs.

name: Park in Calascio
description:
Fresh water in a park where you can picnic. 
You can hike up to Rocca Calascio for a beautiful view.

name: Trieste
description:
Nice please on the Harbour Trieste bear Old Town.
0.80cent per Hour 
In my view the best place in Trieste . We was there with  a  8.40m Camper.

name: Ostello dei Concari, Governolo
description: Very nice Hostel outside of mantova. Geared towards bicyclists, but also great for other overlanders. They have a big parking Lot that could fit Big Rigs, but don't know If they allow Camping there. Acceptable price for Central Europe, Clean, friendly and has Restaurant and bar. In nice Green area perfect for cycling.

name: green parking spot
description:
large parking area. You can park here or drive a few meters up in the woods to sleep there out of sight. Walk up there for a view over Bologna. 
Very clean with trashcan.

name: Kids Playground Water Tap
description: it's located in a kids Playground next to the Esso Petrol station.

name: Triora Camper Parking
description: 5 min walk from the little city, local and with water.

name: Wild camp Bear casteo del Monte
description: We run from Brindisi to Pesacara (heading backup from Albania to France after the ferry crossing from Vlora) and came too late to find any accommodation. We had to open the Roof top tent at a discreet place at 4am. This place is ok. It is near the road, but in a sharp curve, so cars pass by without noticing. A trekking path passes by so you better leave early.

name: Camping Torino Mill Park
description: Nice campsite relatively cheap in high season. Small camper and two people was £18. Around half an hour train from Torino but you have to drive to local village to train station. Paid WiFi available.

name: Stilfser Joch Pass Parking
description: One of the most exiting pass roads in the Alps. Stunning view from the parking. Ee were the only ones who stayed over night.

name: Mountain Clough
description: Flat area off mountain road. The shepherd was happy for us to camp for the night. 4x4 not needed but road up the mountain is narrow so wide or long vehicles will struggle. There is a Refugio round the corner but not visible. Very quiet.

name: Lago di Sauris
description: Flat area big enough for two vehicles by the side of the turquoise lake. 4x4 not needed but good ground clearance needed. Locals visit but quiet early evening for a swim.

name: Camping Riva Blue
description:
Massive campsite with spots right on the lake for Land Cruiser / Land Rover size vehicles, small vans. Not on the lake - big rigs can also fit.
Clean bathrooms, no kitchen, but there is a great restaurant with a view.
Car + 2ppl 33 euros

name: Suzzara Parking Lot
description: nice big parking lot, not many cars at night, a bit of lighting. rather quiet with atm and Restaurants close. No amenities though.

name: Nice camping spot
description: Nice camping spot near to a closed refuge. Big field, fresh running water at the bottom end of it. Place for barbecue.

name: Gravel ground above football field Malborghetto Valbruna
description:
Quiet place above sport fields near village Malborghetto Valbruna. Follow signs sport fields and continue up hill. On your left several wood trunks, we parked next to these. A little bit further up hill there is another gravel ground at your right where you can park as well. 

Dead end street, forbidden to continue after 500 meters.

No one will see you. Next to it there is a cycling and hiking path though but when it is dark no one will pass probably. Excellent spot. Above your head 100 meters away is the highway, you will hear some noise from that, acceptable. 

On grass fields a little below 2 covered pick nick places and a small children playground.

name: Place to camp with nice view
description: This is a good spot to pitch a tent or stay in your camper. You have a nice view and if you are very lucky you can see some paragliders training on the hill right at the spot. We already slept here three times and never had a problem. There is a small street to this place. Take a small path about 150m after the house near the place.

name: Pian Muné
description: In the italiens mountains,nice place ,great cuisine , Big free parking for cars ,motorcycles .

name: End of dirtroad
description: Quiet (for fusina) spot at the end of a dirtroad. 15 min drive to the ferry.

name: Camping Arc en Ciel, Morgex
description: Delightful little site (about 20 pitches) in the mountains. Excellent Pizza restaurant and bar with amazing deserts and English speaking waitress + indoor/outdoor seating on site. Small childrens' play area + little pool in season. Only open to end September. Friendly owner. Electricity ​worked eventually! €18 p n inc electricity with ASCI camping card. Washrooms spotless, chemical loo emptying point, dishwashing room, laundry. Beside a very quiet road. About 15 mins from Mt Blanc tunnel. Does take tents and pets.

name: Campeggio La Sorgente
description: Small, nice and quiet campsite. Restaurant nearby. Sanitary facilities acceptable but not luxury. Stayed here one night with tent and motorcycle.

name: Carpark local authority owned
description:
Carpark on Monte Cassino with camper waste water dump and drinking water tap. Can be full in summer apparently but it was almost empty when we arrived in September (just one other van).  Owned by local authorities and campervans can stay overnight. 

A few teenagers drove round but left when they saw the campers disappointingly ruining their “quiet time” with their girlfriends. Was almost silent after 11pm. 

It’s right under a Roman theatre that you can have a quick look at before heading up the mountain in the morning.

name: In carpark on Monte Cassino
description: Camperstop carpark also has a waste dump in the corner near the entrance. Clean water tap, and you can stay overnight for free in a self contained campervan.

name: Ostaria Enoteca Do Colonne
description:
Small restaurant like tapas bar without tourist. Soup with beans or cod cream a delight frequented by people of the rare neighborhood in Venice.

Petit resto genre bar à tapas sans touriste soupe pâte avec haricots ou morue a la crème un délice fréquenté par les gens du quartier rare a Venise.

name: mantova
description:
parking vers le port aucun service bien pour visiter la ville
parking near harbour no services, good to visit the town

name: Torona piscine
description:
Pool of Torona a Big parking

parking de la piscine de Torons

name: Seicento
description: Very nice place with dorms (4 people) 30eur/pers included nice buffet breakfast ! Also private rooms available. Thee for free the all day, garage to store the bike and little garden to chill. A lote of details very sweet !

name: camping by the beach (arbatx)
description:
Small car park 50m from beach, has small restaurant next to it! 
Shower and toilet available (free/gratis) 
Suitable for tent also, we camped with two motorcycles and two tents!

name: Nicotera Marina wild beach
description: wild beach close to the town Nicotera Marina. near by " Villagio Sayonara"

name: Wolkenstein
description: Camperspot. 20 euro per night. Pretty busy. Clean toilets. no showers. You can fill your water tank. great place to start your hike. beautiful view over the mountains.

name: Camping Pula Beach Park
description:
Camped one night here with motorcycle and tent, can camp in bush accros the road or park your van on the edge of the beach! 
Is free camping 50m from beach, park bench and seating area available and is nice shady area! 
Quiet road and quiet beach! 
Only a few local cars and beach goers!

name: Picnic Area
description: Near the hill top there is a picnic table next to a parking. It's by the main road. If you're desperate you can spend a night.

name: Agritourismo Frascje dai Spadons
description: Great rooms, safe parking, nice staff and great wine, food, breakfast. Not that cheap, but a nice place. We payed 60€ for 2 person in a double room with breakfast

name: in the cliffs
description: lonely place right in the see, no sand, swim possible in small pools between cliffs. small Road only for small campervan, no big campers.

name: rivoli veronese
description: 2 small fields in which locals camp. Further down to the river a nice grassy field with better views and more space. South of Festung wohlgemuth. Perfect if u are tired of busy campings and still like to visit garda. Not for big rigs. Entrance route is gravel, 4x4 not neccessary. Entrance to the last field is a bit steep. Enter from the South, first left from Località Battello. Enjoy

name: Wild beach
description: Wild beach near by Nicotera Marina. Need to go through tne pine forest 100-150 m  . on the right side you'll see a path that goes to the beach.

name: Villanova Tulo
description: Fountain in the Center of the village.

name: Riverside accessible on foot
description: Found this place with firepits. Dry riverbed not accessible by any type of vehicle. Walking only. Go across the bridge and there is a stream.

name: Cascade Gromagio
description: Quiet spot by the cascade. Hidden from the road, room for 1-2 tents and some parking spot at the bottom for cars/small RVs. Some 4G coverage

name: Parking place near sportsarena
description: Quiet parking place near the Sports Arena. We weren't the only ones staying here.

name: Bricofer - Gas Cartridge Screw Cap!
description: After a long search we finally found Butan/Propan Mix Cartridge for screwing. (Camping gas cooker).

name: Monte Crocedomini
description: Beautiful panoramic place along the gravel road over the Passo Crocedomini. Picnic area and hiking trails. A lot of other beautiful overnight places from here eastwards...

name: Monte Maniva
description: Big parking along the road over the Passo Crocedomini. Panoramic view over the mountains. Between the Wildcamp Crocedomini and here are several opportunities to overnight, some with picnic sites, some hidden from the (remote) road. Fantastic area up here!

name: The Rice Beach
description:
Starting at Spiaggia di Maimoni, taking a easy dirt road (strada Maimoni) following the coast line heading north. There are a lot of quiet places for tents and campervans directly next to the beach with beautiful sand and sunset. Its not crowded and there is lots of space between the caming grounds.
 Waste bins avaible, helpful and friendly Carabinieri, even a restaurant and Café at Spiaggia di Maimoni.

name: Piombino
description: Good spot for one night if you're coming or going on the ferry to Elba. You can also park a little bit further down the road on a paved parking space or up at the Castillo. Space is suitable for big rigs, but the roads through the town leading here could be a little bit tricky.

name: Villa San Martino
description: Napoleon's living place. Elba. Italy.

name: Dog beach
description: Sand parking place in the dunes at the beach. There is a small beachbar/snackbar with toilets. Good for a night if going or coming from the ferry in Olbia. There are shopping centers / supermarkets like LIDL on the way to Olbia.

name: Elephant Rock
description: Rock formation shaped as an Elephant.

name: Grotta di Nettuno
description: Small parking area at a lookout point near the Grotta. Only one or two spots are level enough. A lot of dayvisitors, but at night quiet. There are some other options directly at the Grotta or at the embarkation point.

name: Camping Olympia
description:
International camping with chalets, caravans, huts and area for tents.
We paid 37 euro per night (2 people in a tent + car).
LOT of people in the summer, but no booking so just come and ask, people are leaving every day.
Pizzeria and shop inside.

name: Bari Centrale train station (for airport)
description: This is where you catch the train to the airport.  Was running roughly every 30 minutes & takes about twenty minutes then another few walking.  Train station has wifi. Cost: 5 Euro one way.

name: Barfod gelato (vegan options, too)
description: Delicious gelato including sorbets (water based) and vegan flavors (rice or almond milk based).  Gluten-free available as well (just make sure they also don't add biscuits on top at the end).

name: Il Convivio Bistrot Restaurant
description: Tasty foods.  Good wifi.  Pricing starting at 4 Euro per dish.  Friendly staff

name: Cucina Casareccia Trattoria Le Zie Restaurant
description: Local specialties here.  8-15 Euro dishes.  Tasty!  They also have homemade liquers including limoncello, cinnamon and herbal.

name: Urbino Campervan
description: Good small place to park ? stay to visit beautiful mediaeval city. 15 mins uphill walk into city. Bigger coach park opposite.

name: Urban Oasis Hostel
description:
Good wifi, great back garden with fruit trees and tables/chairs with hammock areas, library/tv room, an additional lounge room, and a kitchen.  

Four bed dorms available for 15 Euro per bed/person.   

Private Rooms for single use cost 28 Euro, 40 Euro for two people.

Motorcycles and cars can be parked directly outside the hostel on the street and the parking in this neighborhood is safe.

Short walk to the train station.

name: Beautiful Park
description: This park is gorgeous. Quiet. Tranquil. Really nice landscaping.

name: Camping Villaggio Le Ginestre
description: Near Arezzo. Great restaurant. Pool in season. English spoken. Mini mart/bar in village 400 metres away (uphill); friendly. €22 p n (Inc €2 local tax) with ASCI card out of season for 2 with van & electricity

name: Mozzarella e Basilico Trattoria-Pizzeria Restaurant
description: Open late even on dead weeknights. Tasty. Friendly. Also gluten-free options.

name: Saporu di Sicilia Pasticcheria
description: You can order cannolo here.  They have other items as well.  Super delicious!  Worth it.

name: Soul Kitchen
description: Really fresh ingredients and tasty.  Worth it!

name: Bike Shop - Cicli De Carlo di De Carlo Giuseppe
description: Great little bike shop that will let cycle tourists use tools. Decent selection.

name: Masseria Radogna  Campground
description: 9 euros per person. We were on bicycles. Nice spots for tents and camper vans. Basic facilities but a great hot shower, picnic tables and electricity. A short walk to the view point where you can watch the sunset over Matera and the city light up. The campsite offers a shuttle service into Matera for 3 euros per person return. Very quiet and rustic. We loved it.

name: Camping Gran Bosco
description: Closest campsite to the Colle del Sommeiller. Friendly medium sized campsite with showers, bar and restaurant. English speaking reception. Last arrivals 1930.

name: Osteria da Peppino
description:
Good restaurant with pasta, meat, veggies, etc.  Reasonable pricing.  7-8.50 Euro for entrees.  Our bill was 35 Euro for two people - 2 entrees, 1 side, 2 glasses of wine.

Gluten-free options are also especially delicious.

name: L'Antica Pizzeria da Michele
description: 5 Euro for an entire pizza.  Highly rated.  You will find a crowd waiting outside.  Walk inside (yes, pass through the crowd) and order take-away and it should take under 10 minutes.  Only two choices with cheese or without cheese (it will have tomato sauce and a little basil as well).  If you wait to sit inside it could take an hour to get in.

name: Wildcamp, south east Calto
description: This is a suitable site for a tent. We stayed here for one night. It is suitable for one night only. We had two bikes and a 3 man tent. Very discreet and bikes were very safe. Great spot :)

name: Wildcamp under a bridge at Spessa
description:
Ok, we stayed here when we got caught in the rain! Clearly others had camped here before as there were remnants of someone else’s fire. 

Not scenic and noisy due to bridge and traffic on that. If it’s wet water will pour off the bridge. Under bridge is mostly dry which is why we picked it. A bit too close to the road, but this was a good place for us when the weather changed! :)

name: Wildcamp in Rosolina
description: This is a beautiful part of the world! It’s very flat and open so it can be tricky to camp. We found a spot suitable for one night only, early departure. It’s quite close to the road and be warned every 1-2 hours the pump which is next to the camping spot makes a loud noise releasing air pressure. It woke us up.

name: Forest Hill
description: Nice flat place at the beginning of the forest and some hikes. No one here end October. Maybe busier in summer. No for big rigs. Small curvy road up. No services but nature which is the best service of all. Keep it that way.

name: Rio Pircio, area attrezzata
description: It's a camperstop with clean toilet, showers, sinks, even a washing machine and wifi. It's open all year, near to the beach. Very convenient for a stop over. Hot showers costs 1 Euro, 12 Euro for a van with 2 persons without electricity. Very friendly. Attention toilet/showers closed from 21.30-8.00... In the morning we saw, there is another place 100m further down the road, maybe check there as well.

name: Leopoldo Coffee Shop/Bakery
description: This particular location is gluten free and great for people with limited diets.  However, they have locations all over Naples that are amazing and non-gluten free.  Visit one for pastries, gelato, coffee.  Worth it!  Figured I'd list this one for those seeking out gluten-free croissants (incredible) ;)

name: Boulder park Daone
description: Nice parking where you can spend a night with camper van or tent. 2 minutes walk from the climbing area.

name: Camping Afrodite
description: Very nice campground, friendly and helpful owner. We payed 18€ for a camper and two persons ( low season). Camping is open all year.

name: Ristorante Romeo - Area di sosta camper
description: Nice little campground in Cologna Spaggia. We payed 20€ for Camper and two persons. The campground

name: Harmony Jazz and Blues Bar
description: Good bar with nice groovy music and a nice bartender.

name: Sarzana Riverside
description: Picnic place by the river. Beautiful view. There's a height restriction because of the bar when entering the place. Quiet during the night. Stayed here with my dog, car and rooftop tent.

name: Vesu View Boutique Inn
description: Clean, basic, inexpensive rooms, with private parking for bikes and cars in walk-in distance from the Pompei archeological site. We paid 40 euros for two people plus the city taxes 2E pp. Good quality breakfast for 5E pp.

name: Localito Castagno
description: We choose this place, as a bit more remote from the parking place were most people stop and park. This spot is very quiet in the evening and no one passing by. Their are few locals passing by during say times, all smiling:) Some on 4wd, some hikers and several mountain bikers. You do not need a 4wd for this spot, but only suitable for smaller overlanders rigs, however we did bring our expedition trailer and plenty of space to turn it around If you have a 4wd and rofftop tent, I am sure you can find way better camp-/view spots in the area by seeking out on the dirt roads

name: old bridge
description: flat space next to a service building (probably water) at the end of a small road. next to an old bridge. no services, just a hidden place to spend the night. no special view, but good enough for the night. No one bothered us, but there are tire tracks, so maybe there could appear community workers.

name: Via delle Rose
description: Nice quite camp with a good cover from a forest and view to fields.   On the way up you pass trough several winefields.

name: Wild camp in the mountains
description: You drive up the tarmac road, very easy to reach, a flat spot in a curve, very quite, beautiful view into the mountains.

name: Ticket Parking Vesuvio
description:
here you pay 6€ for the car parking. 
shuttle bus service to the upper office cost additional. 
Park entrance to visit the top is 10€, ticket office is half way up to the top. 
toilets only in kiosks when buying food/souvenirs.

name: Rifugio Bruno Piazza
description:
Very nice location. The "rifugio" is a comfortable place where you can go for a yummy lunch, stay overnight in the dormitory or just for a beer. 
The hosts are nice and welcoming. 
I will suggest this place to climbers (as there are many good rocks) but also to people who desire to spend a day or a weekend in nature.
If you can make a phone call before go, as in the low seasons they are not always open.

name: fountain
description: fountain in a village, locals come here to film up bottles. Might be fed from the river nearby. Not sure if its running in winter.

name: bercerto
description: Bedroom with 4 bed kitchen, toilet, shower, in at siminaire free

name: Fiat Service Aversa
description:
official Fiat service garage. they speak some english. friendly and helpful. 
They fixed our broken cooling water system and let us sleep in the van infront of the garage. no facilities, near to city center with restaurants and shops. close to the train station to Napoli.

name: Area Soster Camper
description: Small campground next to the highway maintained by a nice, friendly guy. All amenities are provided. 20€/24h. Bus stop right opposite as well as a gas station and a supermarket. About 7km to the city centre.

name: Area Soster Camper - parking overnight in Pisa
description: Small campground located next to a Gas station in the centre of Pisa. 12€/night for the camper - 3€ on top for electricity. No facilities provided.

name: Il Parcheggio del Borgo
description:
Small informal campground owned by Guido in walking distance to the city centre of Lucca - providing all facilities as well as a small workshop.
20€/night incl. electricity, shower, etc.

name: Passo Teglia
description:
Right on the top of the Passo Teglia. 
Hidden by trees and with a brilliant view. 
Fireplace and wood available!
Even on the way to the top you can find many places to stay on the side of the road. 
BTW: The road is part of the Rallye San Remo.

name: Piombino parcheggio camper
description:
Public car park in Piombino, but also officially allowed for campers (free). It is right at the outer boarder of the city, not in the center. In April it was quiet during the week, weekends might become more lively. 
From here it is only a few meters to a nice hiking region, and also near to the city. It's just a few hundred meter to a supermarket. A water-tap with drinking water is also just a few meters away where the hiking region begins (not directly accessable by car). Trash containers are also available (along the road).

name: Parcheggio Docciola Volterra
description: Parking area for camper. 12€/night incl. electricity. Open area.

name: Camping Colleverde Siena
description: Nice, but expensive campground a bit outside of Siena. Offers all amenities, but even in low season prices are high. We paid 35,50€/night for two people and a small campervan incl. electricity and shower. For using the washing machine you have to pay 5€ per load.

name: Agritourism Buca Vecchia
description: Small „campground“ which belongs to an nice agritourismo. 20€/night incl. electricity and opportunity to fill up fresh water and drop of grey/black water.

name: la controra hostel
description:
Very nice hostel. 
Safe parking : 5€ motorbike and 10€ car inside of the yards.
Included breakfast.
For dinner; if you pay 3€ for some drink, you have free foods. 
Shared room; 10 ppl 13€

name: Side Road to Camper Parking
description: This place is in the side road of the Camper spot, so you can park on the side road and use the vending machines and bathroom available for the campers (coin payment) (is a quiet place and have a lot of parking).

name: Rome Scout Center
description:
Normal hostel.
Parking inside in the yards = 5€ motorbike.
4 bed room = 22 euros. 
Breakfast included.

name: Agriturismo La Costa
description: Quite place close to Genova at the end of a road, so you can walk into the forest around Genova also with a dog without problems

name: Plus Hostel
description:
Very popular hostel.
Safe gated parking in the yards (moto) but it's possible car also. 
13€ shared room.
7€ buffet breakfast.

name: Free Camping Behind Gas Station
description:
Just a few kilometers south from Venice.
At the left side of provincial SS 309 behind the Tamoil Gas Station. 
Quiet place at night.
The gas statio closes but there is a good place with a gazeebo where you can sit and make your meal. Has water.

name: Sleeping behind Gas Station
description:
Very quiet at night. The Gas Station closes at 7 PM. Several trucks stay here at the front of IP Gas Station.
We opened our rooftent at the back.
Winter time you need to find protection from wind.
Good for a night.

name: Free Municipal Campground-Tuscania
description:
Big place with more than 10 camping spots.
Free with shadow, potable water and energy.
Playground for children. Benches and just beside the historical center.
Recomended for how many nights you want.

name: Lava Piu
description:
Automatic laundry with machines in 3 sizes. 5€ for the small 5kg of cloth 6,5 € for medium and 8€ for the large one for 10kg.
No need to bring soap. It's automatic and included on price.
Has driers that cost 1,8 € for 12 minutes.
Nice and clean place to rest while you wash your cloth. You can leave it washing ad go for a walk in the historic center just nearby.

name: Wild Camping at Saint Severa Castle
description:
Big grassy area just beside the Saint Severa Castle.
Some bushes and at 20 meters from the ocean.
Quiet and perfect to sleep. In the morning had a frost. We are in winter time.
No signs about not camping or other prohibitions.
Some people before us let a lot of garbage. Don't do this. Clean your spot ever.

name: Free Camping at a Parking Lot
description:
Located at Baia Domizia west coast of the Mediterranean Sea. Very close to the beach.
It's a abandoned parkink lot. Huge. One day here was a payed parking lot but now nobody here. The police Carabinieri passed by several times and we waved to them but they didn't stop or said anything. So we guess it's OK staying here. We are with out rooftent and arrived at 16h and liked the place.

name: Campeggio Bersaglio, Camping Schiesstand
description:
Drive East on SS 49 pass Exit Bruneck East. Leave road at zona industrial. Follow the small road, turn right at the end and head on for 500 m parallel to SS 49.

Cosy site with shady places and friendly staff.
Bikers very welcome.

name: Camping at Baia di Trentova.
description:
Sevetal places around. Big space for camping informal and free.
Very near the ocean.
No prohibition signs.
Good for the night.

name: Camping at a Parquejo in Fiumicello
description:
Parking lot at the left side of the beach. You can stay here 24hr free. A little noisy because of the electric electrical. 
Nice place 20 m of the beach.

name: Camping with Rooftent at IP Gas Station
description:
Parked at the spot on the right side of the Gas Station.
Staff is frendly and we used bathrooms at the restaurant-bar beside.
Free and queit at night. In the morning a beautifull view of Etna.
The trains passes near but only after 6 AM.
Has water and even electricity.

name: Parking and sleeping at Tamoil Gas Station
description:
Big place behind the gas station on your right side going to Sicily.
We asked the manager if we could pass the night here and he said it was OK. 
We used this place two times, we  went an returned from Sicily.
Quiet an safe.
Has water and a toilet.

name: Q8 Gas Station camping.
description:
Big place where trucks and travelers stop to pass the night.
Little noisy because the highway nearby. But at night less noise.
Has free internet and shower. AutoGrill is always a good place to stop and sleep. Here if you want has a hotel.
Good place.

name: Sala Braganza Free Camp
description: Paved parking. Spots groupwise seperated by bush and a few trees, with view hilly agri land. Very quiet. Last 100 m. to reach this spot is packed gravel. Easy access for all rigs. No amenities. 4G. There is a meadow to pinch your tent.

name: Quiet grass pull off
description: 2 small parking areas off a single lane. One side paved and one side grass. Very quiet, no visitors and no traffic. Good for tents.

name: Riverside with a view
description:
Great spot next to a big river. Very private, loads of fire wood. The road in looks tight and scary but it's really not. It's good surface just below the muddy top. Access was no problem with 6.5 m LWB 2wd sprinter. Elaborate motorhomes may want to walk it first to be sure. 

Lots of room for bikes and tents.

5 star camping!

name: Udine
description:
Free camping spot next to a big supermarket (Panorama) and a 20 minutes walk to downtown Udine. Very beautiful old city centre. 
Our truck is 8 m long and fits just about in at the left side of this parking lot. Hight and width is no problem here.

name: Volo Via
description: Fantastic vibes in this local tavern. Really really authentic osteria, with a fantastic owner, awesome rustic interior and tasty food. Absolutely recommended. It’s next to the military airport and it’s a little hard to find: take the road next to the gate. 5 minutes from the highway. It’s a perfect stop if you wish to continue on the A1 towards Bologna

name: Borgo Grappa camper service + sosta
description: Water, dump, parking all free. Restaurant nearby.

name: Close to Palermo
description: Nice quiet spot under the cliffs next to the sea. Not for big campers. 4x4 not needed but will help. Beautiful view and sound of breaking waves. By entrance of the park you pay 10 euro for a night. Well spend worth it.

name: Bassano Paraglider
description: This is probably one of the busiest paragliding landing spots on the planet. You can camp here sometimes it costs 3€ sometimes it's free if you eat there. Good place to go paragliding.

name: Laundry
description:
Laundry, do it yourself, 14kg for 7 euro or 6kg for 4 euro
Dryer 2euro/16 min

name: Porto di Genova
description:
Arriving from Tunisia was easy, and they did NOT check for green card insurance. Took about 2 mins total for immigration on motorcycle (don't leave the vehicle), including waiting in line. Some vehicles get customs check, but my motorcycle was waved through.

Departing was easy, only spot customs inspections for every few vehicles. Just a check of documents before lining up to board the ferry. Italy exit immigration done inside the terminal building on the right, BEFORE boarding ferry, next to GNV check-in desk.

Morocco entrance immigration and vehicle customs done on the ferry, before arrival! Listen for announcements or check the disco lounge throughout the day. The thing that looks like a glass DJ booth is the immigration and customs office.

name: Water tap by the road
description: By the road there is a public tap in the village. We filled up our watertank. I can’t tell if it’s potable or not but we will use it as drinking water. It’s Italy so any tapwater should be fine.

name: Drinkable water
description: There is a little fontain, actually a very beautiful one. The water is 100% drinkable and it tastes very good, as it comes directly from the mountain springs.

name: Parking with Sea View
description: A small parking lot next to the main road offers a hidden place to sleep in your van. The neighbourhood consists of mansions with large and luscious gardens. We spent one night here and slept very well. From the place, you can enjoy a morning view of the sea since the parking is located right above Recco beach. The small forest to your right is a good possibility to use as a toilet

name: Carp Zone
description: Great place just near the lake beach. There is a bar and a bathroom service. You need to pay a local tax to stay on the site.

name: In the countryside near the Via Francigena
description:
Here the dirt road ends and the field begins, sheltered by trees: see photo
There is also a very close waterway.
It is a pond, not a stream. And people come there to fish.
---
Qui finisce la strada sterrata e inizia il campo, riparato da alberi: vedi foto
C'è anche un corso d'acqua molto vicino.

name: Weißbrunn lake
description:
This spot is located right next to the the very beautifull Weißbrunn lake. It is a huuge parking place for hikers and visitors of the lake, but it is not asphalted, the total area is grass and there a lof of trees where you hide your vehicle. In the summertime there can be many cars, but you will always find a free space and in the evening, everyone leaves and you can enjoy the beautiful nature all by yourself. Through the parking place are flowing some small rivers, which water you can drink. Next to the parking place is also a small restaurant with some traditional dishes. 

If you have some time, definitely go the the Fischersee, which is a 30min hike and leads to one of the most beautiful lakes in South Tyrol.

name: Camper area Paradiso
description: Overnight camperstay on on paved tarmac ground. On walking distance to village centre. Very modern service. On arrival, first you take a card out of the barrier-machine. After that you can drive through and use the services with your card. Such as using electricity, water, toilets, showers and dump your your grey and black water. After your stay, you pay with your card using the machine. Banknotes and card are welcome. Place with nice view and starting point for ski and hike routes. First night 15,00, second 12,00 all included except shower, € 0,50 (3 min.)

name: Parking in front of former casino
description:
Parking on tarmac. Between closed casino and lake. No signs of prohibited overnight stay. Police came along, and didn’t mention us.
No facilities at all, except a rubbish bin. Some shops and bars in a walking distance. This is a piece of Italian ground surrounded by Swiss ground. Google for it’s history.

name: Lava Pui
description: Well equiped laudry. Washing and drying.

name: Centro Caravans
description: Well equiped shop and repair help for camper isues.

name: Water Station
description: Nice spot, to take water for free. Behind the fulstation.

name: Parking Lot
description: A little parking lot. Few cars in the night. no one at this place. A car with all-wheel drive is recommended. But it is not a 'must' to reach this place.

name: Camping near Auto repair shop
description:
Camping near a garage, there is electricity and water (no drinking water). Automatic barrier at the entrance.
We paid 10 Euro for the day and if you stay overnight/24h you must pay 20 euro.

name: Sea view and beach
description: Beautiful place at the beach and cliffs 20 meters from the sea. It’s private property they charge €10,- a day. We were there in the COVID period so it was very quite... we think it can be very crowed in the high season.

name: La casa sui trulli
description:
bnb few steps away from the Trulli area. perfect location and even a bit of a view from the balcony and terrace. quite big apt, no kitchen but I wouldn't eat in while in Puglia. 😄 coffee machine and water provided. paid 26 euros but well worth it. parking is a bit of a problem if you have a car, but on motorcycles you can squeeze it in somewhere without too much hustle. 
perfect location for exploring Alberobello even at night

name: ostello dei sassi
description: clean and well maintained hostel right in the town center. paid 17 euros for 1 night. parking for motorcycle is possible at the back near the mechanic. quiet at night and fairly safe. since the place is carved in the stones, no windows. but ceilings are high enough.

name: Forest road
description:
Small spot in the forest next to a bicycle path and near a river. Very quiet during the night, in the morning hikers and bikers pass by. No one disturbed us, no signs.
Good for one night.

name: Acqua fresca
description: Nice Campground 4 km south of centre of Livigno. Price is about 17 Euro per day, depending on season, including electricity.

name: Grödnerjoch
description: Parking lot near a Restaurant for 5€ the Night.

name: Cannero Riviera
description:
Stoney/sandy Beach with very nice grassy relax area and (Palm)trees. Some parking space next to it, perfect for small campers if you stay all day. Next to “camping Lido” Parking costs 9€ from 09:00-19:00.
Be early an you catch a good Spot with shade.

name: Open space in forest next to quiet road
description: Quiet place in forest next to the strada provinciale 50 della colma. Down a side road and After about 100m left down to this Spot. A house is in sight but it looks abandoned. Not the nicest place and No View but a quiet one and the road up is beautiful. You can drive this side road further down but it is steep and narrow and demanding on the brakes (and clutch back up) we found No better camping spot and went back up. 4wd or 2wd with high clearance is recommended

name: Supermarket/Sports Hall parking
description: Free quiet parking next to a supermarket and sports centre. Nothing special, but good for an overnight stop if you arrive late.

name: FANTELLE
description:
Large car park next to a bike path. With fountain, tables, barbecue, toilets 200m away.  Ideal for hiking or cycling.


Parcheggio ampio con fontana, ideale per fare escursioni a piedi o bicicletta.

name: Col de Sommeiler
description: Highest navigable point at 3000 m above sea level in the Alps. Accessible by motorcycle. The nature reserve is open once a year for the Stella Alpine (international motorcycle meeting) on the 2nd weekend in July. Off-road experience necessary.Overnight is not possible here due to the variable weather. Overnight only in the base camp at the mountain hut.

name: Hostel Ostello il Castagno
description:
Brand new hostel. Spacious rooms and nice facilities. There was no WiFi when I was here but I believe they are planning on set it up soon. 
Hot water, kitchen and secure parking for motorbikes. It is a quiet town. 
Also this used to be a police station...

name: Next to the waterfalls
description: Small Drive-through next to the Road - is seperated by trees from the Road, therefore very quite, no other People. On the other side of the Road is a nice waterfall, in the next tön is a stunning lake.

name: On the hill next to Florence
description: Parking lot next to the street in the Forest. Calm, beautiful With nice trees, shadow. Next to florence City.

name: Camping BellaTorino
description:
Very nice and friendly campingplace. Starten out as an camperstorrage and in 2014 the Camping was added. It has everything you need, is Affordable and eventhough has a lot of nice extra facilities like: airconpressor for tires, free bbq use and an small oncamping Restaurant in a nice retrocaravan. Small menu but great food and good wine.
There is a Shuttlebus you can take to Torino and a very helpfull staf at the deskoffice that knows a lot about the area. You get a Handwritten Welcome-envelope with a lot of handy Info
We stayed 3 days, and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere very much.

Only one tip for improvement: WiFi is fast but only reaches till a Little away from the deskoffice

name: Community Weekend Picknick site
description: 4x4 or high ground clearance necessary. Nice spot, has seen better days though. Entry or finish point for a very nice medium offroad track.

name: Camping Thöni
description:
A friendly establishment between Reschensee and Haidersee. You can go hiking here or ride your bike around the lake with the sunken village where only the church tower is visible above the water.
A downside is that it is located near the road. You can hear the cars roaring by day and night. It is not bad, but it could use some panels to filter the sound.

name: Camping Sole
description: 25 sites on 3 terraces. Sites are large (aprox. 40m2)  but close to each other for campers and tents (though hard bottom due to camper friendly structure in ground). Electricity and drinking water on sites. Quiet place once all guests are in bed, not much sound of nearby high/trainway. Usual amenities with hot water, clean. Little swimming pool. Tel +39(0)19931710

name: Capoiale on the beach.
description: Nice beach. Great swimming. Not very crowded by day, quiet at night. Beach is cleaned up on a regular basis, the hinterland has some rubbish between the shrubberies. Not many trees/shade

name: Ortolano
description: Fresh water tap with sweet mountain water; it is possible to attach a hose

name: Parking next to the lake
description: Parking next to the lake. Possibility to walk around the lake. Water next to the lake and WC also.

name: Rest area
description: A pond near the town of Moos with some benches around. If you place your tent late enough and pack early, you should be fine.

name: Lago di Campotosto, Gran Sasso NP
description:
Quiet spot by the reservoir. High altitude, so cool even in July when it was scorching hot at the coast. No fire hazard, so nice to make a fire. Bring your own wood. 

The water is not cold at all; great swimming

name: Near muggia
description: Nice free place to stay overnight with camper or car, next to the sea. Alowed for 2 days max.

name: Quiet Parking at night
description: Free Parking close to beach. We just stayed there at night and left early again. There was an other RV parked there as well.

name: Roadside
description: Behind a  bush next to the road. Not beautiful but good to overnight. Just for sleeping in a vehicle!

name: rifugio belvedere
description: campsite beside a mountain shelter , here you can camp for free but no bathroom or shower. according to the national park is allowd to camp beside the shelter, the road to reach the place is for 4wheels.drive or enduro mc

name: Laguna Beach
description: Small family run campground between two restaurants. Directly located at the lake. Clean facilities. 20€/night for a minivan and two adults.

name: Marsaglia River Camping
description: Parking space on a river bank close to Marsaglia. Turn to the left after the bridge. Some locals are there for swimming. All left after sunset. You can park close to the river or some meters before hidden between trees.

name: Camping Gabbice Monte
description: Small campground with sea view. Steep footpath goes directly to a hidden beach with almost no people. Spaces are located on terraces.

name: Future is Nature - Playground
description:
Spacious camp site with lots of big trees. Nice and quiet location in between some villages.

For bikers ideal to do some day trips into the mountains just to the northwest with loads of small and twisty roads.

name: Riverside. Fischleintal
description: next to river, Fischleintal. We were parked here during the hike to drei Zinnen as the official parking had a 2,35m height restriction. we then also stayed overnight as well as others did. no problem, pretty quiet and scenic

name: Pragser lake p1 parking
description:
12 Euro for parking + 8 Euro for Camping overnight
24h for €25.- 3h for € 8.-

name: Area sosta camper Magic Forest
description:
Spacious camper site next to the official camp site. Just down from the main road very easy to reach.

There are trees for a shady spot.

Nice bath house with toilets and hot showers.

I paid €10 for the night.

The camp site of the same owners next door mainly consists of cabins although there is some space to camp as well. The camp site has a bar and restaurant on site so you’ll have to walk 200 meters for a cold beer.

name: Sheep Valley
description:
Nice and leveled spot along a river not far from the road in a meadow. If you're lucky you'll see the shepherd bringing down his sheep herd.
Bad cellphone service ;)

name: Huts/open camping area in hills to the nth of Lake Trasimeno
description:
Huts with open area for camping and RV park ups, run by local authority, though huts were closed up in August. Free/not attended site with lots of space, picnic tables and water. Overlooks the lake, a few miles east. Shop/bar in Portole, 5mins drive west. V quiet. BBQ with wood/firelighters for use.

Road currently 09/20 in bad condition. 4WD / high clearance access only

name: Castelo Tuoro with a view to the Lago Trasimeno
description: a beautiful location, on a lonely road to the Castel.  The castle is vacant and is currently  not used.  The position is level, a seldom used dirt road leads to this position on the hill.  Nature, peaseful and a i view of the valley and lake.  Thank you God for this pitch in the middle of the crowded tourist area.

name: Camping Villa Doria
description:
Small campsite run by one family with total of 50 pitches.
In the surroundings there are woods and hiking tracks, only 10 minutes away from Supermarket etc.. !
Is accept tent and caravans.

name: Huge parking spot next to the beach
description: This is a huge parking spot next to the beach (public and private places). It costs 4€ for 24hrs of parking depending on the season of the year. You will find some beach restaurants/bars that offer also hot showers for 2€ (and Spritz drinks for 5€ + potato chips). The place can receive campers and cars. Very quiet and peaceful. (Police passes by just to make sure).

name: Wildcamping Hidden Next to Road
description: Small spot for one car just off the road. Out of sight, magnificent views. Bit Rocky road but don't think a 4x4 or high clearance car is needed.

name: San Leo Camper Parking Area
description: This is a Camper Parking area next to San Leo city/castle. You can stop also cars to sleep in. Free of charge! You will find free bathrooms & water. If you are in a var/truck, you can park inside the city to visit, and come back to this area to sleep. Inside San Leo city there is only $$$ parking areas (1€ per 1h).

name: On-The-Beach (Via Lungomare) Parking
description: Camper and Car parking. Awesome beach, beautifully calm and clean (with lifeguards also). Beach with rocks! Campers parking with no height limit. Car parking with max of 1.90m. Car parking is 3€ 24hrs (you can find a lot of bars and restaurants on the main road)

name: picnic area Boschi del Giovetto
description: Picnic area near the road with parking. Availability of water toilets. There is also a barbecue area.

name: Shore of the lake
description: Beatifull place at 1 meter from the water! Following the track along the shore of the lake you have different places to build your tent. A lot of people camping there in spite of there is "official campings" near. We ask locals if it was possible to camp there and they told us that shouldn't be problem if you only pass the night.

name: Sandy Parking Spot
description: Good parking spot for one night beside the street.

name: Tresnuraghes
description:
Idyllic spot, right on the sea rocks overlooking two “private” beaches. Majestic waves create a unique sounding experience. Swimming can be challenging if sea is not perfectly calm as shallow water and rocky surfaces creates turbulent entry. Not a single light can be visible during night. 
Absolutely stunning. 

Some cellular data here and there, comes and goes. 

Be aware: 4X4 only with some technical sections

name: Olia Speciosa/L’Annunziata
description: Source of drinking water. Free, fresh, tasty. Stone wall and steps down to the spring.

name: Dorgali
description: Drinking water dispenser. Normal 5 cent/litre, cold 6, sparkling 7.

name: Bosa
description:
Amazing place, quiet and calm. There are no facilities, the camping is free and possible for caravans and tends. It is possible to sleep on flat rocks or flat ground. There are other people around, but the place is huge so it is not a problem.
There is a little van bar that opens in the morning.

name: Secluded spot on the Alcantara River
description: Park here and you can explore a less visited spot of the Alcantara river. Beautiful gorges and calm river to take a swim. Walk upstream for 50m and you’ll find a a spot with crystal clear waters and rounded rocks to relax and take a dip.

name: Nonna Rosa Agriturismo
description: Really well established place next to everything in Matera. It has everything (power, bathrooms and everything you expect from a Camper parking). Stayed there 2 nights paying €28 (August). Really well maintained!

name: F.lli Ziarelli Gomme Srl - Driver Center Pirelli
description: Fantastic place and highly recommended - very helpful and a good price. I needed a new rear tyre for my motorbike in the middle of a my trip, which they were able to order that morning; it arrived and was fitted the next day very quickly, exactly when booked it. They also helped repair my brake light, for free. I don’t speak Italian but the guys were very happy to help using Google Translate. Stock a range of tyres not just Pirelli, despite the name.

name: Bar Mediterraneo
description: Not only a Bar, also pasticeria with high quality. Ask also for a camping Place in Frascineto, nice Place, calm Nest the Highway.

name: On the lake side
description: Close to the road (white and dusty) with medium traffic and very busy in high season. In any case, a very pleasant stop two meters from the water.  Gently bathing lake, sandy with meters of shallow water. Around people intent on various bucolic activities (fishing, walking with the dog, picnic).  Mirrored sunrise over the lake is recommended.

name: Directly on the beach - great for the night before the ferry
description: Great spot for the night before boarding the ferry.  Crowded but gorgeous beach.  Be careful not to park directly on the sand because the Coast Guard warns the Forestry.  In any case, several stops are available, including shaded ones.  Fairly accessible road.  For 4x4s a walk in the park.  Take your trash with you.

name: One night only parking
description: this is a private parking spot next to the beach. It costs 10€ a night. This is a private spot. Very noisy because one of the main roads pass next by, but is is really handy to stay all day and go to the beach (NOT SO CLEAN BTW). You will find lots of bars and restaurants just some meters away. Vou can take bath on them. The parking is really raw and with no infrastructure. You are just going to be in a closed parking lot for one night stand. On the entrance you will find a man that will get you the ticket to stay. He will communicate to his boss that you will stay there (to avoid any police problem), and that's it. We stayed here just because it was dark and we where tired. Stayed just for the beach at night (gorgeous) and to rest for the other day.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz am See
description:
There are two places right beside each other. First on the left is an established campground, full hookups.

100 mts further down the road you will find the place described here.

RV Parking next to lake. 10€/night.
Simple partially shaded place. 17 spaces, first come, first served.
No amenities.
Restaurant with toilet facilities nearby (250mts), shower 3€.

name: Welsberg Train Station
description: Gravel parking lot next to railway station. Space for 15-20 Rigs. Free. No signs. When we arrived, there were like 10-12 other RVs.

name: EDEN
description:
Small campsite perfect for motorcycle travelers, old but really authentic owner. In the evening you should trust the cook and eat with you.

Kleiner Zeltplatz für Motorradreisende perfekt, alt aber echt authentisch Besitzer. Am Abend sollte man dem Koch vertrauen und unbedingt mitessen.

name: Cascate del Mulino
description: This is a free parking place next to the Cascate del Mulino. Only cars with height 2.10m can enter. The place is full of people camping and enjoying the thermal water. They stay late at night but the parking lot and the camping area is quiet. Inside the complex, you will find a restaurant with bathrooms. For the campers, they stay on the road (far).

name: Pianeta Benessere (B&B)
description: Comfortable bed & breakfast to spend a peaceful night. The rooms are rustic, some of them have private bathrooms. They have wifi and free parking (on the road in front of the location, so it is in a public place for parking). The rooms have air conditioning, and at least the one we took, had also kitchen. 40€ a night (while COVID, they where not doing breakfast).

name: Water next the washing street
description: free water near zur washing street. slow but free

name: Camp Natisone Pulfero
description: Small unexpensive camp near river Natisone. Nearby is restaurant Rio Bianco

name: Grassy Area
description:
A large grassy area with a beautiful view! Just next to the woods. There are no facilities at all. The police drove by in the late afternoon but didn't say anything. Locals came to watch the sundown. We stayed one night in the car. 
It's a bit of a drive from the main road, but if you have time and love the forest, it's absolutely worth it! Please take your rubbish and toilet paper, the forest can't handle it.

name: RV Park Panzano
description:
Gravel RV Park in the small village of Panzano. Beautiful view in the morning over the hills. A bit of streetlight but quiet!
We put a tent on the gravel, it's flat so it's possible.

name: La Sorgente
description:
Located in the Val Veny. Some boulders and trees around which gives it a nice atmosphere. There was a kitchen, pool, climbing wall, playground. Maybe some more to keep kids occupied. Also bicycle rental was possible I think. 

Quiet location. Hiking trails are located in the valley. It was also possible to rent rooms and huts. 

It is possible to take the bus from and to the campsite from the road Ss26. Probably also from Courmayeur. 

The owner is a touring cyclist which might be beneficial for other touring cyclists. No guarantees.

name: Parking with a view lake Iseo
description: It is a official parking area for about 6-8 cars on the hill. Not suitable for big campers. On the opposite side of the small street there is a Picknick area with water, barbeque grill, tables and a dixi-toilet.

name: Finestra sui monti
description: I come with my motorcycle. Is close the main road. There is a fountain 3 minutes by walk.close to Madonna della pietà.

name: Po Camp Area
description: Free Camp Area at the Po. Place for big rigs. Water for free.

name: Pic nic site
description: Pic nic site by the side of the road in a pine tree wood, perfect for cyclists with a tent. The area is not super clean, it's used as a toilet by people passing by but still better then nothing. Pic nic tables and trash bins.

name: Gretl am See
description: Parking Lot wich belongs to the campsite Gretl am See. Nice for one or two nights. You can use the facilities of the campground. Mostly grassy with some trees. Cost 25 Euro per night incl. eletricity and water. Nice swimmig at Kalderer See  Restaurants just 5 minutes walk away.

name: monterosso hills
description:
Parking lot on the side of the road with very low traffic at night.
The terrain is quit rocky and there are roughly 8 car/van spaces (probably less suited for very long vehicles). No height restrictions.
20 meters down the road you have a beautiful view of the sea (accessible by foot)

name: Turnout beside Road
description:
Fairly level turnout on the side of the road. 
Very quiet at night, maybe 2 or 3 cars passing.
Good for one night.
In the Morning, a local came by an went to collect mushrooms. Didn’t bother.
Several more usable turnouts along this road.

name: Verona free WiFi zone
description: Free WiFi zone near the park. Called Verona free WiFi

name: Wild camp on the mountain
description: Wild camp spot on the mountain, can be reached from the top of the mountain. (San zeno). The road starts tarred, but goes into gravel for a short while. Than bad tarred road. It’s steep, over 15% downhill. High clearance important. Downhill the road crosses a olive farm. So after staying and you want to follow your way down you have 2.5 m roof clearance.

name: Grass - Riverside
description: Flat grassy spot besides the river, little bumpy rocky road up here

name: Cinque torri circuit & 1st world war Museum
description: You can drive up all the way to the rifugio cinque torri (max car height 2.5 m). From the parking and from the trails around cinque torri you get a stunning 360 degrees view. Beautiful. Very interesting, there's a free round trail with trenches and rebuilt hides from the 1st world war, even with puppet soldiers - cute. There are lots of information signs with stories from the war between austrians and italians. And then the view... Very recommended! (Sorry about the photos, they've been taken from the parking lot - there's much better views to be appreciated!)

name: Camping Steiner
description: Nice place, everything is clean, restaurant, mini store with beer and small goods, 2 pools (one indoor), wifi and a decent amount of trees. Not really our type of place (it was packed) but it worked as a base for riding the mountains for 2 days. We paid 30€ per night for 1 tent, 2 motos

name: Riverside - near San Marino
description: On the river close to San Marino. There are two paths leading to the river which has almost no water in August. Here you are not visible from the road. Views to Montebello and to San Marino

name: Bevagna
description: Not the sexiest nor the wildest but very close to Bevagna old town, just outside the walls. Trees and grass, fairly shaded. Just a little asphalt road on the side. Perfect for a rainy day. And it’s free!

name: Il Mattino ha l'oro in Bocca B&B
description: Lovely little hotel with about 6 rooms. Price was €45 for 2 people and dogs were free. Breakfast included. Walking distance to the town centre. very friendly staff and simple continental breakfast with boiled eggs, cheese and cold meats with toast available, but all you can eat so we left now than satisfied. Highly recommended if you are after a break, especially if you've been wild camping a bit. Street parking only but in a safe area so not an issue. Phone or WhatsApp to book is easiest although the price may be better on booking.com, we called to ensure the dogs would not cost extra. phone number is: +39 050 542769

name: Mercuragio lagoon
description: Just for cyclists and walkers. You can camp at this place for one night. It's a national park but there's no signs saying that it's forbidden to camp (just no fire). Some people walking or cycling until 8pm, then completely calm.

name: Area Camper
description: Small place by the beach for campers and tents. Short term parking. There is a bar, toilettes and an outside shower. We could pitch the tent just by the beach. The bar plays cool music until midnight and opens in the morning. Otherwise super quiet. And cheap.

name: Caravan park
description:
Perfect spot for campervan, cyclists. little playground with parking, picnic area and space for tents. Near a breathtaking little beach with cave. If you need a free camp around don't look any further.
Restaurant on the other side of the road

name: Sardegna
description: A  parking place with wonderful view over the sea! During the night it's quiet, it isnt allowed to camp but to park (you can't build up tends, washing lines ect. or else the police is going to send you away) if we only slept in the camper we had no problems.

name: Water Filling Next to Park
description: You can fill up your water here, you have the choice between still (5 cent for a litre) and sparkling water (7 cents). It is a little blue cabin next to the big park.

name: Camp directly by the sea
description: A nice camping spot at a dead end road by the sea with a beautiful view on an old tower but many mosquitos.

name: Cascata di Alfero
description: Beautiful waterfall, for free. Don't trust maps.me for the coordinates, we got in trouble with that. Depending from which side you arrive, drive either from Mazzi in direction of Alfero or from Alfero to Mazzi. Next to the road there's a big gravel parking lot and a sign for Cascata. Then walk 600 m down to the water. Good to have lunch and relax.

name: Il Serchio Camping
description: If you are using this app then you will find this place to be fine (unlike Camp4Night which gave it bad reviews). What I like most is there are huge trees (shade from the sun) and each small pitch is surrounded by thick tall bushes, has water and electric (RV style only) unlike the other camps in town which is camping in a field). This is a no frills place, no pool, WiFi is OK, there is a cafe with beer/coffee/snacks, toilets are clean (no toilet paper for some reason) and you can walk to town. Unlike the other nearby camps, we are allowed to tent camp here. 2 motos/2 people/1 tent was 25€. The guy working is super nice and speaks perfect English, they close the gate at 8pm for check in but you are then allowed to stay 24hr no matter what time you arrive. Also a BBQ area and pavillion, washing machines and sinks for dishes.

name: Vallicciola
description: The place is very crowded during the day, but when the sun sets every body move away. There is plenty of space between the trees for tents and the parking lot is fitted for vans and campers. Fresh water is available on site.

name: Torre Argentina
description: Very big spot near the sea. Plenty of space for tents, vans and campers. this spot use to be an old camping ground. entry fee are 5 Euros for a car between 7am to 7pm.

name: Parco Cultural Giuseppe Dessi
description: Picnic spot with water under big trees. It's a little near a road but the place is fine for a camper or a tent

name: Laundry point
description: Laundromat with three washing mashines (2 for 9 kilo and 1 for 14 kilo) and two dryers. Open 8 a.m. to 22 p.m. You can ONLY pay with 1 euro coins and the changing machine is currently out of order. There was only the big one free and we paid 7 Euro for 40 minutes.

name: International Blu Camping
description: big camp, lots of big trees for shade, nice small black sand beach, restaurant/bar, pool, nice toilets (although no seats in men's room? or toilet paper). 9€ per person + tourist tax, we paid 22€ for 2 people/2 motos/1 tent. wifi is €5 per day, lol. washing machines too!

name: Parking Lago Artificiale di Cancano
description: 5 Euro parking fee for whole day, after season nobody else there ..

name: Masua
description: place for campers  and big rigs near the beach.

name: Parking lot with view on Castelsardo
description: A nice little parking lot 20min by feet from Castelsardo with a beautiful view on the city. It has a little beach in front of it with very few people.

name: Spot hidden in the fields
description: Great spot in between the fields. You need to pass through a gravel road. This spot noted is the higher bank of the river, think it floats in winter. Farmer past us a few times didn’t say anything, quiet night! Peaceful and clean!

name: Suviana Camping
description:
Nice Campground with access to the Lake. The tent sites are below big trees. The sanitary house is not new but clean. There is a place for barbecue and a restaurant/pizzeria. At this time of the year it was quiet. Just a few other guests.
You can drive the motorcycle close to the tent over a little wooden bridge.

name: Agripassione
description:
Agriculture of Vegetables and Fruits
Place to stay on the Green Field
only for Campers and small Trucks. Electricity available

name: Riverside
description: In the riverbed, beautiful location. Access via a narrow track. Lots of space, clean water for swimming. Quiet. Some locals dog walking and swimming but all friendly. Need 4x4 to drive onto riverbed. If heavy rain, the river rises.

name: Camp spot next to beach
description:
Public Beach with plenty parking lots. You have a view over the sea and there are public, free showers and toilets. If you want a warm shower you can ask the bar keeper of "borgo rena" and he will give you a coin for 1€.
It's a busy Road nearby, so it's not so quiet at night.
Officially not allowed for Caravans, but there are many People with smaller vans.

name: Valentano large Parking
description: Large Parkingplace, 10 Minutes walk to center of village

name: Nice parking spot near geothermal park
description:
Little parking lot 5 minutes from the geothermal park of Biancane.
Parking is free, we spent a very quiet night in our van here. There is even a toilet with running water.

name: Lago campotosto
description: Is a fantastic place. All around the lake there are many places to set up the tent, camper, car, etc.

name: Legend Bike
description: Motorcycle mechanic with a big workshop and will work on any type of motorbike. The owner is well traveled around the world and really a nice guy.

name: Big Parking Chiavari Alloraa
description: Big Free parking lot, for Caravanes, no facilities, with sea view, behind soccer field. Keep the place clean. Quiet place for 1 night.

name: Cultural Adventure Park
description: Free parking under trees beside the road . If you like to enter ask the office.

name: Chappel above Villa Romana del Casale
description: Quite parking beside a chappel on the hill close by the Villa Romana del Casale.

name: Lonely place close to a lake
description: Lovely place where you only meet fisher men, farmers and mosquitos. Access by narrow, very steep but paved road.

name: Free parking at harbour
description: If you have a coffee in the nearby restaurant and ask they let you stay there over night for free.  Quite at night.

name: Trattoria Iolanda
description: REAL south italian cuisine with original dishes from salento. AND italian prices (not touristic). The service is maybe a bit chaotic, but the place is really nice. Very recommended.

name: sorgente
description:
Well with fresh cold Water.
nothing Mode top say about this place

name: Grotte del Vento
description: Nice and absolute quite place on the parking area of the "Grotta del Vento". It is official allowed to stay for one night after / before your visit.

name: Lago dell' Accesa
description: Very nice and quite place with some shadow next to a beautiful lake with clear water.

name: near Fonteblanda
description:
Nice campground without any comfort. Very quite and the costs are ok (12€ / 24h).
Directly on the beach.

name: Parking ground next to Vesuv
description: Quite Parking area with beautiful view on Napoli right under the Vesuv

name: Parking place near Grottas
description:
Quite and lonely place- good for one night at the parking area of the "Grotte di Pertosa-Auletta".
5€ during day, we paid at night nothing

name: IL COCCO Agricampeggio
description: Il Cocco is a famous winery in Tuscany close to Montalcino that offers their yard as a place for campers and caravans. 12€ per night when we visited in low season. Closed from end October until spring. Very nice place in the middle of the vineyard under pine trees. Water is available, shower was closed when we visited. Toilet of the restaurant can be used by campers. Offers wine tastings and wine selling as well.

name: Hostel Stelvio
description: Good and affordable Hostel with big private apartments. Very clean and super friendly host. For motorbikes there is a shelter and garage... Recommended!!!

name: La Lavandera - Self Service Laundry
description: Easy laundry, close to the cemetery parking lot (1.7km), payed 4€ (7,5kg machine, 7€ 13kg), 5€ to dry

name: Gargano Vieste
description: very nice free camper on headland.  easily accessible over a sandy path / rocks.

name: Camping green village
description: Nice campground with a lot of space, shadow, swimming pool and a beautiful view of Assisi! We paid 22 for persons and a tent

name: Conad 24h fuel station
description: Cheapest fuel station for all of North West of Sardinia all the way till Orosei.

name: Oasi di Seu parking
description: Allowed to camp overnight for €6,-, also paid parking during the day in high season. Bins available and two restaurants that are open during the season. Lovely for hiking in not much visited nature.

name: Thermal baths Fordongianus
description: Possibility to camp wild, soak in the baths (either in the riverbanks or modern bathhouse a little further down the road). Nice roman ruins of the bathhouse can be visited as well. Toilet available during opening hours of the bar.

name: Il Ruscello agricampeggio
description: RV park close to the beaches near Porto Pina. Paid €18,- for two all-in. Laundry possible for €4,-.

name: Cretto di Burri
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Needs confirmation by users since generally forbidden

Just follow the small road to the flat grass field. Good for overnight stay. Be aware wild camping is not allowed in Italy.

name: Nice camping spots close to the sea
description: You can find some spots for camping around, just follow the way down, very close to the sea. Some locals are here for climbing at the rocks nearby. Few campers were around, but here is a lot of space. Could be crowded in high season, but it was perfect in October. Just a but windy. If you follow the path you can also find a little pool, where you can go swimming.

name: Santa Maria In Punta
description: Car parking next to the church provided by the town. Very quiet. Next to a nature reserve - Birds and Beavers! Dumping station but water had been turned off - October.

name: Field near woods
description: We stayed on this field at a street, somewhat hidden behind bushes, great view to the mountains, very quiet during the night, just a few cars during day. Outstanding sky in the night with thousand stars.

name: B&B Il Vicoletto
description: Nice and clean, the Lady prepares breakfast with oven-baked cakes just delicious. Place close to Parco Nazionale d’Abruzzo.

name: La Ghiacciaia
description:
Very nice Restaurant. Friendly Staff. 5 Stars

You get your Food pretty fast even on crowded Sundays when all the Locals eat Here. 

The Seafood is amazing, the Pasta is tasty and even the Salads fill you Up. We ate Here several Times and were Happy all the time.

name: Riverbed near ss125
description: quiet Place in a dry riverbed. 2 km easy Offroad. very quiet. all Kinds of Campers fit Here.

name: Area Sosta Vorea
description:
Good campground. Only 2km from Highway Exit Frascineto. Very calm, flat Place also for big rigs.
Toilets under Construction

name: Monte cucco water fountain
description: Push button water fountain still in use October.

name: Parking above Assisi
description: A flat, piece of ground with views of valley below. No restrictions. Free. Quiet out of season.

name: Unrestricted free parking
description: Parking just outside the walls of Montefalco overlooking olive groves. Quiet.  5 min walk to main square with restaurants and bars. 2 mins walk to supermarket. Slightly sloping site. No restrictions. Please keep clean to keep it so. Recycling bins but no other facilities.

name: Borgano
description: Wonderful, quiet car park on the Spoleto to Norcia cycleway, disused railway. (mountain bikes) No restrictions. Water fountain by disused railway station building in the car park.

name: montefalcone
description: not wild just a car park in town behind church

name: Portonovo Torre Car park
description: Large gravel car park a minute from the beach. Views of green hills behind. Exclusive restaurant on beach. Free and quiet out of season. We stayed October. It seems summer camper parking costs 8am to 6pm €9. There is an expensive nearby campsite if facilities are what you require.

name: Camping Da Ciccio Parking
description: Nice campsite near the beach in Tropea. Costs are 17€ in low seasion. Shower 0,5€ extra.

name: Parking lot Corniglia
description:
Parking beside the street for free. A small parking lot on a leveled plattform, where you have to pay at daytime: 10€/day. 
From 8 p.m. to 8 a.m. it´s for free.
Two minutes walking time to the beautiful village and one minute walking distance to the entry gate for the famous hiking trail.
No traffic at night, webcam controll and illuminated at night.

name: Soccer field. San Rocco al Porto
description: Graveled parking lot in front of a sport field. No charge, quiet at night and maybe you can ask at the soccer club for a shower :)

name: Parking Ancona
description: An official motor home parking with a nice view to the city and harbor.

name: Alpe Pala
description: Very nice wild camp site . The road ends here, like a parking lot . Plenty of fresh water, picnic tables and a fire place with lots of wood .

name: Summit of Mount San Primo
description: I slept in a tent, the ground is grassy. If you find the right place you are also sheltered from the wind. Beautiful panorama of Lake Como, as well as sunrise and sunset. There is no water, no trees, no shrubs.

name: Drinking fountain
description: Drinking water fountain in the city center

name: Meadow in the countryside
description: Large flat grassy lawn in the middle of the countryside, reachable on foot or by car via dirt roads. A quiet place in the area, only people with their dog go by.

name: Boschettona Beach
description: Small parking lot at the end of a dirt road. During the day there we're a lot of hikers and fishermen. In the evening it was very quiet.

name: Cemetery
description: I slept in this cemetery (thankfully open) on a stormy night under the only small porch there was. Entering, if you pass in front of the cemetery chapels, there is a fountain and a lawn hidden from view. Respect the place, there are no signs prohibiting sleeping there. Alternatively there is free public parking outside the cemetery, where you can put your vehicle for the night.

name: Open space in forest
description:
Open space in forest, at the end of a dirt road. From the main road, it's a small climb on the dirt road, so it's not suited for all cars, but a 4x4 is not really necessary.
There's a nice big area to park. 
In the morning one other car parked beside us, but left us alone.

name: NostraTerra Camping
