description: Small, very quiet and nice campground. Very friendly and helpful owners. Costs are 15 - 25€ for a camper and two persons depending in the season.

name: P Martinsicuro
description:
Good Park , no noise , sea and beach 1km
Parking in front of the park for children, semi-shaded, quiet, beach 1km away

Parking face aux parc pour les enfants, mi-ombragé, calme, plage a 1km

name: Vertibo therme
description:
Big parking spot close to the therme. There were 4 other campers when we slept here.
It was crowded in the evening, but it calmed down in the night

name: Forest camping
description: There is a nice camping spot next to a good conditioned gravel road in the 'bosco della ficuzza'. there is also a fire pit. there were some cars passing by but they were all very friendly. some cows are walking around. it's a good place for one night.

name: Winery and Hotel Valdonica
description: Ask the very nice owner, and I am sure he will offer you a Place for little money. Taste and buy the wounderfull wine of Valdonica

name: shepherd's lake
description: Very idyllic place with many tables and fire pits. There are many different possibilities where you can put your vehicle or tent. It's a quiet place in nature near a lake. to enter you have to open a fence (and close it). in the morning and in the evening there are sheeps on this ground. the shepherd is very friendly and likes to chat. when it rained a lot the street is quite muddy but there are different paths.

name: Lago di Gúsana
description: Amazing camping spot direct at the beach. You exit the main road next to the bridge. If you head right there is enough space for big rigs with picknick area, head left and follow a little dirt road around the beach to reach a flat grassy spot as the pictures show, vans/2wd ok. Very quiet, nobody bothered us, we stayed two nights.

name: Corinaldo Free Overnight Camper Parking
description: Hard standing 25 mins from Ancona Ferry Terminal. Free. Quite. Safe. Water. Dump. Electricity.

name: Tagliolo Monferrato
description: Aire beneath the castle surrounded by trees.

name: Former Campsite
description: Former Campsite with barrier, use big parking outside. Two other people walking by in two days. Old buildings a few hundred meters away. Very clean, keep it clean. Also good for big vehicles.

name: E.M.
description: It is a public water fountain, it should be drinkable. A universal adapter is required to connect the hose.

name: E.M.
description: It is the parking lot in front of the cemetery and it is quiet. It's free.

name: Cosmos Logistics
description:
Cosmos Logistics 

Vehicle shipping from Italy to anywhere in the world. 

We shipped from here to Alexandria 
&
We shipped back here from Namibia 

Very professional and we got very good prices! 

Massimo was our contact, his details are below;

Massimo
—— 
COSMOS Logistics
tel: +39 0586 892072 / 839066 
mobile: +39 3282120483
Email: massimo@cosmoslogistics.com



Via dei Pelaghi 208, 57124 Livorno

name: Camping del Turco
description:
Nice camping with a lot shadow spaces, for big and small rigs. Ok for tents too. Very clean (toilet clean but no paper) and nice people. 100m from the sea and 20min walking from Vieste. 33,50euros for two people, a tent and a car.
Recommended !

name: Near Lake
description: very nice place... situated nearby the lake and nearby a bar restaurant... enough space  for some cars...

name: Stella Mare Camping
description: Nice Campsite at a hill with mostly seaview. Nearby a nice sandy beach. Clean sanitary rooms, a little shop and a restaurant.

name: Escolca, campo sportivo
description: Designated for Campers. Great view. Rural idyll. Big flat area with 5 concreted surfaces. Power and water at the coin-operated tap dispenser.

name: Ferramenta
description:
Hardware store that also sells propane.
.....
Negozio di ferramenta che vende anche propano.

name: Area de servizio
description:
Gas station with 24h open toilets.
Clean and safe

name: Camping spot
description: As not many places around, this is a nice spot to camp. You will hear the traffic but you are not visible from the road.

name: Bosco quarto / piscina pantolfe
description: Beautiful spot in the middle of the NP, very quiet, great view. Follow the tarmac road and then for 1.5 kms a gravel road. Next to the sign (see picture) is a flat place to park

name: Camping Bosco Selva
description: Nice camping just outside town. Car and one person 15 euro. They give you a map of town. Wifi very good. Its a little over 1 km walking to the beginning of the old town.

name: Monza Camping
description:
Small campground right at the racetrack. 
Lots of trees for shade.

name: pô riverside
description:
Really great spot next to the river. Nobody around. Lot of different spot. High clearance needed for this one but you can find other places near with an rv.
You have to take some unpaved road to find it. 
Be careful with the river if it rain to much.

name: Fountain / Fonte Pirola
description: Fresh water (Fonte Pirola) on the SS125 from Gala Gonone to Baunei - 2 minutes walk from the road there is a picnic area with a fountain (spring water out of the mountain).

name: Onda Azzura
description: Big campsite with restaurant, shop, washingmachines etc directly at the beach. Lot of regular guests so not sure in high season free places will be available. About 1 km away there is another campsite but at the moment closed due to corona.

name: Sky life
description: Great place for a lunch, a sandwich, snack, sweets, icecream or a drink.

name: Camping Costa splendente
description: Large but bit basic camping site close to the ocean. Good wifi. Car with one person is euro 11,30. Its a short walk into town and only 2 minutes to a supermarket where they sell bread

name: Near Siponto
description:
On a parallel road to the Adriatica Highway. Before Siponto, on the left side, you enter a small dirt road just 20 meters before the bridge that crosses the channel.
Go some 300 meters. There are some ruins and many flat and clean places before you reach the beach. 3 minutes walking to the ocean but you can swim in the channel.

name: Petacciato Beach
description:
Nice place just at the shore.
Flat.
A little noisy because it's near the highway.
Small dirt road some 200 meters right from the parking lot.

name: Near Marmiollo
description:
On the banks of the water channel. You can choose either side. There are nice places on both sides of the Goitto Highway.
Go 300 m só you stay far from the highway.

name: Gran caffee winebar
description: Great place for a lunch, a sandwich, snack, sweets, icecream or a drink.

name: Pentedattilo lookout
description: A short walk uphill from the parking for a beautiful view on the surrounding mountains, the ocean and Sicily.

name: Dinnammare santuario
description: Spectacular views in all directions and a wonderful drive towards this place.

name: old football field
description:
Quiet place next to the city.

It's an old football ground. Parking and sleeping for free.

name: fonte Gemma
description: water free near lake endine accessible for all

name: Campsite Marmaruca
description: Definitely not the nicest campsite and straight under the motorway so a lot of noise but good for one night. Toilets and showers well maintained and clean. If you go to the beach you’ll see a nice boulevard and square, good for a diner or a drink.

name: Lo Scoglio
description: Nice campsite right on the beach, but rocky, not sandy. Its quiet, you don’t hear the traffic. They also have a few rooms to rent.

name: LUA beach
description:
In walking distance to the ancient town of Catania, 

There are shops, access to the beach, campsite (gravel, lawn) sunny or shady under huge palm trees, depending on your needs, no size limit for vehicles 

Price in 2021 is 17 EUR and includes electricity, water and disposal, toilets and showers available (free use) price reduction for longer stays 

large beach bar with 2 pools on the beach, use including sun loungers: 5 EUR / person and day 

Bathing in the sea is officially prohibited, but hardly anyone cares about that on the public beach, just to mention it here. 

The owner, Carlo is incredibly friendly and helpful. After a complete fire in 2019, which destroyed the whole campground he is in the process of painstakingly rebuilding this beautiful and optimally located camper space. So folks: Go to camp at LUA beach as Carlo will be finish the rebuilding the faster the more guests are coming :-) 

Additional info: During the summer months from June to August there is a disco at the beach bar on Saturdays and Sundays, so there is partytime until 5:00 a.m. 
Additional info 2: If the white gate at the entrance is closed: just open it, come in and reclose it

name: La Palma
description: Bit outdated campsite but nice people, nice location and great (sandy) beach. You can order fresh bread.

name: LUA beach
description:
In walking distance to the ancient town of Catania.There are shops, access to the beach, campsite (gravel, lawn) sunny or shady under huge palm trees, depending on your needs, no size limit for vehicles
Price in 2021 is 17 EUR and includes electricity, water and disposal, toilets and showers available (free use) price reduction for longer stays

Large beach bar with 2 pools on the beach, use includes sun loungers: 5 EUR / person and day. Bathing in the sea is officially prohibited, but hardly anyone cares about that on the public beach, just to mention it here.

The owner, Carlo is incredibly friendly and helpful. After a complete fire in 2019, which destroyed the whole campground he is in the process of painstakingly rebuilding this beautiful and optimally located camper space. So folks: Go to camp at LUA beach as Carlo will be finish the rebuilding the faster the more guests are coming :-)

Additional info: During the summer months from June to August there is a disco at the beach bar on Saturdays and Sundays, so there is partytime until 5:00 a.m.

If the white entrance gate is closed: just open it, come in and reclose it.

name: Camping la Breva
description: Nice campsite right at the lake of Como. Friendly owners, nice & clean showers & bathrooms.

name: Camping spot at mount Amiata's feet
description: Wild camping spot nearby Val d'Orcia and Mount Amiata. There is a small picnic site with a fireplace and parking. After few meters, a small path heading just under the terrace opens up on a perfect hidden wild camping spot .

name: Field
description: Wild camping next to the vineyard and close to the famous Saturnia wild thermal pools “Cascate del Mulino”.

name: Cappelletta Alpe Erfo
description:
A few spots for vans, you can find some grass to pitch a tent hidden from the main road. Water is available, and tables for pic nic. 
The road can be narrow, big vans will struggle, the gps had us pass through small villages.

name: Wild camping close to Saturnia in the vineyard
description: A field next to the vineyard very close to Saturnia village. Quiet and no noise. Good for tents or 4x4 campers.

name: Overnight Stop near Verona
description: Quiet place, just to sleep overnight, nothing else. Clean and little Pizzeria nor far away

name: Stazzema Alpe Appennino
description: 100*100m , for Overlander perfekt one Night

name: Amanti del Mare
description: Nice camping but only space for 10 vehicles. Enough spots for tents. You can also rent fully equipped cabins. Direct access to the beach.

name: Spot in the orchards
description:
A small space off of the road, right by a climbing spot. With a toilet and a creek with water out of a pipe. Someone drank from it, so we also did. Seems okay :-). 
In the morning we got woken up quite early by trucks driving past to some factory somewhat down the road.

name: My Way Bad and Breakfast (motorbike friendly)
description:
Good place to stay (payed 30€) via booking it is a little bit more expensive. Motorbikes can stay inside the gates. Otherwise save parking around the corner. Should be enough space for like 4 GS or likewise. City center is 10 minutes away by bike or just use the bus that holds in front of the house. Michael is also a very nice and helpful. +393284681169 mywaypisa@gmail.com (WhatsApp). 

Has air condition, coffee, hot showers and fast internet… Just don’t expect the “breakfast” to be very big. It’s more like a morning snack…

name: Railway bridge
description: If you get caught by rain, this is a nice camp under a railway bridge hidden from the street. Fits a motorbike plus tent. Short gravel road to get there. Hourly trains stop during night.  Small and only 2 m high, so not for vans.

name: Artisan Pup with free Wifi
description:
Good pup with WiFi. With some luck you find nearby parking: Passwort = beerlovers 
(Has good beer too of course)

name: Vila ST. Lorenzo Hotel (motorbike friendly)
description: Stayed here for 5 days. Cost 35€ per night excl. breakfast. 4€ city tax extra per day. It has a parking area for a few cars and some motorbikes. Had a huge bed in a kind of dark room - but for the money it was good value. Bigger cars might not fit so call them in advance. The close area has some very good restaurants and bars that are quite cheap. Next Metro is a 15 Minute walk away. Tram Station like 5 Minutes. Felt very safe here and could enjoy my stay… So recommended! :-)

name: Panilanda - simple food Hut…
description: Found this place by accident while riding to the volcano at night. Has awesome burgers and with a quick bite… loved the experience! Didn’t expect something like this at all at this spot!

name: Pizza e farinata
description:
Very good pizza, nice owner, no bathroom.
We got 4 slices of pizza and 2 foccacia for 9 euros.

name: Colle de Lis
description:
On a big parking lot at a monument.
Two restaurants on walk distance.
A great walking area.

name: Cammping Rio Vaiano
description: We paid 10€ per person for one night. The owner is nice. Bar open during the day. The place was quiet as there were not many people on the site. Ping pong table and volleyball on grass available. View on the mountains. Hot water, showers, toilets, electricity, but no wi-fi. Several tables and benches. I personally recommand.

name: Klobstein
description: A parking near sport field and Esso petrol just for a night. Free.

name: Fountain
description: Small fountain with drinkable water situated at the head of a forest road.

name: Oasi
description: Nice caravan parking lot at the seaside. The owner is very nice and helped us and offered a bike to go buy groceries since we had to park immediately. Showers work with coins. The bar is open until midnight but still pretty quiet. Mainly families and older people. Fried fish on the weekend, bread, mozzarella and vegetables daily.

name: Beach
description: Parking lot by the beach. We were there for one night, no shade but great view. Height limitation: 2 m. We have a small rig. We spent the night close to 2 big rigs which parked outside of the lot.

name: Near Paragliding Place
description:
Really nice spot near the lake, big meadow for the paraglider to land. 

We spent a good night here, lots of space.

name: Near Venice
description: Free parking near Venice, (Max 3h, no camping written.)

name: Montanara 6km West Mantova
description:
Between cemetery and corn field a large parking quiet half km village
water cemetery

name: Vigorso
description:
in front an old church half destroyed a place good to stay one night 
After 8.30pm traffic zéro the sing of insects good for sleeping

name: Gran Collina Winery
description:
We were here with the motorbikes and had a double room. They have place for campers as well, tents i dont know. 

Very nice winery were you can get dinner for 30euros with wine tasting and 3 starters, one main course and a dessert.

Breakfast is also possible for 8 euro.

name: Area Sosta Sansepolcro
description: In a central area, easy parking for oversize RV, free, potable water, black/grey water discharge. 5 minutes to the center.

name: Water tap for motorhomes
description:
Water tap for fresh potable water. Locals travel to come to this tap.

There are two taps, one is slower for more control, the other is much faster for larger containers.

name: Corte Canale Virgilio
description:
Farm Name: CORTE CANALE VIRGILIO Small idyllic farm with many different animals (ponies, dogs, cats, chickens, rabbits, bees, insects of all kinds ...) and a very nice host who speaks very good German, has lots of good plans for the area and her mom, who likes to speak Italian and bring apricots or blackberries. 
There is a mini pool for cooling off and you can borrow bikes for free. The bathroom is very modern and clean. By the nearby river there is a lovely beer garden with delicious foccacia. There are various small specialties to buy, such as eggs, honey, jam, wine, vinegar and olive oil. You can stand where there is space in the yard; towards the front, it is a little noisier from the street. It is better to write to the host in advance or to call them. A trip to Mantua is recommended and it is half an hour from Lake Garda or Verona.

name: Camping Flintstones Park
description: Very nice little campsite. One area for tents and one area for RVs. Nice clean toilets and showers. € 30.00 in the low season for everything. € 20.00 without electricity etc. The owner was super nice and friendly.

name: Sans Donato Val Di Camino
description: A parking spot in the grass near the sporting area. No services. Free.  One km from the village.

name: Sicily Rooms Enna (motorbike friendly)
description: Nice hostel very close to the Center of town. Payed 50€ for two nights with a very good breakfast included. Parking though might be a problem for everything bigger then a „normal“ car. There is free parking on the street - but I didn’t see many free slots around. I was also struggling to find my way to the hostel. Try to reach it from the eastern side of town ;-). I was very happy to park my motorbike inside the premises - should be space for +- 4 bikes if necessary. Very friendly staff - no English.

name: Agricampeggio Pini in Fiore
description:
Small quiet campsite on the property of a local farmer.
Nice and really clean bathrooms.
No wifi.
Very friendly owner.
Shadowy pitches as well as sunny pitches available.
Perfectly flat pitches.

name: Refugio Monti Peloritani
description: Abandoned Refugio inside the forest. Unfortunately home of some cows and the standard flying toilet paper that can be found around places like this. But besides… it has huge benches and tables, fire spots and a some grass spots for camping. View down to Messina can be found at the nearby little church (it’s also in IOverlander) or just along the very adventurous road. 4x4 and off-road motorbikes can make it. Everything bigger I wouldn’t suggest.

name: Euromaster Pellegrino Paolo
description: Good mechanic to get a tire change done. I ordered my motorbike tires the day I came from the ferry. Two weeks later - after riding around Sicili - got it easy and professionally changed. Payed 230€ for a new set of Annakee Wild which is quite a good deal as well. Recommend!!!

name: Bologna
description: Checked into apartment in Bologna downtown.

name: 10 km West Bari
description: a Rocky beach but best to walk on the rock and swim nearly clean but Many people on Saturday and Sunday

name: Lago Orta
description: A Good Place for ohne Night. 5 Minutes to the Lake! Perfekt to swim

name: Tent in Eroica circuit
description: Quite place perfecf for a night on eroica circuit

name: By the river
description: The parkinglot belongs to a restaurant, which was closed when we were there. The owner agreed we could stay, we wanted to habe dinner there. It's a wonderful quiet place next to the river ticino.

name: Hidden spot in the fields
description: between a small wood and a sunflower field, perfect for a night, close to a side road

name: Scenic camper parking on top of a mountain
description: Marked camper parking, this spot lies at the end of a curvy and steep mountain road and sports a grand view of the next couple of valleys. No signs of having to pay, it was empty when we were here. No shade. There are a couple of spots suitable for a night on the way up, too.

name: Camping La Cà
description: Very friendly welcome, very clean toilets, Northern European atmosphere, easy access to Lake Garda

name: Tent next to small river
description: well hidden spot for a tent next to a small stream in the green. bushes and trees around. the area seams to be known as there is a fireplace and a improvised bench. follow the little path next the the small bridge away from the road along the stream (nearly 250m). you can take a bath in the little bassin in the stream at the cascade. no phone signal.

name: Popular parking lot with campers
description: For vans and rigs, not for tents. It is allowed to park and camp overnight in this parking lot. There were 3-4 campers here at the same time. It’s right next to the river but it’s in the village at the same time. No services.

name: Public water tap in front of Cafe Fontana
description: Public water tap in front of Cafe Fontana

name: Public water tap in the middle of the village
description: Public water tap in the middle of the village

name: Free gravel parking next to the lake
description: No amenities, just a flat area used by campers and people visiting the lake. Some traffic during the day but very quiet overnight. Beautiful place. There is a great restaurant/bar nearby.

name: Albenga Punto Gas
description: A friendly place where they fill up your empty bottles

name: Toblach See Camping Ground
description: Mainly for motorhomes but there is space for tents, even not max comfortable as a little sloped, no WiFi signal and dark (may this is a + as everybody is sleeping at night). The place around is awesome and all the services are included: hot water, shower, etc.

name: In Majella NP
description: Beside the gravelroad to some hikingpaths. There are also parkinglots at the beginning of the hikingpaths, but we prefered the nice view.

name: montespertoli
description: Free parking in Piazza del Popolo convenient and reserved for 6 spaces for campers. Services at the sports center two km

name: Area Sosta Camper
description: Best stop near Torre Canne, directly at the small beach. Friendly owners, only for vans and mobilehomes. All facilities, simple but clean, some shadow. 25€/night with electricity, warm shower 1€, cold shower for free, but most of the people use also the cold shower with shampoo and soap.

name: Picknick place next to sport ground
description: nice spot with an amazing view.. it's official an Picknick ground , so nobody cares about an overnighter

name: Electric Vehicle Charging
description: Electric Vehicle Charging Station ..........

name: Electric Vehicle Charging
description: Electric Vehicle Charging Station ........

name: Rare Wild Camp Spot next to creek
description: Great hidden place right next to a creek. Close to the main road but totally hidden. Right in the bend drive off of the main road towards the valley into the forest. You will find a dirt road leading into the valley with forest all around. The road goes past a utility building and then you can continue another 100 meters further down until you get to the end of the road. You could stay there, but we stay up right next to the track where it gets a bit wider. Nobody bothered us, great place.

name: Electric Vehicle Charging
description: Electric Vehicle Charging Station.

name: Locazione Mandoal
description: Breath taking view in Lago di idro. Small hut with benches and fireplace...

name: rifugio di montecristo
description: I slept in a tent at the edge of the great parking lot. Excellent panoramic view. No problem.

name: Beach spot near Torre Castiglione
description: Small Parking lot, 100m from the rocky beach - empty during the Night, Also good for big vehicules. You can camp on the shore and swim in the sea, very quiet and clean (we slept in tent)- very nice spot!

name: La Villa
description: Small, friendly family campground. Well maintained, but claustrofobic ablutions, kitchen, fridge, BBQ, swimming pool. 5 minutes walk from village. Cars need to be parked in front. EUR 22 per person per night. Cash payments only.

name: lago dei caprioli
description:
parking and overnight stop at € 3 .. there are bathrooms but only during the day

ITALIANO
parcheggio e sosta notturna a 3€ .. ci sono i bagni ma solo di giorno

name: Olive tree terraces
description:
Quiet spot among olive tree terraces
Nice for setting the tent for one night, but not ideal for longer stays.
The car can be left in the parking area beneath, where some campers are parked, and the spot can be reached in one-two minutes only.
3.5 stars for me

name: Area picnic Colle Ciardonet
description:
Beautiful spot for wild camping where you will find a plain area covered with grass, some picnic tables and an awesome view on the mountains all around.
The big wall Rocca Sbarua is just 20 min away walking. From the parking area there is a 15-20 min walk uphill on a dirt road.
Good place for spending the night, although it might not be the best to keep the tents set during the day due to the passing of hikers and refuge personnel.
Water fountain available at the refuge Casa Canada.
5 stars!

name: Madonna di Campiglio
description: You can basically camp (if you have a van) in Madonna di Campiglio next to a quiet street, under a big pine tree. Nobody cared that we camped here. But it wouldn’t work with a tent or a large rig. If you sleep inside you car or van and don’t put chairs and tables out then it’s ok. A local showed us this place and he said it’s totally fine to camp here. We spent a couple of nights at this place

name: Strada Tre Valli, Via Maniva
description:
Quiet parking slot with tables, grillplate and a small spring beside the high altitude gravel road Strada Tre Valli SP345 to Paso Dasdana.
beautiful view and sunset. no traffic in the night.

name: Happy place
description: Nice spot.  you can swim in the torrent.  Quiet and few people.  a little close to the road that we can hear.

name: Parking close to Val Comelico
description: Free parking colse to the Val Comelico Ski Area. Staying overnight is allowed, there are no restrictions signs. It could be chaotic during the day, especially in high season. There is a fenced area with the selective recycling bins. The supermarket is 4 mins walk (300m), Restaurant-Pizzeria “Sky” 3 mins.

name: Cinque Terre
description: Medium size campground (about 70 sites in various sizes/prices). You can keep your car at your site if it is large enough. Adequate number of well maintained facilities. Lots of shady trees. Dish washing facilities, washing machines, dryer. Bar. Walking distance from town. EUR 40.70 per night (2 adults, tent, car electricity). WiFi near the bar. Nearby are two more comparable campgrounds. About 20 min. walking from town.

name: Panoramic view near Passo del Dil and Passo di Tremalzo
description: big turnaround at the gravelroad after Passo del Dil, nice panoramic view, quite

name: Chairlift Parking
description: Free parking on gravel colse to the chairlift.  Convenient location to reach “Lago di Campo” and “Valgrande”. Restaurant/pizzeria “Sky” is right there. The spot could be noisy during the day, quiet at night instead. Staying overnight is allowed, there are no restriction signs.

name: Marina di Pisticci
description: a good place in the pine forest.  Attention in August there are a lot of people, but if you get there before 9am you will find super shady places. good to stay a few days.

name: Spectacular view high above Lake Como
description: View on the lake on both sides. Calm and flat place for at least three cars. Narrow road up there. On the way up you can buy cheese and visit restaurants.

name: Beach
description: Lonely beach with few locals. Unfortunately there is a lot of rubbish on the beach. But it is very quiet.

name: Torre Inserraglio
description: A quiet place very close to the sea. Unfortunately you are not allowed to swim here. But for a few quiet nights it is wonderful.

name: Ticino
description: Shady, grassy family owned campground with lots of trees. Friendly staff. Swimming pool, washing machine, no dryer. Dish washing facilities. Shower, toilet and sink are combined in single units. Luxurious, but inefficient when it is busy. About 2.5 km from town and 1.2 km from large supermarket. Bus to town leaving near camping. Gate is closed for cars between 13:30 and 15:30. Bus/train/metro connection to Milan takes about 1 hour. Walking/bike path behind campground along river.

name: Wild Paestum
description:
New camper stop with really friendly and caring young owners. Shower and Bathroom very clean, hot shower 50 cent. 50m to the beach through a small pine forest. Beach clean, 15km of sand, not crowded in the mid of August.
Shop nearby, 10min walk to the small town, 25min walk to the sights/temples of ancient Paestum. Best place you will find here.
Wanted to stay one night, stayed three nights.
30€/2 persons and car/night

name: public water fountain
description: free cool water available 24/7 and adjacent parking

name: Pavia
description: Interesting town with a large, car free medieval centre and a bridge with roof across the Ticino river. Good walking/cycle path along the river. Not mentioned in Lonely Planet, not touristy.

name: Campeggio Cameragna
description: Very nice campground with real nice owner. For dinner, you get the best pizza in Italy

name: SP 43
description: Little fountain near the road SP 43. Attention please, at the moment, no potable water.

name: Carole
description: We traveled from Bibione where we stayed one night on a free parking lot above Playa Pluto witch you can go on with dogs. There is water, bath rooms and showers. 5 Euros for camping

name: Paradise campers
description:
Campsite with a lot of olive trees, friendly price compared with other campsites in the region. There is an access to the see in 1 km.
The pitches are spacious, flat and separated by bushes.

name: Gigant free parking area
description: Big free parking spot with many campers from all over the country. Perfect for big rigs. To the center of Caorle it not more than 20 minutes walk.

name: SP 7 Fonni - Desulo
description: Wonderful fountain with parking between Fonni and Desulo

name: Auberge Nazionale
description:
Great place to rest for a night before tackling the Via del Sale. Basic rooms available at the auberge (70 euro including a great breakfast!). Extremely welcoming and friendly staff. On the other side of the road you can find the Relais del Nazionale with more expensive rooms (+200 euro).

Nice little town with a short hike indicated by the 'Murales' signs, which will lead you to some ruins on top of the hill. For dinner: Bacarrá had great pizza. Various little bars around as well.

name: Truck 4x4
description: This is a dealer in ex-military 4x4vehicles. strictly speaking not a garage. all the knowledge and used and new spare parts for iveco 40-10 and daily 35-12. and Mustafa, the fantastic mechanic, who completely overhauled our gearbox in 2,5 days. including taking out and putting back. The parking lot is bulging with beatiful refurbished 40-10 and daily's for sale from army, "protection civile" and ambulances. a gem.

name: Kapuziner Garden
description: Water Tab in a beautiful Park with shade trees. Perfect for a cycling-break.

name: Punta Ala Camp
description:
Big Campsite that is well organized and separated by hedges. There are a lot of facilities like washing machines, bike rental, tree climbing park etc., but you don‘t necessarily need to use these. The beach is nice and sandy, pretty crowded at times. 

On the campground, only registered campers and tents allowed, no cars. You pay by campsite, not by tent/Camper.

Price is bit higher but fair for the Region

name: Parking lot next to the beach.
description:
Nice parking spot 50 meters from the beach, 100 meters from the sea. Vary nice long wild beach to the left. Stunning view on the mountains on the right. Warm water.
SHOWERS BEHIND THE PRIVATE BEACH PART. + WATER TO REFILL POTABLE WATER TANK.
We are here half day and one night.
Nice place to stay many other camping people vans and big rigs.

name: water for drinking
description: A nice place easy to park for free along the street under trees. We had a nice lunch in the car and the restaurant next to the sea has a water source for portable tank water

name: Wild camp for wickers on the beach
description: Extremely steep trail down to a beautiful beach. Amazing views. Only by walking

name: Parking lot for the hickers.
description:
Quiet parking lot on close to a beautiful village with stunning views and many great hiking trails ending on amazing beaches with less amount of people. Free and easy. Good for bigger rigs but the road up is little more narrow and lost of sharp turns.
Check on map first. Elevation from sea is 400 meters.

name: Picnic area with water fountain
description: Picnic area by the road with a picnic table and water fountain, easy access, great for camping, road was not busy during the night. Some horses came to the fountain during the night, so don't park too close to it (like we did)

name: Parking lot by panoramic road
description: Parking lot behind a bus stop at Vigna del Mare, easy access. We were driving the panoramic road when it got dark so we slept there for the night to continue in the morning and nobody seemed to mind. It has a small trash bin and the road is not busy during the night.

name: Abandoned gas station
description:
Not the prettiest place to rest but it will do for a night, especially if it's raining because it has a roof. You could set up a tent in the surrounding fields but there's lots of trash lying around.
Warning: There was a stray dog living in the station, but he always kept a distance from us and shied away when I approached him. Didn't bother us any further but be aware!

name: Lago Pozzillo
description:
Beautiful spot directly at the lake. Very quiet and an amazing view over the lake. No city or anything nearby - just untouched nature. There are several paths down from the main road, some are better than others (we took the 3rd one). Probably easier with 4x4 but we made it in a normal car and so did some of the fishermen we encountered. 
Warning: We were surprised by a very friendly dog that probably belongs to one of the houses nearby, he was quite nosy and tried to get us to pet and feed him. He wouldn't leave us alone no matter what we did, but he wasn't aggressive. Maybe you can avoid him by driving a bit further away from the houses.

name: Parking lot
description: Parking lot right next to the sea, wasn't too busy. There's a bigger one down the road that was a lot busier. We even drove down to the sea and spent the night there, so we were almost alone with an amazing view. However, we didn't see the sign that says you're not allowed to drive further down and we were visited by the police in the morning who told us to go back to the parking lot, so you better not make the same mistake.

name: Roadside
description: Small dead end road just by the main road. There are a few bushes between the spot and the main road so you're not in view of passing cars but the road wasn't busy at night. Not the prettiest place to stay (the bushes are spiky) but it's ok for sleeping in your car, there is no place to set up a tent. You also have a great view on Sicily and Mount Etna from the road.

name: Parking Lot
description: A nice parking lot. Calm at night. Free to use. Next to the center.  Good for bigger campers too. 15 minutes from the center.

name: Stramare Moto
description:
Mechanic for motorcycle

really fast and flexible
+39 0183 880754
stramare-moto.business.site

name: Camping Vahn
description:
Small camground on grass field. Not very level ground but nice familiar feeling. Solid outside eating area. The lake nearby is closed unfortunatly since they found WW2-Bombs in it.

There is also a „Wirtshaus“ (Restaurant).

name: Pizzeria Royal
description:
Great food for good prices.

Big parking lot directly in front of the restaurant and supermarket nearby (50 meters).

name: Next to the bridge
description: There is a way to a spacious parking spot right next to the bridge crossing the river here. The way down is unpaved but fine and you can camp with a view over the river and a 1 minute walk down to the water. No signs or people telling us to leave.

name: Forte Leone
description:
Spectacular place. Old fort with a  few tables with benches. Nobody here, only the dog from the nearby farm came to check us. 
Gravel road, with tight turns and step hill. Be aware with standard European RV (alkoven). Vans, 4x4 and normal cars should not have a problem. Fort is closed, but from outside is also worth to see.

name: Best View near to the mountain station
description: Direct near to a bend behind the guardrail. Great view. The other place on the gravel field is closed by big rocks in the road. You also can park at the mountain station, but there you are normally not alone.

name: Beautiful lake
description:
A best place for 1 night near a lake 
No service

name: Along the hiking path
description: Coming up from Monterosso, there is a nice bushtrack on the right that doubles as a hiking path. If you follow it for a few meters, there will be a nice clearing with enough space for a camper or two. There were one or two marks of fire spots already. Only a few cars passed the newby road, but you‘re out of sight anyways

name: Pineda - near Vajont dam
description:
Nice place, hidden in the forrest. Locals are probably doing parties here, because the fireplace is here. 
Continue the road to Pineda and more. It will bring you the SR251 again but it is tight and full of tunnels

name: Pesaro Beach
description: In a dead end. Right on the beach. Free during the week. A parking ticket is required at the weekend. Very well known by the locals. You shouldn't "camp" excessively in front of the vehicle, otherwise it will be rioted by the police. Use of the showers and toilets on the beach promenade is possible.

name: Combai picnic area
description: Very nice place, close to sport fields, grassy picnic area with bbqs.

name: Road up to Monte Corrasi
description: On the road up to Monte Corrasi are parking lots perfect for a quiet night. This particular spot is suitable for one vehicle. The road up has several narrow hairpins and lower branches. So, be aware of scratches. Perfect place to start hikes.

name: Ecoparco Neule
description: This campsite has also hotel rooms. There are several activities like massages, yoga and excursions on the nearby lake. Some pitches have a magnificent view. Restaurant not open daily. We paid 31 euros for two person’s.

name: In the area of Riu Pramaera
description: This wild spot is extremely quiet. Only a dog far,far away was barking for a short time. Along a gravel road without traffic. Maximum two spots. Eventually big rigs. Shadow came from de cork oak. Mountains all around. Good 4g reception. Leave the spot cleaner as found!

name: Masua 4x4
description: This is one of the most beautiful places we visited on Sardinia. Only one pitch, not reachable for big rigs. Only 4x4 with high clearance.

name: picknick place in the mountains
description: you can park here, quite big parking left hand site. not sure if it is allowed. on the other site in the woods are many tables. many locals around in september at the weekend, some of them camping. no stress at all. also bbq places here.

name: parking lot next to sport center
description: it has a well and a calm neigborhood. we only refilled water here. minus: plane traffic from verona airport

name: Waldcamping Völlan
description:
46 Standard place for caravans or motor homes. 22 luxury spots with privileged view. 
Nice place on a hill. 
€ 33.50 all inclusive ( electricity, taxes,etc.)
Lots of shade.
info@alpinfitnes-waldcamping.it

name: Camp Sole
description: Nice, quiet clean camp, but not that big like all others around. Directly at the beach. Fair prices, especially out of the season. You can get also a bungalow.

name: water, playground and rest for the night
description: as described above and see the pictures. wide parking lot, fresh water and new playground.

name: Agricamp Arcade di Noè
description:
Nice and quiet litte place in the middle of nowhere! Pure nature and nothing else. 
Only about 10 spots for campers or tents.
Clean hot shower and toilets. 
Kitchen available, self service bar. Shaded space inside and outside under the roof of the farm. 
Lovely owners even speeking „Schwitzertütsch“. But also proper Italien. 
TEL: +39053 6080 012
larcadinoe.natura@gmail.com
Please do not follow your navigation system. Follow via Strada Statale 486 alongside the river Secchia until aprox. 8 km after Roteglia theo turn left and follow SP23 until aprox. 2 km before Gombola. In a sharp right turn go left. 700m and you are here.

name: San Leonardo di siete Fuentes
description:
Near by the area totally devastated by the recent big fire, a fantastic green place.
A lot of space for every kind of car, camper, tent … shadow, flat, calm, just birds. 
Ancient pic-nic area with a lot of tables. 
And even a fountain with fresh water !!!

name: Priola mountain road
description: Small place in in the middle of the mountain road. Nice view to the walley. Caution the hill is really step and the road really tight

name: La Sciumara
description: great place for the night! awesome view to the sea! really quiet! for 3 or 4 camper!

name: Porto Palmas
description: Nice parking area looking down over the sea with several parking spaces.  No service.  Beautiful sunset.

name: Strada Provinciale
description: This place was found by us with the help of locals. Grassy area, with a spectacular view over Trapani and it’s shore. Walking distance from the town of Erice which is worth a visit. No amenities at all. A big rig should fit.

name: Camping “La Cascina”
description:
Traditional camping typically open all year, with permanent guests in mobile caravans. Lot of places also for travellers. Good for motorbikes with tent, RV or big RV. 
Tricky to spend quality time with the kids. 
A ramp will introduce you to the reception. You will be able to completely unplug yourself from the outside world. Close to LANGHE (UNESCO World Heritage), land of best world’s winery.
The place is very quiet, surrounded by the typical Piedmontese landscape and nature with a river nearby.  Usually closed during December and January.

name: Favignana, near harbour
description: Parking on gravel with nice view. Overlooking the sea you’ll see other islands and the mainland as well.  Swimming possible, no beach. No amenities, plenty of space, also for big rigs.

name: Favignana
description: You really need 4x4 with high clearance to reach this stunning spot. You can overlook most of the island. No amenities, no big rigs.

name: Parking lot near Coop
description: Parking lot near Coop supermarket and some restaurants. Very quiet and a lot of space. Drive down the dead end road on the right side of coop and then turn right. There is even a playground for kids! No showers, toilets available in coop between 08:00 and 20:30

name: Azienda Rasicci, Controguerra
description:
Nice stopover at vineyards/ agriturismo - lovely welcoming hosts (particularly the 90 year old father who is a find advertisement for this place). Clean toilets and shower/ wine and oil to buy. 
Parking for big rigs may be a bit tight but possible if you phone ahead. General parking is just informal around the farmhouse.
Ideal stopover for a quiet night before down to Bari or Brindisi. 
We paid €15 for camper and two people - but we did buy some wine (rose) which was excellent……so try it !

name: Valledolmo
description: This village surrounded by agriculture provides a piece of tarmac for a overnight stay. It’s located on the edge of town and has no amenities except a WiFi connection that didn’t when we were there. No problem for big rigs.

name: Picnic Area
description: Nice place to stay overnight. It is quiet, no traffic at night. Water tap at the top corner of the area, but not potable.

name: Cavagrande del Cassibile
description: These pitches on grass are located nearby the entry of the cave. The restaurant ask 3 euros! for an overnight stay. You can use toilets and cold showers. The hike to the cave is worth it. If you ask the restaurant owner he will help you to refill your watertank.

name: Porto Palmas
description: Great Spot for 3 Campervans! little bit uneven,but with rocks no problem! 50 meter from the sea! Great beach for swimming or snorkeling! Nice sunset! Little bar with toilet(key) and shower(with shampoo!) free!

name: Asti Center
description:
on a Big place free but on Wednesday stay only under très Saterday IS market 
2 minutes to down town quiet sometimes drink people i stay hère 2 Yers ago without problem

name: New Park
description:
Large, locked, monitored, well-organized parking lot. The owner is very friendly. The center can be reached by public transport within 30 minutes. Between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. there is a free shuttle to the nearest public transport station. Electricity, WiFi, showers and toilets incl.

30€/24h

name: Dump station and water
description: Parking lot with dump station and water faucet. No sign if potable or not but should be potable

name: Parking lot
description: Dump station and fresh water. You can stay here at the parking lot for a night.

name: Ragabo picnic place
description: This picnic place offers several pitches between enormous pine trees. In an open area in the forest are several fire places. Pitches on grass or lava. You can leave your garbage in one of the buckets. Perfect place for discovering the fantastic Etna mountains.

name: Bosco della Mesola
description: Nice big parking lot on the entrance to the park. Very quiet and calm. Around a lot of agricultural. Perfect place to start a day trip with the bikes to the beach or next town. The parking lot is the whole week open, the park only on the weekend, so the restrooms only open while the park is open.

name: Montespluga lakeside
description:
Nice spot by the lake just outside the village. 
It’s on the Italian side of the Splugen Pass. 
There is a picnic table and bench. 
Room for up to 4 rigs. 

This specific point is no more accessible. But lot of other place around the lake

name: fishermens path
description:
A path where local anglers sit.
 there’s space for one campervan.
You can watch lots of boats on the channel.
Good for one night.

name: Parking lot in residential area
description: Parking lot to stay overnight. It is forbidden on every third thursday. No facilities, no height restriction.

name: Parking Lot Martellago
description:
Some locals park their cars here.
Nothing special but good to stay overnight.

name: Parking lot Benaco
description:
A simple parking lot on a playground.
Two cottages with benches & tables for sitting and cooking. 
Opposite to the street is a cemetery where the toilets are open at night too, a water tap is also available
Good for one night.

name: Rest Area
description: This is a BBQ area that have tables and a place to park. It is very simple, but an awesome location.

name: Beach parking San Ferdinando
description: Free overnight parking on tarmac on the boulevard 50 meters from the clean and sandy beach.  Several rubish bins all around. In oktober really quite, it might be busy in season.

name: Lago Sirino
description: Nice place near a small lake in the mountains. Good for a stop while traveling a longer distance. The small village is very nice. Hiking trails are there and restaurants. Also good for mountainbiking.

name: Wild camping spot under the tree
description:
A place under the tree for at least 4 tents.
Water point is in 300 meters away.

name: Wild camping in the park
description: Wild camping in the park. Water point in the park is available.

name: Wild camping spot near the road in the industrial zone
description:
Wild camping spot near the road in the industrial zone.
No water.

name: Spot for tent on the beach
description: Spot is close to the lake, so it is better to stay here when the weather, and the lake as well, is calm. across the road there is space to park motorbikes a bit more difficult to access by car .

name: Public toilet and shower
description:
Public toilet 0,7€ + shower 3,0€.
Nice service and very clean toilets and showers.
Work from 10:00 to 17:00 every day Mon-Sun.

name: Near Cotriero Beach Club
description: Wild camp a few meters from the sea. A sandy/rocky area. The bar isn’t far but closed in off-season. No amenities, just the sound of breaking waves. There is a small sandy beach where it is easy to enter the water. We could use the free WIFI from the closed bar, but don’t count on it. To narrow for big rigs.

name: Train station Frascati
description: Big parking lot directly near the train station to Rom. Quiet at night because no trains and it’s the final destination from the train. A ticket costs 2,10€ per person into Rom and it takes around 30min. I can recommend this place for visit Rom on couple days. Gendarmerie is near and they driving by and check. Also you have cameras on the Spot.

name: Lava tu
description: Modern self-service laundromat. Opening hours daily 600-2300.

name: Wild camping spot in small forest right in Verona
description:
Spot is quiet and fully without people.
Good place if you need just one or two nights, but you failed to find some hosts in Verona

name: Nice forest with many spots to put a tent
description:
We put a tent here, no other tourists went through our location, so I would say, it is safe to camp here, but only for one night.
The location of this place is more approximate rather than exact because the forest has many good spots. Feel free to find here the best one for you.

name: Laundromat Speed Queen
description: Washing and drying, self service. Open daily 800-2130

name: Emmepigas
description: You refill your propane bottle at this place. Open 700-1530 mo-fr.

name: Tent spot in near the bicycle path
description:
The place is hidden from the bicycle path, so nobody should see or hear you. Only the busy road makes a noise.
Only accessible for bicyclists or hikers because no regular road to this place.

name: Belvedère de la murge
description: Parking/picknick area with a fantastic view to the Adriatic coast. Because of the narrow path not suitable for big rigs. Cars and vans reach this spot without any problem. No amenities, just a bin. So, it’s one of the most clean parking spots in southern Italy. Overnight stay is okay.

name: Near Castelmezzano
description: Spot aside of a mountain road. All vehicles can reach this point. Nice view in a mountain area and pretty quiet too. No amenities.

name: Rosignano Solvey
description: Large free parking spot next to the beach. There are three parking sections. The two in front of the sea are for cars, the third behind is for campers. The police is checking. There are no facilities, but many restaurants and bars near. During nights it is calm and quiet. We stayed here for three nights without any problems. Quite nice place at the sea for free…

name: Angler Ground
description: beautiful place 10m from the sea on one side a pond inflow of fresh water and to the front the sea beautiful fishing spot have caught fish and also seen muskrats in the evening. A fish restaurant is nearby but unfortunately it wasn't open at the end of October

name: Monte Argentario
description: Small parking area on dead end road, high in the mountains. No facilities but very quiet night. Very little passing traffic.

name: Piazza San antonio
description: Free water just behind the parking lot

name: Spiaggia Libera Di Nerone
description: Spiaggia Libera Di Nerone - free beach parking, overnight ok, quite parking, well lit.

name: Porto San Stefano
description: Nice free parking spot next to the sea. No facilities. We spent here in October two quiet nights in our camper without problems. Usually fre parking is free, but limited for four hours. But now there was no problem to stay several days. Be careful because the entrance leads through a ZTL (Zona Traffico Limitato) which you only may pass when the sign says green „ZTL non attiva“. If it’s red you should have a permit to pass through! Many bars and restaurants are near.

name: Little Clearing
description:
This clearing is surrounded by trees and bushes, I wouldn't expect much shade in summer when the sun is high. Quite grassy, ideal for tents. Cars and smaller rigs should work as well, the unpaved road is approx 200m, just check whether it's doable.
You can hear cars from the road and some background noise from the industrial site next to it. It didn't bother us as we just stayed 1 night.
This place can't be seen from the road, no one passed by.
Good signal with Windtre.
There was no trash/litter around, let's keep this place clean :)

name: Vado Ligure, Savona
description: Ostensibly a truck stop by the port but also used by motorhomes as there is plenty of space, no parking/camping overnight although we did stay overnight end of October and no issue.

name: Diga di Alpe Gera
description:
Parking with BBQ area right below Alpe Gera dam. Visited in November, after a snowfall, so obviously you need 4x4 and winter tyres. Not sure about summer access.
Very quiet and spectacular sky, even with the dam lights, it was a masterpiece.

name: wild kamp between the cows
description: This is a very quiet place. We only heard the cowsbells at night. a few walking paths through the woods. You can park away from the road.

name: Above the clouds at 1700mtr
description:
Fantastic spot between mountains.
Above the clouds at 1700 mtr.
Good road to the spot.
Great hiking trails!
A little lake.
Very quite.
15 minutes drive from Prato di Trivo.

name: Camper Dolce Vita
description: This campsite is about 1 km from the center of the city located. Here are mainly families with children and dogs from Germany, Switzerland and Austria, spending the winter here or are partly permanent campers. It is a group of "free learner". At the campsite are offered showers with coin insertion (0.50 €) for hot water, toilets (without toilet glasses), sinks for washing up,  a washing machine (4 Euro/ hour with up to 60° warm water) as well as a spacious covered terrace (mainly used by the children). On this terrace you have the possibility to use Wi-Fi, which is very good. Outside this area the use is not possible.  We were there in the first week of November and stood for 10€/night, just a few steps from the beach.

name: Area Sosta Camper
description: In front of the entrance of the ferry terminal there is a large parking lot. Here you can stay for free (no limit). It is not cozy, but it serves its purpose. There are places with electricity, drinking water and a dump station. The pretty city center is within walking distance

name: Villa Gerace  agriturismo
description: Sicilia,In a farm Nice,tranquille,25 euros under trees oliviers . Nice toiles.

name: San Donato
description:
Behind the dike there is a nice flat and grassy area to put up a tent. There are two levels, both are hidden and flat.
Only accessible for walkers or people by bike.

name: Sarzana
description:
Place by the river with a small picnic area, surrounded by reeds and near a nature reserve area. 
a bar limits access to small buses, so we parked at the edge of the road and it went too. Only natural place for vans in the area. The only one with nice picknick tables next the little field where to put a tent. 
 Fishermen are there by day, but no one at night. There is a little ‘house’ with a roof to stay dry in case of rain. We uses the fireplace and there was a grill too.

name: Happy Sardinia
description: Flat place for 2 or 3 cars with hill and field view! Really quiet, OK for 2wheels drive but not ordinary car maybe..some holes and rocks on the road.

name: national Abruzzes parc ( happy.westy)
description: It's a big flat parking with sorting bins ( plastic, carton, other), very quiet, no exterior light.

name: Parking area
description:
Nice place to stay with camper van in city parking.
Near the road but not too bad in night.

name: Sosta camper Napoli Parco dei Camaldoli
description:
Great site, lots of level parking bays for camper vans and motorhomes. 

20 euros for a night. 

Secure site and gated. Nice showers €1 for 3 minutes. Bus tickets can be purchased and you can take the 139 bus into the city but you need to walk down the hill to the bus stop. €1 per bus ticket. On the road so some slight noise but this is expected in a big city. There is no parking in the city so a camping site is a must...

name: Parking behind police station
description:
Small Parking in a small village. 
Nobody say something when we stay there.
Good place for camper van with nice view of mountains.

name: FREE parking
description: Free motorcycle parking in Venice itself. 100+ spaces, mostly small bikes but a touring bike will fit (we took 3 spaces between 2 bikes). nice view of the bridge over and much better first look of Venice itself from your bike rather than out the side of a train window. Only a short walk to everything that Venice has to offer.

name: Park
description:
Nice place for sleeping with tent. 
You have some people walk in this park during the day. But not too bad.

name: Happy Saturnia
description: small parking near a restaurant, garbage, a drinking fountain at 100m, quiet and easy access.

name: Flamingo Parking
description:
Small parking in forest. You can park your car or put up your tent. 
Peaceful place. Keep it clean

name: Happy Impruneta
description: Large  parking area with drinking water and playground for kids. we stayed one night and no issues. There is a  restaurant nearby.

name: Happy Fiesole
description: We slept here for one night without issues. Big parking area really quiet and only 6km walk to Florence. Nice village with all shops that you want, beautiful Florence view!

name: Bucchioni SRL
description:
I collected my car from kenya with them 
Expensive but it was hard to find a clearing company. Overall Mauro was very helpful and had an understanding that I am not a a client on a reoccurring basis. He sad for a world traveller it is a pleasure to help. 
The company is actually in La spezia but they have a branch in Genoa 

The job was done without any major issues so i can recommend them

name: parking Matera
description:
Parking 0'5€/hour
Ok for 1 night no services

name: happy Metato
description:
Small parking before the Metato village.
awesome view on the mountains, sea and others smalls villages! really quiet and aqua drinking.

name: Agricamping Maiella del Garda
description: Nice small agricamping near river Mincio and about 15 minutes by car to Sirmione.

name: Camping Sass Dlacia
description: The "Camping Sass Dlacia" campground is located in the Dolomites village of San Cassiano in Alta Badia, near the entrance  to the natural wonders of the Fanes-Sennes-Prags Nature Park. This makes it the perfect starting point for countless walking, hiking and biking trails. The campsite lies in a scenic location, surrounded by fragrant pine woods and green meadows, at the foot of the majestic Dolomites. The Camping Sass Dlacia offers a wide selection of all-year-round outdoor activities and a range of services designed to cater to all your needs.

name: Riverside
description:
Great place down by the river. Near a Rivercrossing. 
Take the small bumpy road down right after the tunnel. Several possibilities

name: Mountain Meadow
description: Not so many possibilities to camp in the this hills so we liked the flat grassy meadow. High clearance may be an adventage to drive around here. No traffic here, no lights, no noise, and freezing cold now in winter.

name: The wild side of Monti di Alà 4x4
description: What a view! Flat meadow on the way to Pedra Blanca. Pretty rough if you come up from the south from the SP67, you need a proper 4x4 with reallly high clearance to manage the rocky track. It's really worth the view... There are more cool places on the way north

name: Forca di Presta
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

Very large parking space for mountaineers going trekking on Monte Vettore, difficoult or no phone signal, cozy area where to camp for one night, at day tent must be off. There may be dogs guarding sheep. From the parking you can enjoy an amazing sunrise from Adriatic sea.

name: Place for a tent
description: Close to the road, with wonderful view over the sea and amazing sunset. Very calm, no one around.

name: La Mola
description:
Great place! you can taste olive oil, have  a fantastic dinner under the olive trees (25€ pp) and park to sleep (25€ a car, 15 for our tent with bicycles). 

There's a toilet and shower at the factory. The owners are fantastic and everything was great. Just go there.

name: Nuraghie arrubiu
description: Great place to visit, a very important nuralgic fortification. We also highly recommend the guided visit, which was great!

name: Agriturismo Sa Guardia
description: A typical sardinian agruturismo, with delicious food (35€pp, starter, cheese, 4 main courses, dessert, wine, coffee and mirto). The damily is lovely and the owner allows you to park for the night for free. A outside shower is available. you'll have the most beautiful view. Attention, there's a steep dirt road to access the place from Torre delle Stelle.

name: Natur Caravanpark Tisens
description: Beautiful, very  clean and well organized campingplace. Shade and sunny places.

name: Ozeanriesen
description: Quiet Parking Lot next to the Harbour and the old town. Big Riggs ok.

name: La Quercia Agriturismo
description:
hotel run by the family, warm and welcoming; best shower in 2 weeks travelling; english speaking; a bit difficult to read instructions for directions if you are in the dark by motorbike; felt like at home
planning to be a place for bikers (push bike and motobikes);
As accessing via steep concreted hill, not sure for any big vehicles
Found place via Booking.com

name: EWA service station
description:
Station service with low price fuel, free water on the parking, air for tires, big space. 
Only diesel and gasoline.

name: Eurogomme
description:
Close to ACT italy
Marija speaks fluent english!
Tyre exchange cars & motorbikes
www.eurogomme.com and email info@eurogomme.com
Super helpful and efficient.

name: Pianello
description:
It is at the end/beginning of the village, off the SP29, on the corner is a big orange house.
Supposingly the owner of Bar Papi in the village got the key for the bathroom, but bar was closed.
Close to river.

name: Orta San Giulio
description: Big parking lot wird different Levels. Higher Levels very calm. Good to stay overnight. Near to Center. Cost: 10€/24h

name: Chiari
description: Laundry with parking places in front. €3,50 for 11kg.

name: Chiari
description: Sanitary dump next to camper places. Water available. Close to supermarket.

name: Chiari
description: Six camperplaces to stay 48 hours. No facilities except dump station. Supermarket on walking distance. City center is close by and worth a visit.

name: CAMPO PIRO E MORE
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

Campo Piro and More
345 391 8301
https://maps.app.goo.gl/q87fTwTn93T7fg8N7.
Telephone signal ok. Free bivouac with own tent or with our own tent. For other services contact by phone

----------------------------------

Campo Piro e More
345 391 8301
https://maps.app.goo.gl/q87fTwTn93T7fg8N7.
Segnale telefonico ok. Bivacco gratuito con tenda propria o con tenda di nostra proprietà. Per altri servizi contattare telefonicamente

name: Bolle di Sapone
description:
Self Service lavandaria, currently opening 7days 7h00-22h, fast dryer
off SP42 Orvieto, around the back of the petrol station
Fuel station, Supermarket and Bistro at building complex

name: Lago Di Corbara
description: Just off the SS48 at the camping site and follow along the side of the lake.

name: Parcheggio H24 di Franco Oggiano
description: Fenced parking ground with cameras and Rottweilers. 50€\month for long term parking. No English spoken here

name: Camping with ocean view
description: Great spot for any size rig. On a dead end road. Nobody around, very quiet.

name: Troia Parking
description: Camper friendly parking in Troia. Possibility to Dump, free electricity and short walk to the City Center. There is a typical Cake from Here. Nice little town.

name: Contrado Il Pulo
description:
Nice spot near to the official picknick place and only few walking minutes to various hiking/walking trails around and to the bottom of the crater.
We were here mid March 2022. Very quiet - but most probably more visited during weekends and in summer.
No facilities, no trash bins, no water.
Please do not leave traces behind, as some of the visitors sadly do.

name: By the river
description: Small flat area by the side of a river. Follow the track past the old poly tunnels Recommended for motorcycle or bicycle. Very quiet and sheltered. Fresh water in the river.

name: Vermoglo
description:
Nice quiet place. Disposal and water available.
.....
Schöner ruhiger Platz. Entsorgung und Wasser vorhanden.

name: Express Wash
description:
Catanzaro Lido, in Calabria... we found it with google under auto lavandaria, but not all on google is still existing or really open. They are open during the day. Cafe shops, small supermarket and fruit shop close by, while waiting.
www.expresswash.it

name: Abandoned Motorcross track
description: This sight is accessed through 2 sets of unused gates between the abandoned tennis courts. When we found it there were a couple of local kids using the track for training. we spoke to their father who was supervising them and he said we will be fine here tonight with our 2 motorcycles. He said not to worry, the gates are never closed.

name: Parkplatz in Como
description:
Como car park
Approx. 1 km from the old town - parking also allowed for mobile homes - free parking/staying overnight from 7:00 p.m. - 8:00 a.m., otherwise with parking machine
Nice little old town --- Parkplatz in Como
Ca. 1 km von der Altstadt - Parkplatz auch für Womo erlaubt  - von 19:00 - 08:00 freies parken/ übernachten, ansonsten mit Parkautomat
Schöne kleine Altstadt

name: Tenting under a Bridge (no vehicles)
description:
ONLY PEDESTRIAN ACCESS WITH TENT

Spent there 1 night in a Tent directly under the bridge. Not a lot of people, just cars driving over the bridge. Quite some shade possible, quite hidden spot, especially at night. 
Also you are directly at the Sea.

name: Agriturosmo la Longarola - overnight parking - (Parmaschinken von schwarzen Schweinen)
description:
Parking overnight at a small restaurant "Agriturismo - la Longarola".
Only local specialties are on the menu (including Parma ham from black pigs grazing in the garden). You don't have to go out to eat, but it's really tasty.

Deutsch
Parking overnight an einem kleinen Restaurant "Agriturismo - la Longarola".
Nur einheimische Spezialitäten stehen auf der Speisekarte (u.a. Parmaschinken von schwarzen Schweinen, die im Garten weiden). Man muss nicht essen gehen aber es ist echt lecker.

name: Agriturismo overnight parking - Ciaolatte (Parmesan)
description:
Small Parmesan factory with overnight accommodation. If you are lucky there is a guided tour. We didn't stay there - the parmesan was delicious.

Deutsch
Kleine Parmesanmanufaktur mit Übernachtungsmöglichkeit.
Wenn man Glück hat gibt es eine Führung.
Wir haben nicht dort übernachtet - der Parmesan war sehr lecker.

name: Agriturismo - Overnight parking Weingut La Bandina
description:
3 camper pitches at the winery - max 1 with 7m. Great view and nothing to do. Hike to Torre Chiara Castle 2.5 km. MTB tours. At the winery you can get wine and grappa. The owner is super nice. There is only fresh water - no sewage - electricity etc.
---
3 Womo Stellplätze am Weingut - max 1 mit 7m. Tolle Aussicht und nichts los. Wanderung zur Burg Torre Chiara 2,5 km. MTB Touren. 
Am Weingut bekommt man Wein und Grappa.  Die Besitzerin ist supernett.
Es gibt nur frisches Wasser - kein Abwasser - Strom usw.

name: By the river
description: Follow the track from the main road and as you get to the Polly tunnels on the left take the small grassy track to the right until you meet the river. This is a lovely flat spot by the river that meets the sea. Short walk to the beach. Perfect for a small tent.

name: Parking spot
description:
It’s a good place for overnight. Around a lot of walking paths.
The spot in near the church Madonna della neve. Space for big rigs.
The source is currently dry ( April 2022 )

name: Gambatesa
description: Camper Ares next to the centre of Toen with view in the mountains. 7 places down and 5 up. Payment by app. € 8 for first day, € 3 for next. With sanitary dump, water and electricity. Big rigs: have a look first, before you drive down to the area. A Unimog is no problem.

name: Cuglieri
description: Water fountain in city center of Cuglieri, possible parking close by.

name: Agricamping„ Il Mandorleto“
description: A wonderful house with small Woodhouse for sleep, inside with Shower and a Small kitchen. A Sleeping room With Double bed and a extra guestbed. A place for tent and Camping Cars.

name: Auto Caravan Massaua
description: Authorised dealer Webasto, Eberspaecher, Truma, Alde

name: Near Ossi town
description: Little fountain near Ossi town, a lot of parking near

name: Tenuta Santallago
description: Campsite with bathrooms, bar, restaurant, bbq and a lovely big field where to place tents on top of a hill. Lovely forest all around.

name: Grass Field
description:
It's a small field of grass, in a residential area but enough out of sight. Neighbour with a field with cows.

Quiet place except for animals sounds.
There is enough space for tent and vehicle.

name: Brentonico Parking
description: A free graveled parking spot surrounded by fields. Picknick Tables, a swing set and running cold Water across the street. We stayed here for one quiet night with our big rig (about 5m) with no problem. Please take your trash and use the garbage bins abvailable. Lets keep this spot nice and clean!

name: Santuary of Crea
description: This is a beautiful World Heritage Chapel accessible by a steep footpath and is situated on the top of a sacred hill popular with pilgrims/visitors.  There are three car parks at or close to the base, all of which accommodate campers including large rigs.  The best one has the most amazing views.

name: Riverside camp
description: Follow a big dirt track (any vehicle can handle) then small space to camp 20m down a turning to the left. (There are a couple of these turnings). Was a bit muddy after a days rain but we just put some reeds down, people from the village walk past in the morning but they didn’t seem too bothered.

name: Car Park Sacro Monte di Crea
description: This grassy car park is below the Monte de Créa.  It is accessible by rod and is near the top of the hill.  It has the most amazing views over the valley.  Campers appear to be left unchallenged overnight.  There is a security camera directed at the park probably monitored by the police.  Busy during the day but promises to be very peaceful overnight.

name: Tuscany hill camp
description: Turn left off the main track road past a golf course then turn left again into this field about ten minutes down the track and when a small stream crosses the road. A beautiful place even if you aren’t on top of a hill

name: Free Camping by the lake
description: Free Camping by the lake, very quiet and beautiful sorounding by mountains

name: Agip Gas Station - All you need
description:
Gas station with all you need. Free hot showers included. Showers and restrooms are inside the restaurant, downstairs.
Potable water for your tank, and dump station for black and gray water.
There are 4 places dedicated for campers, with se view of the ocean. Great stop.
Wi-Fi was not working.

name: Agip Gas Station - all services
description: Another great Agip gas station offering free hot showers, along with black and gray water dump station. Fresh water tap as well.

name: Garage delle isole
description: Safe parking area for those traveling to the islands from Milazzo. 11€ per day for outdoor parking. Has car wash, water and toilets. Saw a couple with camper van set up on gravel lot as well. Not the prettiest spot but great location and safe.

name: Free from 8PM-8AM
description: Plenty of parking available here. Leveled at this location (next to the church). Quiet at night, had no issues. About 10 min walk to the tower.

name: Gas station
description: Full camper service at gas station. No shower.

name: Before going to Venice
description: Drive down the track, there’s an unlocked gate. Bit of a bumpy muddy track. You have a view of cruise and cargo ships that look like they’re floating on the next field over.

name: Parking, water and sewer
description: Parking free for vans. Not so big and quite full. Free water (not specified if potable). Free sewer with a hole in the floor (not so easy to aim it!). In town (San Piero a Sieve) easy to reach. Near shops and market. Surrounded by a little park.

name: La Salina Parking
description: Convenient and comfortable parking on gravel with services for vans/trucks, etc. Very nice owners, 1 bathroom with shower, picknick area and shuttle service within Trapani included in the price 10 Euro/24 hours. 40 mn walk to either center and cable car to Erice. Quiet at night. Supermarket and Decathlon across the street.

name: Easy Wash
description: Nice small self laundry with very modern machines. You don‘t need detergent or softener it‘s included. Next to the laundy is a bar.

name: Agip Gas Station - Free hot shower
description: This is another great stop. Small but clean shower. Free. Just ask the cashier.

name: Best wild camp in Rome
description:
Stayed 3 nights. Quiet and safe. This spot is right in front of the Egypt’s Embassy. There’s a simple security camera point to the academy’s gate, that “supposedly” could add to security. Security guard 24h inside the building. Metro station 1km away. Left the car 3 days here without any issues.
Paid parking but cheap. €2-3 per day and free at night. There’s free parking in the lower part (2nd pic). Fits 7,5m rigs.

name: Zapponeta Camper Ground
description: We arrived at this place, when it was closed. Just outside the Entrance is a flat, nice  place for urgency stay ocer night. We do not know the details inside.

name: Pull off with a view
description: Pull off by the road. Very little traffic. No services but a bench seat and a trash bin. Stopped for a break, but this would be a great camping spot.

name: Eni Agip Full service gas station
description: Another great stop. Free showers and dump station. Thanks Eni!

name: Orthopedic clinic
description:
This parking lot is super busy during the day, but you can find plenty of places after 7 PM.
Not that leveled, but not that bad either. Quiet and safe. Left the car here to walk the city. No issues. Other cars spent the night here as well. Private but they don’t mind campers here, specially for the night. Free.

name: Small flat grassy place surrounded by trees
description: Pass the end of the lake, then take the road on the right. After the bend, take the small dirt road that climbs to the left.

name: big place near the river, close to the road
description: Place between road and river. Mostly quiet, there are not to much car on this road but we are on a off season.

name: Gas station with dump station - Free
description: Good gas station with free dump station. No showers on this one.

name: La Terrazza di Hermès
description: La Terrazza di Hermès is a camping area for camper and caravan. 50 place, 25 euro, electricity 6 ampere. Rent auto, bike esclusive tour service with helicopter tour

name: Residential neighborhood
description: Spent a night on this side of the river. Some traffic but not bad. Safe and free.

name: Torre Sabeo
description: Very nice, familiar CP, near Gallipoli, with shuttle bus to the city, nearby shopping center, near the rocky beach.

name: Agrotourismo Fontanelle
description: Nice friendly CP, good infrastructure, flat area, near beach, places with and without shade

name: Interspar Mall - Free after 8PM
description: Small parking lot by a mall. Free from 8PM-8AM. Spent one quiet night. No one bothered. No height limit.

name: Eni Agip gas station
description:
Good stop. Has everything, but showers.
Dumping station is simple, but there’s water at the tap. Bathrooms clean. I was told there’s shower at the next stop 20km towards Trieste.

name: Costa Morena Terminal
description: Stay over night is allowed. No Service from 8 pm if Terminal is closed. Ferry only every 2 nights.

name: Specchiolla Port
description: Parking lot at the  small port. We were looking for a Campground, but all were closed. This parking lot served several campers as a „last resort“. No service, quiet, some boat watering in the evening.

name: Agrioasi
description:
Really nice campground on an old farm. Nice owners, clean facilities, showers, pool, jacuzzi (!). Dogs are welcome.

We stayed here for one night (25€, 2pax).

Autostrada/highway is a bit noisy at night. But everything else will make up for you. although there is no Wi-Fi (very fast LTE here), we highly recommend this place!

name: Po riverside
description: Perfect for a tent, easy access but totally hidden. Perfect place for cyclists and hikers.

name: Camping La Tesa
description:
Campground at an old farm (agristuristo Italy).
Small camp for about 20 campers with a stunning view on Lake D‘Iseo (photo). Hot showers, pool, quiet at night.
We stayed for one night. Wished to have time staying here for one week.

name: Conad supermarket
description:
Supermarket at Iseo.
Accessible for big rigs

name: Eni Agip Gas Station
description:
Another great station offering free hot showers along with dump station.
Shower is at the back. Ask cashier. They’ll ask for your passport and hand you the key.

name: Osalla Beach Garden Sardinien
description: Place for a Campervan close to a great sand beach.

name: Free City Campground
description: This is where locals told me to come. Way better than the other spot. There’s plenty of spots and cameras. There’s a chemical toilet as well. Other campers also spent the night here.

name: Parking lot near a canal, 35 minutes from Venice.
description:
Good place to stay on night or more. Trashcans and benches available. Flat and quiet at night. 
Good place to play petanque.

name: Messina port offices
description:
the offices of Messina shipping line are here. This is the place to take out your car coming from Africa if it got shipped with messina lines.
you wil need the document of delivery issued by Messina. 
in the office you have to wait until they prepare some documents to take release the car.
then someone came to pick me up to get the car.

name: free water
description: loading and unloading of waste water for campers

name: Camping Piccolo Paradiso
description:
Small and nice campground. 
Beach is across the street. 
Verry dogfriendly.

name: Free hot shower at Gas Station
