description: Another great stop with all you need. Free hot shower. RV dump station as well. Wi-Fi.

name: sevetene Italie
description:
at the end of a dead end, only for van, no motorhome, 3 places maximum, not far from the expressway, but for the night it is good.
--
au bout d'un voie sans issue, uniquement pour van, pas de camping car, 3 places maxi, non loin de la voie express, mais pour la nuit c'est bien.

name: Fattoria Maionchi
description: Wineyard and Olive Oel Producer , very nice place for couple days and to visit Lucca. We went to the town with the bicycles. The owner are two young guys, you can have a tasting for wine and oel. Quiet at night.

name: Licata Kitebeach
description:
Wonderful quite campsite direct at a white soft sanded beach. Perfect for kite surfers or surfers and/or beach goers. Owner of the camp site charges 25€/ night including electricity. Slow mobile net at the camp site. Shower 50ct/ 3 minutes. 

Site is absolutely amazing. B&B also available!!

name: Azienda del Lupo - Wolfgang Haas
description:
Nice / small / silent campsite in the garden of a beautiful house with a view over the wine hills.
Spots for Campers, caravan, tents - holiday apartment

name: Tap water
description: Tap water in the main park, open at night.

name: Funtana Onniga
description: Nice pic nic area under trees with a drink water fontain

name: Talamone Camping Village
description: Big site with many options for camping - not much space between camper van pitches, weird but very clean showers with no place to hang clothes or put anything down Sqaut toilets.  Washing machines at extra cost.  Pool and restaurant on site, camp is close to the beach.

name: Agricampeggio Colle Dei Lupi
description: Great place in a fab little village up in the mountains. Shady pitches, very clean ablutions and reasonably priced.   Electricity and a wash basin / water point at each site.  Owners were very helpful.  Entrance is pretty steep so big rigs will struggle to get in.

name: La Spiaggetta
description: Free campspot. It's allowed to stay here. Nice view, only locals here. Awesome lake.

name: Capo Sperone Sardinien
description: Very nice silent place for 4x4 car’s only

name: Isola Giardinelli
description: Nice little Spot directly next to the water. Fully quiet at off season till mid July. Check the weather and wind before camping!!! Could be very strong

name: Tourist Village "Le Dune" Oasis Resort
description: Well established and neat campsite for all size rigs, with some rather bizarre rules (no shoes allowed to be worn in the toilet block) and a fairly strict set of guidelines.  Sites are marked and allocated on arrival, all are relatively close to the beach. Noisy at night from nearby town, was not sure if it was a train constantly shunting or an ongoing volcanic eruption.  Expensive at €37 per night for a Land Rover, RTT and 2 people.  Wifi access for the price of a kidney, per device / hour.   We were also billed an additional €3 euro for some sort of ‘fine’.  I would avoid this place unless you like taking a bit of a beating.

name: Riverside
description: Parking area large enough for several camping cars near the river & near cycling path. Near road & visible but not a problem. We parked our moto & put our tent under the picnic shelter across the bridge, a bit more hidden from the road. Beautiful views of the mountains.

name: Minicamping Alessandra
description:
We spent 2 night over there with our VW Bus 
It is a camping only for tents but there is 1 or 2 spot for a minivan 
Really nice, Alessandra, the owner is very kind and helpful 
Really clean and quiet at night
There is only 8 spots lost in the nature 
I really recommend if you need calm 
There is all the amenities you need, included a washing machine! 
we paid, for 2 people, our van and 2 night 60 €

name: Seven Hills Camping
description: Gigantic but nice camping place close to Rome. It’s located in a valley with a lot of shade. Paid 15 euros for a tent and two motorbikes.

name: Vesuvio Eco Camping
description:
Small camping run by a community of young people. It’s the perfect place if you want to stay out of the touristy, industrialized  area.
They have a small bar on the location and they also sometimes cook and just invite you for dinner.

name: Mergia woods: Gravina / Altamura. Bosco Pulichio Woods
description:
LIMITED VEHICLE ACCESS
Quiet Woods, not super dense trees, enough room for tents but good cover. No scary wild animals. Exact location is fairly flat, just over a little verge off a public footpath in the woods. Arrive late, leave early as may get dog walkers.

name: Lago di Campotosto
description: a minute away from the lake, some toilets and a cafe too but popular with motorhomes, stunning views of the lake

name: Bilancino Lake park
description: Very nice gravel parking area on the lake, few motorhomes in the evening and a nice area in the trees to set up tents. Lake is perfect in the summer for a dip right next to the parking. Away from road so no noise, very pleasant and relaxing area. Good 4g coverage.

name: Camping Marina Del Convento
description:
Nice, well maintained camping with lot of shades and beach access. There are mostly campers but they let you pitch up your tent if they have free places.
The beach here is superb and have lot less people than at the other better know places.
There is a pizza place at the camping next door. Don’t go there! It’s a tourist trap!

name: Area Sosta Camper - La Rosa
description:
The La Rosa well-equipped rest area is a private and large structure.

 It is located in Coreglia Ligure about 15km from the sea.

The area is completely fenced, hosts 14 pitches (8 m x 3 m, 24 m2 + 24 m2 adjacent personal) with columns equipped with connection to drinking water and electricity (6 Ampere) personal and 6 free pitches (8m x 3m, 24m2 ) without connection for personal drinking water and electricity.
The wifi coverage covers the entire parking area.
The area is under video surveillance, cameras with license plate recognition are used, these cameras are also used to open the entrance bar.

There is a CAMPER SERVICE for draining waste water and a tap for connecting drinking water for free pitches that do not have a personal connection.

The area is equipped with 2 sinks for dishes, one of these is also equipped with coin-operated hot water.

 There are 4 toilets, one for the disabled, with 4 token-operated showers with hot water, 2 token-operated washing machines.
---
L’area di sosta attrezzata La Rosa è una struttura privata ed ampia. 

È situata a Coreglia Ligure a circa 15km dal mare.

L’area è interamente recintata, ospita 14 piazzole (8 m x 3 m, 24 m2 + 24 m2 adiacenti personali) con colonnine dotate di allacciamento ad acqua potabile e corrente elettrica (6 Ampere) personali e 6 piazzole libere ( 8m x 3m, 24m2 ) senza allacciamento acqua potabile personale e corrente elettrica.
La copertura wifi copre l’intera area di sosta.
L’area è videosorvegliata, si utilizzano telecamere con riconoscimento delle targhe, queste telecamere vengono utilizzate anche per l’apertura della sbarra di ingresso.

È presente un CAMPER SERVICE per lo scarico delle acque reflue e un rubinetto per l’allacciamento dell’acqua potabile per le piazzole libere che non hanno l’allacciamento personale.

L’area è dotata di 2 lavandini per le stoviglie, uno di questi è dotato anche di acqua calda a gettone.

Sono presenti 4 servizi igienici di cui uno per disabili, con 4 doccie con acqua calda a gettone , 2 lavatrici anchesse a gettone .

name: Camping Captain
description:
Huge but really friendly camping place
right on the beach. They have a lot of shady places for tents.

name: Zorza parking
description:
good place for long vehicles to park all day, 1euro per hour.
you can Walk the path downstairs to Riomaggiore and visit all Cinque Terre by train.

name: Villa Speranza Camping Garda
description: Small campground with everything one needs and nothing more. It is clean, relatively quiet and fairly priced.

name: Free camping
description: Free parking lot. Water and electricity is also for free. Nice and flat. Fits every size vehicle.

name: Idroscalo Est Parking
description:
Big parking place, water, showers and a lake inside the public park.
Entry is free, you just pay for parking.
Only place we found for big vehicles, other are limited to around 2,5m.

Edit after leaving: 5€ per day is parking fee, a park guard aka gangster wanted us to pay 20€ in cash and at exit we would have to pay the 10€ for our 2 days.
Don't do it and complain within the park to such behaviour.
Nevertheless its a good parking spot to visit the Scala and Dome. You need 45 mins with bus to Airport and from there directly to centre/Dome.

name: Mountain top
description: A small, quiet spot quite well hidden from the road. Only big enough for one small van or truck, we stayed with our truck + roof tent. Amazing views all around, very little shade.

name: Camping - Bio Farm
description:
Super nice, little, quiet camping place in a farm environment. Owners are really cool and helpfull and they cook reall well. 
There’s also a swimming pool.
We paid 18 euros for one tent, two persons, two motorcycles.
So if you’re in this area and sick of the industrial camper villages this is the place to go!

name: Mountain Magic
description: Several options for tents or parking. Not quite invisible from the road, but close enough. There's a stream for water, and great views.

name: Nice little hut
description: Nice little hut with a bunk bed and a table inside. The hut is located next to a river.

name: Nice place above the Lago di Garda next to the street.
description: Not much traffic only a few locals and maybe some motorcycles since the TET Italy goes through here. No ethernet connection here.

name: Small Fountain
description: small Fountain with quality controlled water.

name: Parco Europa
description:
Free parking place, fits big rigs easily. It's a dead end street and super quiet at night! the park has one water fountain in the middle, and you can swim in the river or at the lake at the end of the park.
Edit: today the "parco ticino" unit was here and held an exercise, no one said anything;)

name: private Camping
description: private Camping place you can't sleep here.

name: Fenton camping
description: small camping with only Italian people. Small bar in front of the camping. very nice people. I paid 10€ for the place (tent) and 4€ for beer 0,5L

name: Parcheggio publico Quassa
description: A nice free parking spot for big rigs. The path down to the lake is at the south end of the parking. We stayed one night, so didn't look for amenities

name: Parcheggio gratuito cimitero
description:
good place to stay overnight and refill usable water sources, did a full cloth washing here.
whole day nearly no one came, after 5 o clock some visitors to the cemetery.
Respecting place is obligatory.

name: Camping Amici Di Lacize
description:
Nice small campground near the lake and the Parc Caneva world but quiet at night. Swimming pool.
110€ for 2 nights with 2 adults, 2 kids, 1 dog and camping car.

name: Campeggio Saletti
description: Quiet enclosed Place close to the River. Completely flat, grassy, sunny but shaded by trees. Beverages and Snacks, Washing Machine, available. 600 m to village with supermarket, Pizzeria.  Check in at the "Bar Saletti"

name: Cacchet Alberto motorcycle and bicycle shop/repair
description: Made an oil change here very kind old guy doesn't speaks Englisch but with Google translate and gestures we understood each other well. paid 80€ for 3L oil and his work.

name: Chez serena
description:
Very nice place to stay very calm and clean 
The owner is very friendly 
Not far from pinerolo

name: Camping Village Lago Arsie
description:
Nice flat campground. Good and easy holding ground for tents. Sunny with some trees. Very clean toilets and showers, very friendly staff. (Motor)Biker friendly. Shop for bread and basic alimentation, Restaurant, access to the lake and swimming pool available and included. Washing machines 5€.
We moved here from Camp Galijole which is about 700m down the street and less friendly, less flat and more expensive (27€+9€ 
per person compared to 17,50 € here).

name: Camping Sambalon
description: Nice camping, paid 24 euro for 2 people with roof top tent. Price is inclusive shower, wifi, electricity and beach use. On the beach are beds, chairs and umbrellas free of charge. Washing machine is 5 euro extra. Toilets and showers are very clean. Only negative point is the disco from nearby resorts, but it stops at 23:59

name: Camping Terrazza sul Bosco
description: Private garden with place for camping with tent or small camper/van.

name: Lido Lilla Camping & Bar
description:
Not busy even though we were here in July. We prefer small campsites with more local people and it seems you get this here. Quite pricey but that is camping by the lake in Italy, we think. Paid for two adults and two kids, a car and an off-road caravan 56 € per night. 
They make super good and strong coffee cheap at the bar. Nice for just a stop as well.

name: Camp at the River
description: Nice little spot at the end of a gravel track, right next to the river. The area is declared as a touristic swimming area. Has a hiking path nearby but no hassle. Nice view to the mountains which are lit up by the evening sun.

name: Falconara
description:
The parc is opened 24/7 and is located uphill not far from the beach (15mn walk, it is quite steep!)
A lot of trees and of fields to set up your tents or  hammocks.

We slept there one night and it felt quite safe, no one bothered us.
There is no access to water or shower, but you can find some water and showers on the beaches of San Terenzo !

Restaurants are just downhill next to the beach too, we rode our bike back uphill by the end of the night to set up our camp.

name: cantina Aru winery
description:
very nice place to taste local wine cheese and ham
People are super friendly and will explain you everything about wine production
Wine is quite good and cheap, we  bought 6 bottles

name: Water point
description: Free fresh water access point with choice between sparkling or still water !

name: Water fountain in Piazza Brusacà
description: Just in front of the Foccaceria Tiziana there is a water fountain to wash your feet. It is fee of access and you can drink the water !

name: on bike path, behind tables
description:
this is a nice rather hidden spot for wild camping for BIKERS/CYCLISTS on the bike path from Bolzano to Trento. there are 2 tables and you hear the river. 

I heard no noise after about 21h and I woke up at 8am, and there were a few road cyclists whizzing by. no one stopped to ask/bother. there is a light on the whole night across the river. I'm a female traveling alone by bike and this was a great spot for me. it was about 15⁰ at night, a bit humid. no tent, just a good sleeping bag and a mat. 

enjoy!

name: Bike camp laghetti dell aquila
description:
No vehicle access!

it's hard to find a place to sleep here but this little river is great. I'm traveling by bike

name: Camping cima piazzi
description: Liked my stay here, enjoyed the pizza in the on site restaurant.

name: Nosy campsite
description: The road up here is worth the trip. Or the amazing view from there picknick area. I got a deal on a mini bungalow, as they would allow tenting because off expected rain.

name: Parking to visit the city
description: Free parking, quiet at night. 15-20 min to the city

name: Camping Riva del Setta
description:
nice camping place. we payed 21€/night for 2 people + tent + car

kids play area, pool, tennis, table tennis,...
hot and cold showers, dryer (possibly also a washing machine),... 
you can hear the highway but it doesnt bother much..

name: Solanas
description:
Large dirt parking area like many others in Sardinia that are free. Directly in front of the beach. No shade anywhere though. Can not put tent or clothesline because authorities patrol but if overlanding & sleeping inside the vehicle this is a good spot.

The town of Solanas has small market and cafes. Beach offers clean & clear water

name: Centro polifunzionale
description: Camper place in a small city center. Perfect for rooftop tents or everything bigger. At this date I pay €5 for 12h and €10 for 24h. It’s a safe travel through spot, it has a free toilet and a shower. You have a bit of noise from the kids playing and the tractors passing through.

name: Baberino di Mugello
description: Next to the lake, you can travel it by car (4×4 not needed).

name: Large opening beside dirt track
description: Big opening along a easy to drive dirt road, no 4wd needed but quite bumpy! No rubbish here so please keep it that way! Room for 4-5 trucks/vans

name: 180 amazing view
description: This place has an amazing view of Genova all around.on top of the mountain behind the city, you’ll be there in 15 min from the beach. The last 100 m are on a gravel road and the climb is quite steep but doable.

name: Passo Polentin
description: Road on the Austrian side is open from June 1st until October 15th. Both sides are well maintained gravel roads.

name: Loreto Aprutino
description: Free water potable, next to the main plaza.

name: La Colma (balconata di Ormea)
description: Really beautiful spot, a paradise at 1500m. To get here you need to take quite narrow offroad but not a difficult one, doable  even with a small/medium van. There is plenty of spots to stop for the night ( don't park on the grass as you can get fined ). Amazing views and lots of marmots!

name: RHO Panorama for a tent
description: Lookout Place over the Convention Center of Milano where surely only few people ever come. A Bit of noise from the street. Check it out in google maps

name: On the foot of Monte Pelmo
description:
Nice place in the middle of nature just in the foot of Monte Pelmo. Please don’t do fires here and take your trash with you.

Directions: From the main road on Passo Staulanza there’s before the first turn on the left a forest road used for wood work. You need a little bit of ground clearance with your vehicle to reach the point. Don’t attempt with a road car. Be careful when it’s wet and muddy to not to get stuck.

name: Camping Cetona
description: Informal campsite, very quiet. You need to drive the gravelroad to get there. In high season just one other guest

name: Lago do Cavazzo
description:
It is a free camp side next to the lake .
It is a large area with trees , bins and picnic tables are available .
Everything is nice accept it is under the motorway .

name: San Pellegrino camperplace
description: beautiful camper place with simple toilet and shower, 2 km away from the city, 10 camper pitches and payment machine

name: Sea Laguna
description:
nice spot for wild camping. Follow a little path throw the forest and look for a place. 
In the morning you will see some mountainbikers but the don't care.

name: next to river
description: The site is on a path that actually belongs to a farm, but the field had already been harvested and we knew that no tractor would pass us. There is also a small swimming area here.

name: Tagliamento waterfalls
description:
Nice place down next to the Tagliamento River with some little waterfalls. In August easily reachable with low water levels. Don’t know how it is the year round. 
Directions: Take a dirt road to the right before the first turn of Passo Rest. You pass some other spots to stay, a little house on the left and then on the left there’s a way to the camp spot.

name: Birrificio Agricolo Kauss
description: Kauss it's a farmhouse brewery . We offer two spots for camper for free near the brewery. Electricty and water refill for free. There isn't shower. Toilet only during the opening hours of the brewery shop.

name: Pineta
description: Quiet place all day and night, no police controls. it’s near a little village, you can peacefully rest all night

name: Fontana
description: Fountain with drinking water................

name: Passo Gardena Water Stop
description: A large gravel parking spot with free-flowing water

name: Nice place on the border of the park
description: On the border of the park Foreste Casentinese. From here there are nice hiking paths.

name: area sosta camper Terrauzza Sul Mare
description: Nice campground at agriturismo. 2 minuten walk from the sea. Trees and electricity. Wc and cold shower. Lovely place!

name: place near Torre Murtas
description: It is so beautiful. Put your car near the sea and jump in the water. There is nothing, not even mobile internet but the vieuws are stunning.

name: Sa Mola Experience
description: Wonderfull place! Campground belongs to an olive producer. There is also possibility to stay on the parking next to the factory where is water and a bathroom. Here is nothing but olive trees and superior views. And a lot of cozy stuff like colored furniture, tent, etc. They offer olive oil tasting and selling, of course. We payed 6 euro.

name: Pergine Valdarno
description: Pergine Valdarno overlooking the valley. Nice and quiet place near the village and over a soccer field. Easy to reach and flat spot.

name: Al Vecjo Traghèt
description: Bar and restaurant on the banks of Tagliamento river. Wonderful nature and landscapes. It's possible to camp here with tent for 3€ per person. You can also have dinner and breakfast. Shower with hot water 0,50€, toilet 0,50€. It has also park for van and camper but I don't know how much it costs.

name: In the wood
description: Easy entry, you can find this Place on your right

name: passo Degli Onari
description: Grassy spot, not that flat, next to the pass. Awesome view.

name: wold garden with a stone bridge
description: a nice grassy spot in the middle of the bush.

name: Crai supermarket
description: Supermarket with everything, including ready to eat food and local products. I stopped here for lunch and the super kind owner gave me a chair to sit in the shadow and then offer me a coffee. Totally recommended!

name: Camping Milano
description: Large shaded campsite with wifi, 1xwashing machine and dryer, toilets, showers, loading and unloading, restaurant, sauna, and playground. There's a water park next door (separate business).

name: Valle stura outdoor
description: It’s an outdoor activity company with a camping ground. In front of the campground there is a motel name wolf village. Campground is big with enough space. I Payed 4€ per person per night. Incl shower And toilet. There is no wifi.

name: Fiames car park
description: A - free - alternative to Olympia Camping, next door. This is a large, gravel car park next to the road. The ground is not perfectly level and large puddles of water form when raining. But it is free! Bus stop into Cortina is directly opposite. Great for one night, even for the largest rigs and RVs

name: Side near creak-Bridge for a tent
description: Spot close to a biking Trail (ruff condition). There are a few wooden benches here but no further amenities

name: Torri 5 car park
description: A big car park for the ski lift. Hard ground with lots of space. Mostly on a gentle slope (but we didn’t need levelling blocks). During the day time this place is extremely busy but at night time just a few motor homes here. There is drinking water available, near the ski lift, and big skips for rubbish disposal. Very quiet in the evening. You must park according to the signs, otherwise you will get told off by management. Toilets and restaurant available during daytime

name: Agricampeggio al Batèo
description:
Very nice, small campsite between trees. Conveniently located for day trips to Venice as the pier is only 10min walk away. 
As there is no playground or pool, we didn’t experience any kids on the campsite, hence it was very quiet.
Nice and clean facilities and the owners also sell their own produce like veggies, wine and bread.
We paid 30€ for a car and 2 people. That includes everything.
Can definitely recommend.

name: Hidden grassfield with little bit of a mountain view
description: Large grassfield, partly flat and partly angeled. Accessible by a small dirtroad from a small paved road. Suitable for smaller rigs or motorcycles. There is a window with less dense greenery so might be able to get spotted from the small street if you have bright colours or reflective materials, i tried to hang some black clothing over my gray motorcycle, worked out fine and nobody bothered me during the night.

name: Hilltop
description: Quiet spot with a view up a gravel road. Arrived at 1am, stayed until 10:30 with a few locals coming by in the morning, no one bothered us. Good for one night.

name: SP ex SS277
description: This is a good place to pitch up your tent for the night. It is not appropriate for campers. If you go until the end of the paved road, you walk 50 meters further down and there is a nice, flat and quiet place. No water, at least not in September. In winter or spring, there might be a small stream here.

name: Camp spot on the mountain pass
description: I only had lunch here, but it is a great spot to spend the night. You have to follow the small road (paved) that deviates from the main road, and then a short unpaved road to the right. I don't think it is suitable for camper vans, I am on a bicycle. Motorbike would also be fine!

name: Ferramenta Michele Oriolo
description: Place to refill propane tank for camping

name: Free shower
description: Free shower next to a free parking lot with shade

name: Goloritze - Sardinia
description: Very nice place to stay!!! Hot Shower, Bar and Restaurant and Wild animals around.

name: Shady spot for lunch
description: Shady spot with Hugh olive trees. A little church and couple places to sit. Good for a lunch brake

name: Al Maneggio
description: horseback riding, mountain bike trails, walks, hiking, top quality food products, hotel and shelter.

name: Wild camp spot
description: Perfect spot for a night (or 2!). There are benches and there is a water tap. If you wish to have the sun in the morning you can camp 100 meters further in the farm field. I came quietly by bicycle, but motorbikes and small vans can also give it a shot. You can use open street maps to navigate, it's easy. Enjoy!

name: Quarry onifai
description: Beautiful and quiet spot in the hills with many options to pitch a tent or park your camper van. Perfect for cars or bicycles with a Great view

name: Bike Park Km99 (Bicyclists only)
description: The friendly owner welcomes everybody who needs a stay overnight in their tend. It's completely free and you can have a drink and something to eat there too.

name: Fontana Meiga
description: Beautiful spot on the beach. Flat and easy to reach. I recommend to avoid high season, now in September it's perfect.

name: fanano barbecue
description: is a picnic area, the is barbacoa be careful because is next to the route,if you want to sleep. is a place where truck drivers rest.

name: Pineta
description: I slept here one night, we are in a small wood, you don't get to the sea, but you are more protected from the wind.  the road is not paved but flat.

name: Torre Borraco
description: parking area near the sea, excellent in the off-peak season, clean

name: ATM
description: ATM links an der Haupt Straße. Baconnat. Super fast and super easy

name: Laundry
description: Laundry at touristic service beggerru green tourism. Open 10-13

name: agriturismo il lago
description: small and quiet campsite with wooden, open shelter for cooking and warm showers

name: camping Aquilea
description: large campground, friendly staff, rather quiet in the end of September

name: Landry Bloomest
description: Self-service laundry at the gas station, ideally located before or after the Italy/Greece crossing.  There is ample parking for any type of vehicle with service at the Conad supermarket.  the price is right and detergent and fabric softener are provided

name: Parking Ancône
description: large free parking dedicated to motorhomes with all services, located next to a hypermarket.  A good option before or after the Italy/Greece ferry.

name: Picnic ground
description:
On google maps it appears as a picnic, but its without chair and table. we slept 1 night, in a tent a motorbike. Is not comfortable for a  tent because the ground is steep, but not too much, for a night its ok.
 Very quiet, it was Saturday, autumn.

name: Savona Parking Waterfront
description: Medium sized parking spot, free parking, located directly at the waterfront and close by to a little park and kids playground. Good place to park and hang out if you are waiting for a ferry. We also saw some vans that parked here for the night. Around 9.30 o’clock in the morning police showed up to check if there are campers but they just talked to the people, no problems.

name: Alanno
description: Potable water for free, next to the church, quiet city to park your camper and sleep too.

name: Parking spot in Polignano
description:
Here is a pretty big square where we parked for free (3rd october). Overall the place has a good vibe, it's by the sea and seems secure. 

Remember:
white areas = Free
blue areas = Paid
yellow areas = Residents only

name: Baja Sardinia, Via Porto Sole
description: Parking lot in front of a small pier.  Directly at the sea. Several beautiful beaches within walking distance. Without shadow.  Spectacular views of the bay.

name: Beach camping
description:
we drove here from the parcheggio pineta. there is a dirt road you can use to get to at about 50m from the beach. there is plenty of tracks going around (check Google satellite view).

very quiet night. no one around. some lights are on throughout the night from nearby settlements.

bigger rigs can spend the night on the dirt parking mentioned before. plenty of room there.

name: camping riviera
description: Nice camping with a lot of services. Not suggested for tents. It is well positioned near by the local village and supermarkets. Regarding the beaches, they can be reached by walking even if it is not so close and there is some height to hike. however, the campsite privides a small bus service. last but not least, electricity is available at tend sites but it could be better distribuited.

name: sketchy place, good in a pinch
description:
We came quite late to the seaside, so we didn't have much time to check it out. But all the entrances for the beach to the south have a ramp for at least 7km. Plus a kind lady offered some "amore" when we stopped to check out one of the gates. Lots of sketchy dudes standing by the side of the road as well.

This spot is a parking lot, but seems pretty quiet for the night. there is a gated hotel nearby which adds a sense of security.

name: Sorgente Su lidone
description: fresh water spring cose to the road. pic bic area cose to it.

name: Sorgente Pubusinu
description: pic nic area close to a stream and to the fresh water spring.

name: sorgente
description: fresh water spring close to the road. drinkable water.

name: Capo Pecora
description: camping spot for tents close to a secondary road. quite busy of local people during the week end.

name: Torre cannai
description: on the road right below the tower Cannai , space for few caravan, more tents.

name: Cala Lunga
description: parking area (on payment but cheap) and  little bar right on the beach. Vans and caravans welcome, some spot for tents right on the beach.

name: Cala de Sa Perda Longa
description:
2 km of gravel road not maintained. Only transitable by off road cars or cycles.
a lot of nice spot were to camp with tent very close to the beach and shaded by the bush. warm water and very beautiful bay. in the week end might be busy due also to the boats coming to visit the bay.

name: Fontana de Susu
description: Public fountain at the exit of the village

name: path of the gods wild stay
description:
Quiet parking spot at the trail start.

there are free parking spots (white) just before the start of the trail. there is a guard dog at the property above, but overall super quiet and safe place with a fantastic view.

Van fits with ease, a motor home should do fine as well. in a pinch there is a gravel lot cca 500m back that can accommodate anything for the night.

A bit more activity in the morning due to hikers.

name: The Olive Garden
description:
The Olive Garden (very narrow road to get to). A wider area that can host a couple of vehicles.
We came here as we thought we could get to the beach, but it was gated off 150m ahead.
To get here it's super narrow,  a van would already be a challenge (big one). we had an SUV.

The road is pretty and all done with stone tiles from a certain point. Further down is a gate and no turning points, so do not venture on from the coordinates. your clutch will appreciate it.

if you take a small stroll down the path (300m) there are olive trees and an amazing view of Capri.

name: Abandoned hotel on vesuvius
description:
We found an abandoned hotel next door to the observatory. Easily walkable from the main road. 

it's a surreal experience,  an amazing hotel with a breathtaking view over Napoli, completely forgotten.

you can enter and walk around it.

what a waste. highly recommend the visit.

name: Port Palermo
description:
Pretty easy and straightforward port. There are signs and people helping out.

I was going to Tunisia with GNV. When checking in, I needed to have a return ticket and proof of hotel for the entire time I’m in Tunisia. A couple days at the start was not enough. In Tunisia, they wanted to see Covid documents, was not sure which, showed them vaccination document and that was fine.

name: Camping Siino delle Rose
description: Camp site for tent and camper with wc, hot shower, electricity. Common area with tables and chairs with a vending machine for coffee. 10€ per person with one a tent.

name: Public Showers & Toilets
description: Restaurant with payed toilets and an outdoor shower (cold) for 1 euro. The camper area close by was closed by october 22, maybe open during high season.

name: Roadside
description: Roadside with nice view. Quite and safe to spend a night.

name: La Fornace
description:
Parking area close to private country homes (50 mt.) - Hamlet at 300 Mt - Village at 3 Km 
Hill area, beside local woods, nice natural views
Easy access
Phone coverage - Vodafone/Wind/TIM 
Area - wide enough for 3 vans 
Check for space availability

name: Trobaso Picnic Area
description:
quiet area in the grass a few km from verbania, can only be reached by bike or on foot.
Near the river with drinking fountain and tables

name: Azienda Rasicci
description: Top. Great place to spend the night. Very friendly people. Grandpa is still going strong.

name: parking lot near the Basilic
description:
large parking lot near the recycling area.
flat and convenient before heading to the huge monument

name: Nice large spot
description:
looking for a remote place with a nice view? just go up a dirt road and you'll have plenty of choice to park any size and as much vehicles as you want.
view on Italy and French side, small walk to Italians first world War ruins just nearby on the Noth east side. don't hesitate to walk there, nic peint of view. 
lovely place, deeply recommended!
we went there with a 7.2m camper van, so you can do it guys!

name: breathtaking church
description:
on the top of a steep hill, seats the Sacra di San Michele. this church is the one in the movie The name of the rose. 
you have to go up the hill on a steep road but totally doable. 
A must see !

name: Roadside with perfect view
description:
Translation: Wonderful location with Picnic table and stunning views of the Dolomites and Cortina D’Ampezzo. We had a wonderful night. Beautiful lookout!

Local maravilhoso com mesa de Picnic e vista estonteante das Dolomitas e de Cortina D’Ampezzo. Tivemos uma noite maravilhosa. Lindo mirante!

name: Nice spot by the lake
description: Easy access by car . You park off the small road. It has a big spot of campers and motor homes. Locals said it’s okay to spend the night just don’t rip up the grass. Beautiful lake to take a swim and freshen up.

name: Ville
description: Drinkable water next to the road in the town

name: San Domenico
description: Very nice and quiet location in the wild, not far from the village.

name: Il Moro Della Molpa
description: This is a small campsite privately owned. You will park you RV between lemon and olives trees! 20€ per night with electricity and clean bathrooms. This is the only place still open in November. Make sure to call 0974933142 or visit http://www.ilmorodellamolpa.it .

name: Off -road Track
description:
Follow steep tarmac roads, they turn to gravel and keep going until you see a decent sized gravel area with a great view. 
If you fancy some fun on the trails carry on and eventually take a right up to a wind farm (maybe a bit too much fun for some). 
You could certainly get bigger trucks to the camp spot but maybe not beyond

name: Lido Lentiscelle
description: This is a large parking area that gives access to the beach. We talked with the owner of the campsite just across the street and he told us that camping is allowed in off-season (November to March) since all the campgrounds in the area are closed. There was another van staying for the night. You also have access to hiking trails from here.

name: Hill top view of San Gimignano
description:
Lovely park up with great views 
Follow road up to Fattoria il piano and turn onto track just before entering the complex
4x4 needed 
Not really suitable for big rigs

name: Flat gravel area just off long gravel track
description:
A nice gravel area, easy access via gravel track 
Looks reasonably unused

name: Water Taormina
description: Tap should be drinkable but We filtered  it.

name: Agriturismo il favalo
description:
Agriturismo with homemade and home produced food. Warm rooms, free parking, English speaking, extremely friendly. 
68€/night, huge breakfast included!

name: spring with drinkable water
description: spring with drinkable water.

name: Self service Speedy wash Lavanderie
description: Self wash laundry. Camping spot just opposite. Easy to use machines. Dryer uses only 15 min. Washer 40 min.

name: little forrest for bicycles only
description: this little forrest has several hidden spots for cyclists. very quiet.

name: Lago di Cavazzo
description:
Quiet (wild) camping spot down the bridge.
We are with a motorcycle and a tent, it’s very safe here. Just a few people around.

name: Onda Blu
description: Selfservice  laundry. Address: 7 via Genova; Santa Teresa de Galura; Sardaigna.

name: Monza
description: Easy spot to have really Good drinking water

name: under/next to bridge
description: going towards the coast, cross the bridge and then get off the road. there's a big dirt pile to block the part under the bridge and the part next to the river. I guess motorhomes could park in front of it though. perfect for cyclists. so many spots and nobody around

name: Fontana
description: Nice foutain with mountain view and place to park. Potable

name: Padivarma parking
description:
Small parking for cars and just below for truck. We spend one night there cause we didn't find other place. It was OK for one night, some noise in the morning but not during night. Good local meat shop just in front.

Petit parking pour voiture et juste en dessous un pour camion. Nous avons passé une nuit ici, en dépannage car il faisait déjà nuit et on avait pas trouvé d'autre endroit. Plutôt calme la nuit, bruit de circulation le matin mais ça dépanne bien. Bonne boucherie locale en face.

name: Lavanderia wash and dry
description:
Laundry open all day 7:15am to 11:30pm.
Self service. 4€ for washing machine (30min), 2€ to dry 15min (washing powder include).

name: Parking, water and dump station
description:
Parking when you can sleep but you have to come early, you can also fill potable water for free and dump station. 
At 100 meters you can find gaz water for 5cts/1L.

Parking ou vous pouvez dormir mais il faut arriver assez tôt pour avoir de la place. Il y a aussi un point eau potable. Un point pour vider les eaux usées (gratuit). A quelques mètres il y a un distributeur d'eau gazeuse pour 5cts le litre.

name: Presanella camping&chalets
description: Nice and quiet campsite close to Gavia pass. Friendly owners, English spoken. Toilets and showers very clean. Small kitchen. Camping has a small bar, shop, bread and full breakfast service. Also cabins and chalets for rent.

name: Camping Casa Bianca
description: Nice small campsite close to Colle del Nivolet. Friendly owners. Toilets and showers very clean. Small bar and restaurant. Bread service. Cabins for rent.

name: Gabanel Bike Hostel
description:
Hostel with gated parking.
It’s a little bit far from the city but you have a good place to park your vehicle.
Hostel is nice and clean but in the higher range one night 31€ and city tax 1,20€.

name: Watherfontane
description: Fresh Wather around the Fontaine there are eighth taps for fresh wather

name: Sea Art Hotel
description:
50€ for a double room with breakfast included.
20€ for a full dinner

name: L’Autolavaggio Bosa
description:
Car-wash with Camper-service
4€ to fill the fresh water
4€ to empty Black water
4€ to empty Grey Walter
10€ füll service

name: Bosa Marina
description: Free Parking on fine gravel. Place for about 20 camper

name: Capo Palmeri
description:
Access to this place from Barisoni, +/-6km to drive on a small track on rocks. Only accessible with off-road cars.
If you continue the track in south direction above the place you will enter a forbidden military area. Best is to go back in direction of Barisoni.
The place is quiet, you will need some rocks to level you car. Place for 2 cars.

name: Parking under power line
description: Quiet steep road that goes up to some wind turbines. As we couldn't get further up, because the road was to steep and muddy we stopped at this parking spot under some power lines.

name: Fornace Penna
description: Fantastic place to wild camp, safe with quite a lot of people excercising over the day time and just looking at the view. Ocean view next to the beach

name: Pian Dragoni / Ruderi di Selvatiche
description:
secluded and quiet place.  stone building with fireplace and table.  mountain refuge.
reachable by motorbike or 4x4

name: quiet place next to sea
description: perfect place in a little forest next to the sea! we spent 2 nights there with a hammock just next to porto flavia and after dark it is quiet and nobody passing! might get busy during high season

name: blueferry ticket office and embarquing
description: good company.you buy theticket,aside is the embarqument.i paid for a two way ticket open for 60 days 66€.one person toyota landcruiser length 5 m high 2,86

name: on the beach
description: Nice beach place.  Tents and 4x4 possible.  Access bumpy.

name: porticciolo de santa tecla
description: Quiet little town at the beach with safe parking lot to sleep on. Also there’s a shower and a drinking fountain. Close to Acireale. Beautiful spot not too far off.

name: on the top of the ex-(ski)lift
description: a place on the top of the mountain with the great view of the surrounding. there is an old Skilift (actually a lift that took people up to the great views). in the top are many concrete paths, which you can follow to "get lost"

name: at the iron river
description:
this is a campsite at the red River, which has such colour because of the iron ore, that hides in the mountains around it. 
The campsite is on the river bank. It is accessible with either a car with a big ground clearance alias modern SUVs or classical 4x4s. The 4wd drive doesn't hurt, but also a person with good driving skills manage the solid dirt road. Big rigs also catches the spot. We stayed here at the end of the July and the river was still running. Otherwise climb along the dirt road that runs along the river bed and you will probably find it.
There are signs along the road with warnings of sudden rise of the water status due to either big rain or opening of the  "pneumatic lock" !? Well, if there isn't any bad weather alias storm in the surrounding mountains or closing storm from the sea, which is etc. 2.5 km away, I believe that possibilities to be washed away are extremely small (maybe equal to become disabled after spinal anaesthesia :) ).
Anyway, good spot for peace and quiet :) (and Sardinian beer)

name: on the top of the beach
description:
A place is on the top of the small Cliff above the beach. The place itself is very narrow, big enough for one car and quite tillted. It is easy accessible with the car that has enough ground clearance and 4wd is warmly recommend, because on the way back you have to climb back on the road :)
There is sea to swim, own shade is warmly recommend :) The place is also almost GSM signal free :)

name: Spiaggia con pineta
description: A dead end of the road that leads to the sandy beach. Locals come during the day for a beach day, otherwise peacefully. There is no real shade unless you bring it with you, the beach itself is sandy with crystal clear water :)

name: Ishaia e Pradu
description: Beautiful place on the top of mountain with a beautiful view 360' around. Place for 4-5 cars. Access only with off-roader.

name: Spiaggia di Razza di Junco
description: Nice spot on the beach. Easy access but only off-season.

name: Alta hostel
description:
Paid 26 euros at arrival. The website asks you for your credit card information to make a reservation but it won't take your money. Rated best large hostel in the world apparently. 
Has live music events and comfortable beds. On the pricier side but cheapest that I found around Venice. The let me park my motorcycle for free in a secure place.

name: station Gpl
description:
Gpl here
good service
car wash possible
snack and tabac

name: Parcheggio Tropea
description: Behind the wall is a water tap. Potable water with high pressure. Beside a parking, free from 19-9  in the morning.

name: La Gemma di Elena
description:
Awesome place, big apartment, rustic. 
Lucca town centre, inside the walls and nearby all the touristics places.

name: La Traina Camping
description:
Small Campground with about 10 places for vehicles. Green area, hot showers, possibility to empty the toilets en recharge the water. Energy at every spot.
Kind and helpful staff on site.
In high Season there is also a Bar / Restaurant on Site (nothing huge, really cozy amd friendly!)
Check it out.
The surroundings are beautiful and during the night there is only the river nearby which you can hear, or take a bath during hot summer days.

name: ostia piazza sirio
description: a big parking,a lot of lokan park with a camper.good for a night

name: Camping Salerno
description: This is a camping with beach access that can receive 30+ RV and that is opened year long. It cost us 22€ for one night in November. The bathrooms and showers are clean. Shower are 0.5€ for 5 minutes.

name: Campeggio Selvaggio Nel Bosco
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
------
We offer our grove to other people who love nature. The river surrounds the property, the pitches are flat enough to accommodate tents and motorhomes (max. length 6m, not suitable for attics). Calm reigns there, you can relax comfortably around the brazier. A few km from Lake Maggiore, 2 hours walk from Alpe San Michele. We also produce honey, vegetables and fruits.

name: Quite Bay
description:
Just reachable by foot or Bike.
Many ships passing but no people.
Some trash, little beach and next to a Military Air Area.

Really nice for a night and campfire.

name: Robert Baden Powell park
description: Mid-sized paved lot next to the park.  There are no services except a 4G signal.  A bit of road noise from the main road nearby.

name: Torre Lapillo municipal parking
description: Large flat parking lot of the square.  Some spots designated for motorhomes - max 7m.  Free from October 1 to May 31st.  We were told. 1.50 eu per hour in season via Easy park app or machines.  Garbage cans, play park and 4G signal available.  This time of year shops were closed.

name: Tiol Carburanti
description: Separate pumps for GPL.  Attendant must fill.  Was cheaper than several others when we came.  Asked about water but the tap was apparently broken.

name: B&B Abbadia
description: B&B, parking for motorcycle and bike, Tel Marlene 3335893791

name: Area Attrezzata a Pagamento
description: Full service camping complete with toilet, 2 showers, cassette dump, grey water dump, fresh water and power.  Gate is locked.  There is a phone number on it that you call and they will give you the code to open it.  Choose a spot.  The price is 15eu per vehicle inclusive.  At night someone may come to collect or you leave the money in a box near the back of the place with your vehicle license number.  Close to city centre with shops, food and restaurants.  Great value.  No wifi but strong 4G signal.

name: coin laundry
description:
very large free parking next door for motorhomes
possible to pay with 10 euro note or in coins
good machines
-----------------
très grand parking gratuit à côté pour camping car 
possible de payer avec billet de 10 euros ou par pièces 
bonnes machines

name: wild garlic paradise (bärlauch paradise)
description: at the end of a street behind a industrial area you find a small dirt road through a Forrest. we parked at the side of the road. very quiet bird's singing in the morning and in spring there are of eatable wild hermbs like wild garlic.

name: Goethe trailhead parking
description: Free decent sized lot with no services.  Near start of trail up into the city.  Most of the lots in the city charge outrageous prices IF you can get to them. No services, lots of trees for shade, some park benches, and a great view over the coast.  The trail is a steepish one but doable.  4G cell reception.

name: Ragusa parking
description: Free small parking about one kilometer from the centre of the old town.  No services. No signs prohibiting overnight.  4G cell reception.  Several other campervans were here with us.  Busy with traffic during the day but fairly quiet at night.  A couple of electric car charging spots too.

name: Decathlon parking lot
description: Large parking lot where there's a Decathlon store and Euro Spin grocery store.  No signs prohibiting overnight parking.  Very good 4G signal and if you park close to the Decathlon, you can reach its free wifi.  While the store is open there are bathrooms too.  Not scenic but good for a night near Syracuse which did not have many quiet options.

name: wasserstelle
description:
Waterspigot at the playground, drinking water. Good for cyclists
---------
Wasserstelle am Spielplatz, trinkkwasser. Gut für Fahrradfahrer

name: Sosta Camper Holiday
description:
It’s a Camper Restarea, but you will also be welcome if you arrive with a tent.
They have Wi-Fi, hot showers, drinking water, possibility to empty the toilette. Washing machine and dryer (washing machine is 3 euro, not sure about the dryer) 
The area is grassy, with a couple of tries, which are still growing. Thanks to the small river in the back, even the hot nights are a bit colder than elsewhere.
The owner and his family are super friendly and just started this CP, they are open for critics and thankful for it! 
All in all best place over here, near to nature, 400 mt to the ocean, in town there are pizzeria and bars even open now in low season. 
There is also a green area for child’s to play,  and they are planning some upgrades like ping pong etc. Lovely! And clean!!!
We paid 15 euros without electricity the first of April.

name: Comacchio free, big parking spot
description: Free, big parking area along the main road at the entrance of the town, facing one of the dam's canals. During the day is crowded by cars, buses and people and it's very noisy. Quieter by night. 300 meters to the center.

name: Camping dei Trulli
description:
Set in a green rural area of 3 hectares, this casual seasonal resort is 3 km from Alberobello Train Station and 4 km from the Trulli di Alberobello, traditional limestone buildings with conical roofs.

The simple 2 to 5 bedroom apartments, some with a TV, sofa and/or fireplace, are equipped with a kitchenette. The superior accommodations are located in the characteristic trulli. The simple permanent rooms have shared bathroom facilities.

The property includes a restaurant and café, outdoor pool, children's pool with waterslide and games room with foosball and table tennis. It also offers bicycle rental, camping area and parking. Pets are welcome.
.....
Immerso in un'area rurale verdeggiante di 3 ettari, questo informale resort stagionale dista 3 km dalla stazione ferroviaria di Alberobello e 4 km dai Trulli di Alberobello, edifici tradizionali in pietra calcarea con i tetti conici.
Gli appartamenti semplici da 2 a 5 camere da letto, alcune con TV, divano e/o caminetto, sono dotati di angolo cottura. Le sistemazioni di categoria superiore sono situate nei caratteristici trulli. Le semplici tende permanenti hanno il bagno in comune.

La struttura comprende un ristorante e un caffè, piscina scoperta, piscina per bambini con acquascivolo e sala giochi con biliardino e ping-pong. Offre inoltre noleggio biciclette, area campeggio e parcheggio. Si accettano animali domestici.

name: Star Wash Lavanderia
description: Self serve laundry with 4 washers (8 & 14kg two of each) and 4 dryers.  5 eu to 8 eu to wash.  2eu for 15 minutes drying.  To pay you use  the Laundry Point Machine with cash or card.  There is a small sign in English by both the washers and dryers.  Supposed to be free wifi but we couldn't find the password.  There are USB ports in a table across from the washers. Open from 8:30 am to 10pm.

name: Spadafora free beach parking
description: Beach parking at the end of a road at the far end of the beach.  Nice concrete boardwalk beside the beach.  No services except a cold beach shower nearby and a 4G signal.  Probably busy in high season, but we were alone here in early April other than a few people in the evening dropping by.  Can be windy.

name: near the sea
description: qyiet place, nobody disturbed us all the night

name: beach parking
description: This is along the edge of the seaside road specifically marked parking for campers.  Very little traffic after dark. Great views and. 4G+ signal but nothing else at least this time of year.  wonderful too fall asleep to the waves.  View of Stromboli too!

name: small parking lot next to decathlon
description: Medium sized parking area near the larger Decathlon parking lot.  There is a little bar/drink shop as well as a playground and a porta potty.  4G+ signal or you can walk over to the Decathlon to use their free wifi and bathrooms.  There are shops and restaurants about two blocks away.  A bit of traffic noise from nearby highway but nothing intolerable.

name: Rest area by a soccer auditorium
description: Four camper spots on brick pads - FREE! Power, water and grey dumping.  Pizza bar/restaurant on site.  No toilets or showers.  4G+ signal.

name: next to etsch and playground
description: Narrow road to get there not for big rigs but possible with a van.

name: Florence hill
description: Nice and quite place for 1 car. Amazing view of Florence and the surrounding hills.

name: Toscanay mountains
description: Next to a lot hiking trails. Fresh water available. Quiet and spacious. Deers running around.

name: small quiet forrest
description: the place is between some trees, u can reach this spot by bike,or motorcycle. the trees protect from the wind and from curious eyes. use by night

name: SS 1, 8, 16038 Santa Margherita Ligure GE, Italie
description: On a parking lot (free) with a beautiful view over the sea and the port of rapallo. Itvs next to to the road so there is some cars but not much.

name: next to Monza
description: On a parking lot with a nice view, on the afternoon it's a bit crowded but in general a quiet place in a small village. There is some picnic tables, we cooked there it's safe.

name: Chiesetta Santa Maria Assunta
description: There is fresh water, a fire place and some benches. Nothing more. There can be other people, though.

name: Pic-Nic Area
description:
Wide area with water, wastebin, benches, tables and fireplaces. It is direct next to the street although you can put up your tent further back. There can be other people though. 
There is another places like this up (!) the road around 1,5 km behind the next village.

name: Car Park
description: Large car park with water, drainage and electricity, €15 or €20 (with electricity) per 24 hours, otherwise €3/hour.  Bus line to the center nearby, shops within walking distance.  Environment so-so, safe space, even for slightly larger companions.

name: Bozzolo, quiet place in the woods
description: Quiet place in the woods for one night. We were 4 guys with 3 motorcycles (alzo naked) and you can reach the spot by bike

name: Rivalta sul Mincio
description: Great place to set off on a canoe trip on the Mincio. Off season very quiet. Water tap with gardena coupling.

name: Castelnuovo
description:
Area di Sosta Park Rocca

Gravel parking holds approx. 4 RV

Totally quiet at night

name: Marano Lagunare
description: Parking lot between cemetery and bar. Only 30m to sandy shore. Perfect for kajak launch. Totally quiet at night.

name: Canicattini Bagni
description: large almost level parking lot with water faucet - quiet at night

name: Agriturismo la Montina with free basic camping
description:
Really great country side restaurant with excellent food, amazing. And nice for kids: they have goats, pigs and many more animals. And shop with farmers goods to buy, eggs, aceto, jam etc. 

Behind building is a flat grassy area with a water well, kind of sandy ground water, nothing for a tank and not drinkable. Ok to put in a shower system. Place NOT suitable for big riggs larger than 8m / 4,5 tons (small bridge to enter… backside portal too narrow where is no bridge…). Camping here is free.

Owners are super nice and interestes in travellers. One van use toilet in restaurant. No shower no electricity. 

Niiiice sunset pano, spacy place once you are in…. 

Food: try the starters miced plates for 15,- - GREAT! Main course beef filet was also AMAZING, same with TIRAMISU, tasted super delicious!!!!

Place has great atmosphere!!

name: Lettojanni
description: Parking along beach road - quiet - nice view

name: Piedimonte Etneo
description: water dispensing machine - 5c per 1.5 Liter - use any coin from 5c up

name: Piedimonte Etnea
description: quiet large parking next to piazza - vegetables and wine within 150m - water dispenser at 5c per 1.5 L at the end of the piazza

name: Tindari
description: potable water faucet with threaded outlet

name: Area Camper Schiranna
description: It‘s a camper parking space for free. The facilities are not working at the moment. But it‘s alright for one night. The lake is nearby.

name: Gas Station/Scarico Camper
description: Free of charge dump station on A22 (heading south), plus toilet and gas station.

name: Great view Camping at Pedrosa
description: Lonly wild camp site for intermediate camping vans

name: looking Cagliari
description:
Great spot for a night along the old TET.
Road with many rocks, minimal offroad experience required and preferably a 4x4
-----------
Ottimo spot per una notte lungo la vecchia TET.
Strada con molte rocce, richiesta una minima esperienza di offroad e preferibilmente un 4x4

name: Porto Pirastu
description:
ONLY FOR MOTORCYCLE!
In front of the sea, place for three tents maximum. Accessible via a small road with some rocks. No service, good phone coverage

name: dirt track by ballore
description:
alternative more private for normal sized 4x4 just outside the ballore thermal waters.

stayed 2 nights no one bothered us no-one cared. there is a camp fire there already set up.

just up the dirt track across the road from the pools.

narrow, and can get boggy at the bottom, so standard 4x4 only would be wise. only room for one car.

name: La Lappola
description:
Farm-campsite (agritourismo) with limited number of guests (max 7 campers/4x4).
Very friendly and helpful owner (3 generations live on the farm). Good and clean facilities. Possibility to make use of a common living room and a kitchen for guests only (very welcome on rainy or cold, windy evenings). swimming pool in season. No restaurant.

name: nature campsite
description:
Nice spot aside from the dirt track
quiet with beautiful view

name: Hidden Gravel parking
description: Little gravel parking far from the road. You need to take a easy dirt road for a couple of minutes

name: Parco Dei Cavalli
description: PARCO DEI CAVALLI: it is a private park where you can stop and relax in the middle of nature.  Very quiet, place for meditation and yoga. Dark sky full of stars and good vibes. Shower and toilet not always available. Laundry, barbecue and bicycles are available upon request. Pets are allowed. ATTENTION: horses, cats and chickens roam freely inside the park. GIANMARCO whatsapp or email

name: farm house alla strozza
description: super clean 100%, on may 5 i only pay 55 euro for 1 room and breakfast , motorcycle park ibfront of our room ...the host is family run and good cheff and restaurant ..good for relax ..strongggg wifi

name: WOW
description:
That's a WOW spot!
Small road, last 500m on dusty but easy road.
Some places where park your vehicle or put your tent.
Free camping is not legal in Italy but it's tolerated.
No service, no neighboring village, bad internet coverage.
REAL WILD SPOT!

name: river side
description:
clearing next to the master embankment of the po
---
spiazzo accanto all'argine maestro del po

name: Sassari
description: Parking permitted 0 - 24 h other capers there no fresh water direkt on the beach

name: Parcheggio a pagamento
description: It is marked as a paid parking lot for camping cars, but there is no parking fee. It is close to Lake Misurina. We pitched a root top tent and spent one night. No disturbances and it was quiet.

name: Sarda Camper
description:
Beautiful and Clean Parking Area for Campers and Vans. It offers different services as electricity, water, waste water drainage. It is not very far from the city of Cagliari and marine landscapes.

Please visit our website at www.takeyourvan.com

name: Agriturismo Antico Mulino Caravans Campers & Tents
description:
Authentic agriturismo, with a place for tent. There are facilities to refresh yourself, fresh hot water, toilets, please for fire.
Roomy space for tents and there also bungalows. The owners very friendly Italian family. Home cooking and many many more interesting stuff to be found at this place. Suitable for tents , but not for campers or caravans.

name: motorcycle tent place
description: Nice flat spot beside the track,just a few meters on a gras ramp.. Beautiful view. No cell service. Nothing

name: Tower power
description:
Amazing place ONLY FOR 4X4 & MAXI ENDURO!
Possible with expedition trucks but there will be difficulty in maneuvering.

Dusty, sand and very difficult road with 40/50cm potholes. I ride a KTM 1290 Super Adventure.

We slept inside the tower but getting in is difficult.
There's no door, there is only one window and you have to climb up but.. WOW!

No service and very bad telephone coverage

name: Beach spot!
description:
Small road in the middle of the vegetation on a sandy bottom. NO camper and expedition truck. YES car, van and motorcycle. 4x4 not required.

Very quite place in front of the sea.
We slept in two tents for one night.
No service, perfect telephone coverage.

name: Il Sacrario Militare di Oslavia
description: Drinkable tap water by the war memorial monument.

name: Azienda Il Calanco
description: Agriturismo where you can also stay with your camper or tent over night. We stayed here with our tent (+ bicycles) and they offered us to pitch it under a roof due to bad weather (might be only possible in low season when they don’t rent out all rooms? - not sure!). Hot shower and toilet. We paid 20€. Very friendly owners. Lots of farm animals around.

name: Punta gro
description: Wonderful place by the lake, quiet and safe. Cannot be accessed by motorized vehicles. There is a bar nearby (Punta Gro beach bar) with internet access, free toilets and showers. Free camping in this area is not legal, so pitch your tent after sunset and take it off early in the morning. Enjoy a swim in the lake!

name: Lago del Pescatore
description: ~40min max trail from the rifugio fontana bianca (we did it in 30min). Spot by the lago del pescatore. You can fish here if you want. There are two tables with benches. We put the tent right next to them. Chill place, no problems. A bit cold at night (middle of August), but nothing that an extra layer couldn't solve. Great view, specially in the morning with the sunrise. We put the tent around 8pm and took it out around 7am. There were also other spots around to place a tent. It's a chill area, not many people even though it's summer. There's also a huge flat grass area a bit further down longing the lake. There's a potable water fountain by the restaurant/rifugio fontana bianca.

name: Il Frutto Della Passione
description:
This car park is located 1.5 kilometers from the village of Ballata di Erice (400 inhabitants, 260 meters above sea level) on a hill among olive trees, fruit trees, vines and a stream.
It is the parking lot of a camper-friendly restaurant. The restaurant is open only in the spring-summer period, and in the other periods of the year it only carries out a take-away service with at least 1 day's notice.
Usually they do not accept campers in the period from July 15th to September 15th.
Maximum vehicle width 2.50 meters!!
Free parking, Free broadband Wi-Fi internet connection, Free separate waste collection, full of Free drinking water, Free electrical outlet connection.
10% discount on food and drinks consumed.
For contacts via whatsapp +390923575012

name: cascata del  sasso
description:
Beautiful grass pitch with about ten places planted with trees and a water point
----------------
Bel emplacement en herbes d'une dizaine de places arboré avec un point eau

name: church parkinglot
description:
location behind the church on a large car park with electricity in a quiet area
-----------------
emplacement derrière l'église sur un grand parking en terre avec électricité au calme

name: Collicello
description: This little area was enough to pitch my tent and get through the night on my bike packing adventure.

name: Santuario di San Bernardo di Andagna
description: behind the church there is a meadow where it is possible to pitch a tent, it is very close to a picnic area where there is place to park

name: Agriturismo Valverde
description: Agriturismo that offers camping for campers. it has a decent playground for kids. offseason we paid 15 euro per night for 2 adults and 2 kids. unsure what electricity costs.

name: Rochetta E Croce
description: Near the street is a isolated small area which is tent friendly. Quite night no cars. Early morning however but still a great place to stay for a night. Service is good from up there

name: Area Camper Verona “Porta Palio”
description: Overnight camping spot open 24/7. Has security cameras, big enough for towables, has dumps station. In a fairly nice spot, right next to the river

name: Anza River Woods
description:
🇬🇧 Quite place in the wood near the river Anza.
Not very big, just for one car/van/camper.
Gravel road to arrive.
________________________

🇮🇹 Posto tranquillo nel bosco vicino al fiume Anza.
Il post non è molto grande, ma lungo la strada ci sono altre aree naturali simili.
Strada sterrata per arrivare.

name: Anza River
description:
🇬🇧 Wild camp near the river Anza (Anzasca Valley, Monte Rosa).
Free horses, you can find a ring. Recommended only 4x4 and minivan.

🇮🇹 Campeggio libero a ridosso del fiume Anza (Valle Anzasca, Monte Rosa). Potreste trovare cavalli liberi, quindi una recinzione. Consigliato per mezzi 4x4 e minivan.

name: casa dell'acqua
description:
5c/L good drinking water ! 
2 distributors, you put the coin and it save the credits pouring 1L at a time.
The left one didn't work for us, it just ate our money but later I saw someone using it so it might work now...

name: Lucciole Nella Nebbia
description: Very nice and small campground with Restaurant and Pool (bring your bathing cap). You can also rent an apartment here.

name: Camporosso in Valcanale
description: A huge FREE car park with designated area for motor homes and camper vans. The entire area is on a slight slope, so you may want to use levelling ramps (we didn’t bother!). The ground is tarmac or compacted gravel (no mud if it rains). There are no services on site apart from rubbish bins. There is a drinking water tap in the village as well as all of the usual shops

name: Kiddies playground
description: Good drinking water tap at the kiddies playground

name: Gardaland
description: The best Italian adventure park. Quite expansive, especially food and drinks: better bring them by our own. Season pass available and good deal if you wanna come back on same summer

name: Agriturismo Poggio Caminata
description: Farmhouse Poggio Caminata.  From Piacenza, direction Podenzano then Carpaneto Piacentino.  In Celleri follow the Agroturismo Poggio Caminata for 2km.  Narrow but passable road.  Welcome to the orchard.  Meals, by reservation, at the hostel.

name: Miane
description: A free municipal parking site with sewage disposal and fresh water tap. Sloping, tarmac ground. Reasonably quiet overnight. Supermarket 3 minutes walk.

name: Follina
description: Nothing fancy. Just a big, gravel car park that has a drinking water tap and Spar shop. Motor homes and camper vans offer stay overnight here. No other facilities.

name: Camping Solico
description: Great Campground. Directly at the Lake Maggiore. Absolut clean facilities.

name: Follina laundry
description: Laundromat. Open 0700 - 2200. Parking for big rig’s opposite next to the cemetery.

name: Camping Cusio
description:
Nice large campground next to the small town of Orta. Toilets and shower are o.k.  There is a small swimming pool. Ideal to visit the town. The restaurant serves a limited selection.
Wi-Fi works only around the bar.

name: Forest clearing
description: A large clearing on the edge of the forest. Sometimes used to store logs prior to shipping out. Access is easy for all vehicles and the ground is flat and free-draining. Several picnic tables in the area. No services at all. Very quiet overnight.

name: Mobile home place
description: Only a mobile home parking with the idea to stay for the night. Next tho the lido with its restaurant. Very quiet. Free of charge.

name: San Giovani
description: Water tap by the road at bus stop, drinkable and very good water.

name: Mandala Camper Space
description:
Beautiful place in the middle of orange and lemon trees. Owners came in the morning with lemon and oranges and are very kind. If you like just a flat ground, it's perfect. Entry to the gorge of Alcantara is around 5km away.
Price 2023: 15 euro

name: San Floriano del Collio
description: Water tap by the road and 20 m away from the church. During the winter it May be closed, but all in all it is a very good location to refill.

name: Tall vehicle parking
description:
Behind the Grand Hotel, access from the promenade.
Most parking areas around are limited to 2,1 m in height. This one is not limited. 1€ per 2 hours.

Big rigs will fit, but marked spaces are for cars, maybe motorhomes only.

name: Dolegna del Collio
description: Water tap by the road and by the "municipio" building (municipality).

name: B&B il cammino
description:
B&B for overlander travelers.
Nice house in a very peaceful Place.
Situated 4kms to Casina and 15kms from the Rossena and Canossa castels 
Breakfast included.
30€ a person

For reservation call +39 3392475734 or 
+39 0522607184

name: Park Petroli
description:
Free Parking with Bus transfer to Venezia Piazzale Roma - ticket with return is 3€ p.p. - 
No overnight parking possible.

name: Pit stop for cyclists
description: Water tap, info point and repair tools for cyclists by the road between Corno Di Rosazzo and Ruttars.

name: Parco Isonzo
description: Water tap at the entrance to the city parc "Parco Isonzo". Works all around the year.

name: Sorgente Fustiolau
description: Nice fresh water from the Fustiolau spring. Access via good gravel road.

name: Refugio Monte Stino
description: Nice place behind the house of Refuge. We asked authorisation to the owner of refuge before our installation. Very quiet place. Only for one night.

name: Piumoni Lavaggio e Asciugatura
description: Self Service Laundry in the centre of La Spezia - 8kg & 14kg machines and dryer for up to 16kg - open 8.30-23h

name: B&B Camping Pianella
description:
We are a small private B&B with camping places and a Glamping tent in the middle of our antique olive garden. Located near beach and mountain and a lot of must see's in the Abruzzo region. Our camping is close to Pescara, Chieti, Montesilvano and also Campo Imperatore. Ideal for families and friends to join the vacation together in an informal and private way in a natural and tranquil environment.

Rate per night: €25,-
Electricity: Gratis
Shower: Gratis 
Washingmachine: €4,-

name: Old waterpowered Sawhouse
description:
You can park your car and put up to 3 tents. You can hear the stream nearby.
Had a good night sleep, only 3 cars from locals passed by in the morning.

name: Colle de Colombardo
description: Nice place beside a church. Nice view to peaks and also to the valley. Some other people but very quiet.

name: Free Parking spot at Lago Smeraldo
description: It' a free parking along the street at the end of the lake (Lago Smeraldo). A lot of space, wood and river aside. Super quiet (except of Sundays - very crowded by day). Crickets singing and river running. No facilities for camping. There's a beautiful Pizzeria right in front of the lake. The lake isn't so interesting, but there are wonderful and easy walks in its surroundings.

name: River bed
description:
A nice and very quiet place in the middle of the river bed. There was no water anymore (end of June). 
No 4x4 required as long as you stay on one of the obviously frequently used path at the edge. In case you like to go deep into the river bed I would highly recommend 4x4.

name: Bosco Fossalta di Portogruaro
description: Wild camp available in the woods of Bosco Fossalta di Portogruaro. The trees shelters you form unwanted eyes. Set up your tent later and leave early(ish). I arrived at 22 and left at 7:00. I was with a bike and tent. No cars allowed here.

name: Hill top with view on Lago Trasimeno
description:
Quiet flat place on a hill top with a great view on the surrounding area, including Lago Trasimeno. Easily reachable by 4x4 or motorcycle. There's enough flat ground next to the tree to pitch a tent as well.
You can drive further down the path to be even more secluded, but it's quite overgrown there.

name: Capocchia du Purpu
description: Beautiful meadow in front of the sea with a view of the archipelago.

name: Piazza San Marco fountain
description: Public fountain, just a tap. No hose adaptor.

name: Monte St. Antonio rest area
description: Picnic area near the road, a lot of trees and quiet place. There's a pipe but no water.

name: camping "le Fontanelle"
description:
cool camping in the Woods of Rovegno (GE),Little bar and a restaurant Just outside the camping,Town at 10/15 Min by feet on a trail across the forest.
open from last week of April to October.
dogs welcomed

name: La Braceria
description: Great local grill restaurant. Not recommended for vegetarians. No menu, just eat what they serve. And what they serve is outstanding. The restaurant is in a insignificant village but was fully booked by locals. We paid €30,- per person for a three course meal including 2 bottles of wine.

name: Poggio delle Aquile
description: Nice, wide and quiet spot on the road to Poggio delle Aquile.

name: Grado by the sea
description: Water tap in the city marina in the center of the town Grado.

name: Big bench n. 200
description: The big bench 200 have the best view of the Vulcan etna

name: Pietra di Bismantova
description: 3 parking for campers, 5 €/day. Toilette in the very nearby and little fountain with good water. Also 2 bars and restaurants. In summer and weekends very crowded

name: Free big parking
description: Before arriving to Pietra di Bismantova, there's a free long parking along the street. Except of summer and weekend, it's very peaceful and silent, in the middle of the wood. At the end of the street, 500 mts forward, there's a bar restaurant, toilet, a small free fountain with good water.

name: Sicily near Etna
description: This is a good place with concrete platform for all size of car/motor home , quite place.

name: L'Urteia
description: Beautiful farmhouse in the countryside with campsite and shop selling organic and typical products

name: Camping La Grotta
description:
Wonderful starting point for the experience around Mount Etna. By bike in 1 hour uphill to the starting point of the cable car. Ideal for those who want to camp close to nature. Nature, pure volcano! A dream of a campsite, almost like wild camping: An impressive lava flow from 1983 "flows around" the site, silence and solitude, pure nature. Rudimentary facility, no usual camper service - ONLY toilet & shower, no W-LAN.
Electricity for mobile and Laptops

name: Parking lot Nature Reserve
description: This is a parking lot within walking distance to the natures reserve and beach.  Very quiet and no artificial lighting.  The ground is flat and clear.  There is payment up until the park closes.  It is great for overnight but not long term.

name: Nice view
description: Open parking spot on side of mountain with beautiful view of surrounding mountains and countryside.  Quiet, no lights, no Wi-Fi towers.  It is on the side of the road, but there is no traffic at night.

name: Huge wildcampsite
description:
Just next to the old pass route there are 3 abonded houses (probably from workerst whilst building the tunnel). The entry is a steep gravel road for a few meters. 4x4 or a brave driver is recomended. The houses topmost house is relatively clean inside and provides perfect shelter if needed for loats of people. 
Behinde this house is a big leveled gras patch, suitable for about 8 vans. There's a track further up the mountain where u'll finde two more flat areas the same size. They are quite well protected. We stayed ond the middle plateau and hardly noticed the road. 

There is some wood around for a bonefire. 

We challanged us on the track leading uphill with our motorcycles as well.

name: Small parking on the side of the road
description: Informal site with a beautiful view on the mountains. I parked my motorcycle a little bit out of view and set up tent in a lower part which could not be seen from the road.

name: La Montanina
description: Beautiful little winery with place for 5 small - mid sized camper. Comes with a pool, washer, dryer, shower, water..

name: Parco Monte Taburno Camposauro Free  Camp
