description: Pleasant meadow in the park surrounded by busch and trees for some shade. Direct access from the road. Easy access for all rigs and tent friendly. The road windes pretty much arond the spot, but evening/night no traffic at all. Y're almost invisible for the passing traffic. Sun is available till late afternoon. No no signs. Restaurant Bar Al Refugio on the other side of the road was closed. Nights can be a bit cool because y're 1 kilometer high. Your mobile has a little G. We enjoyed a quiet night.

name: Shelter @ abonded refugio
description: The entrance of the "refugio domingo fornara" is covered and provides shelter for 2-4 persons to camp. I rather sleep here on a rainy night. On nice weather probably not the most beautiful spot.

name: Piccionaia di Matilde di Canossa
description: very strange pigeot House built in the middle Age

name: Fisherman Parking lot in the lake
description: Little fisherman Parking in front of the Lake in the center of the small Alfero Village. Nice spot with playground, nice restaurante and pizzeria and grill Pic nic area

name: Natural pool with bar and restaurant
description: Natural pool in the Little River, Sunny and Shadow places for a rest during the hot season. Close there Is a parking lot with a park, bar and restaurant

name: Castel di Tusa beach
description: Very quiet place on the beach. No noise. Open view. Flat ground.   Clean and gentle water, 2 minute walk from car!

name: Wild Sellustra Countryside Garden Camping
description:
Countryside garden camping in the middle of beautiful clay hills (Calanchi).
place for tents and RVs. Glamping tent and swimming pool available :)

Please write me at wildsellustra@gmail.com or through instagram before arriving to organise your arrival, thanks!

name: Roadside
description: It's right next to the main road and, even though you are next to it, you can see the lake; that said, it is very quiet at night, there aren't any structures nearby.

name: Potable Water here
description: fresh potable water next to a parking, and in the city

name: Near the River
description:
Low signal for smartphone, ok for 4x4 and for normal car if isn't low car.
Large place.  No problem there

name: free parking near Castel del Monte
description: Many free parking spots, 10 minuts walking to Castel del Monte, under the trees. Super quiet to sleep.

name: Camping Tahiti
description: Established campsite not far from the sea. It is pretty crowded and there is no space for large caravans. But if you are a hiker or a biker there might be something free on the hill side. It is clean enough and there is also a restaurant where you can get breakfast and also tasty pizzas. I might come again here.

name: Sud est Raid
description: Small Motorcycle hotel from a pro driver, including motorbikes for Rent and trainings.

name: Sotto Ara Pacis
description: On the way to Ara Pacis there is a bike pit stop with water tap. You can get water also across the street in the graveyard.

name: Agricamper - small camper area
description:
Small camping for campers and tents. All facilities, simple and beautiful location in the nature.
Cheap prices, owner veeery gentle.

name: Big parking area
description: Free, big parking area with spectacular view. Extremely quiet in summer. Place for small tents in the fields nearby (isolated and super peaceful).

name: Camp Lago
description: Camping on the shore of Lago Maggiore. It is not far from the border with Switzerland but the prices are still italian. It is clean and seems quiet. The view is great.

name: Ipplis Christian Monument
description: Water tap by the Christian Monument, tall white tower with mosaic.

name: Overlooking the waves
description: Large parking right at sea. Next to a restaurant, open in May. There were 4 campers on the lot so it seems tolerated to park for the night.

name: Field with water
description: We checked the other places in the app but we were not satisfied, so we found this spot which is out of cultivated fields, under a tree and next to a little spring with some running water (not enough to fill a tank). We didn't see anybody around.

name: Great View Lago Legro (no vehicles)
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User states (in an e-mail) that there is no "camping prohibited" sign, but vehicles cannot park at this location.

Great spot for tent near the road with water. There is a sign to not park the car by the 100 m down near by house is parking place for car.

name: Camping Il glomere
description: Very nice camping in the wood, quite and relaxing. Elecricity available (standard 230V). WiFi. Cafe. Market. Bathrooms with hot showers.

name: bike fever
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: description unclear. Contacted user.

It's a bike shop and rental and also offers luggage storage.

name: Lake Garda view!
description: A nice, little, quiet spot on a grassy dirt road, with a great view to Lake Garda! It's close to a hiking trail but we didn't see anybody in the evening. It's fine for everything else except a big campervan.

name: spiaggia Manfredonia sud
description: good place for camping but some people is driving around meeting others for unknown reason

name: Silence and pink flamingos
description:
Mid-size grass parking with a beautiful view to hundreds of pink flamingos. 
High season, middle of a week, nobody except us. Perfect place. Check google maps for pictures. 

No water, no toilets. A lot of mosquitoes (: 

There isn’t any signs about if camping is permitted or not. Nobody bothered us.

name: Alternative for "Quiet place next to SS1"
description: Because the "Quiet Place next to SS1" was closed with a bolted chain + lock, we looked further. So 500 meters back there is a small and very little road going down, 100 meters down that road there is a small flat area on the left side. Good for an overnight stay. No traffic when we were there. The water source is nearby, so enjoy!

name: Peschiere del Garda
description: The side is on a property by a wine farm. you can stay here free. In the wine field. Aldo the have a farm restaurant where you can have your meal. if not also ok. No water and electric but if you ask the help you. Great place to spend a night. The are also a lot of animals on the that's nice.

name: casina bert pro natura parking
description:
we spent the night in this parking lot surrounded by small trees . very calm and peaceful night.  no other cars. In the morning, a few hikers passing through. garbage cans available 
thank you for leaving the place clean.
---
nous avons passé la nuit sur ce parking entouré de petits arbres . nuit très calme et paisible
 aucune autre voiture
Le matin quelques randonneurs de passage
poubelles disponible 
merci de laisser le lieu propre

name: Riverbed near Carbona
description:
You can drive into the riverbed. Just watch on Google Maps with satellite. No 4x4 needed as long you don’t drive trough water. The ways to the river are bumpy. Would not recommend Caravans. 
There are a few people here, people go here to refresh during the day but also a lot of campers. But you can search for a (almost) lonely place. 
Enjoy, take your trash with you.

name: Gradisca city park
description: Water tap in the center of the town and inside the city park.

name: parking next to bologne
description:
little parking.  clean with lights and a little public garden next to it. 
we arrived late and found few others camping cars or vans .
the place is not too noisy.  we can hear the road far away.

name: Radicondoli
description: Nice and green, flat camper place. Very quiet at night. Nice restaurant in the village at about 300 meter.

name: free campervan spot and possible tent campspot
description: there's a free area for campervans etc. I asked the owner of the little Kiosk, before the turnoff for the camp, if tents can camp there, he said he thinks it's ok, but it was all full (high season) and he kindly allowed me to camp on the lawn around his kiosk. there's a toilet and he even let me shower🥰

name: Camping Colle Ciglio
description: Wonderful place. Located in the Abruzzo National Park, on the shores of Lake Barrea. You can travel by camper and have a pitch with a view of the mountains. I travel by motorbike and I left the motorbike a few meters from the bivouac. There is no electricity or drinking water by the lake. And this is the beauty. Fair price for a bivouac. Hot drinking water and shower. Possibility to choose your own place to sleep. True wild experience

name: Residence Salento
description: Beautiful location 15 minutes from Otranto!  also offers motorcycle garages.  all services.  alone plus bike the price is €38.  I recommend to anyone who wants to relax

name: Agricampeggio La Pineta
description: Campsite with access to the beach. Excellent services with hot shower and toilet. Power for RVs. Great welcome. A perfect place for my tent and my bike! 17€ a person, a motorcycle.

name: Amici della Natura area sosta
description:
Area sosta/Camp ground in the Shadow behind pines. In dove minutes walking From the Camp ground you find a wild Sand beach.
The owner Is nice and gentle.
Places with electricity (25€/ night) and places with no electricity

name: little vineyard and ruin
description:
Nice and quiet place close to a vineyard and an old church into thé hills.  
please leave the place clean

name: station meteo
description:
very big area after 1km into the forest
we arrive during the night. the road is OK to come even with small car if you be careful.
the place is in the middle of nowhere.  quiet. we saw 5 or 6 other campers in the place 
keep the place clean

name: Spina Verde
description: this is the parking spot of the park, commonly used by RV/vans/rigs to camp. there is an upper parking that is more exposed, and a lower level accessible for smaller rigs that is an open grass field partly shaded. Quiet and fresh. on a august wed night I was the only one on the lower level, while 4 vans were above.

name: Flat grass area close to the main road
description: Easy access from the main road (doable in 2WD). Its a big flat grass area only connected to a small hiking trail. No noise from the main road and good 4G signal. No one disturbed me during the night or in the morning. No "No camping" sign around

name: Riverbed near Peonis
description:
There are multiple spots in and near the riverbed. To come here, drive as near as possible next to the river and take the bumpy road with stones. Manageable with 2x4. Big rigs possible. There is a sign that forbid cars at this place. Seen a few cars though and some locals too. Didn’t had any problems. 

! Be careful, the river can rise extremely fast, so be sure it doesn’t cut your way out !
(The Internet says it can rise from 30m to 1km in 24hrs.)

Take your trash.

name: Camping Gran Paradiso
description:
Large campground between the mountains. Has toilets, showers, running water, electricity (ask for three-phase to EU plug adapter if you need one). Has a bar and restaurant. Reception was open at 6pm when i arrived (august).
I paid 19 euros for a tent, a motorcycle, electricity and an adapter. Showers are 1 euro. You can pay by card. If reception is closed, go to the bar for help. Wifi password is listed on the bar wall. There is a river and a small waterfall nearby, although i do not think you should swim in the river. There are chalets too. Not sure about rig facilities.
The scenery is awesome and the road to here as well.
Nearest ATM is 4km
There are no cigarettes on site
Prices:
One child 4.5 eur
One adult 6 eur
Tent 6.5 eur
Camper van 7.5 eur
Car 3 eur
Dog 2 eur
Electricity 3 eur
Motorcycle 3 eur
Big rig 8 eur
Shower 1 eur

name: Casino di Terra Bushcamp near the river
description:
Little parking area in the middle of the fields.
During the night you can hear boars in the woods.
Ideal for a bivouac of one night.

name: Wild Abruzzo by Sir Def 110
description: Wide space on a hill with beautiful view.

name: Sovazza area pic nic
description: Place to camping motohome. Can barbecue there is water

name: Brussa official free camping - Mazarack
description: Officially camp for free on a large meadow. Many campers are here, it is illuminated at night and not far to drive to the beach. Parking directly on the beach costs € 5.

name: Cantiere forestal
description: Drinking water in a fontaine along the road

name: Camping Orsa Minore
description: Quite big camp in the middle of the woods with a beautiful view with Majella Park

name: Camping Serenissima
description:
Nice and cheap campsite, for the high season.
3 € for the bus to Venice and back. Tickets available at the campsite.

name: Falesia Castelletta
description: quiet spot at the crag trailhead. water fountain and grill setup. picnic table and benches. wonderful view over Castelletta, great rock climbing at a stone throw.

name: Val d’Arzino
description:
Campsite not organized but next to camper site with electric and water
Place is very next to a beautiful river
Quite and secure

name: Nebida next to Porto Flavia
description:
under the pines and the eulyptus trees
for 2 to 3 vehicles
for 4x4 only


sous les pins et les euxalyptus 
pour 2 à 3 véhicules
pour 4x4 uniquement

name: Old mine between Buggeru and Masua
description: Big area for 10 cars directly on the stones

name: In the middle of nowhere costa verde
description: After a long stone road a place in wild nature

name: Many spots at a lake
description: Many sites for van and tent in the forest on the side of a fishing lake (you can swim). There is a restaurant, but closed when we were there

name: Colognati creek
description: during the summer river bed is dry and you can find flat spots on sand between stones and some bushes. Peaceful place, just a wildboar at midnight, I clapped hands and it ran away.

name: spiaggia santa Focà
description: Quiet beach, in August just few peaceful people like fishermen. Sea is clear. Some mosquitoes and condense, so bring tent.

name: spiaggia foce corace lato sud
description: peaceful beach, close to the woods, some wildboars around. Many fishermen all the time, some sleeping here with me. Sea is clear and deep.

name: Grotte di Frasassi - free
description: Large pitch for campers close to the normal Grotte car park.  Free with toilet, water (not drinkable) and a supermarket within walking distance.

name: Parcheggio Bekaert
description:
Large parking lot near a gas station, where mobile homes are always parked in the last row.
Sometimes a foot truck is open on the square.

name: Area Sosta Camper via Fersina
description: Parking area for motorhomes only. 36 hard standing pitches with electric hook up. Near the Trento Sud exit of the A22 motorway.  €.21.20 per night. CDP, grey water and fresh water. It is also possible to use the service only for motorhomes. Completely fenced and with day caretaker.

name: Agriturismo Sa Perda Marcada
description:
Agriturismo with typical sardinian dinner (35 Euros) and breakfast offered (5 Euros). Very delicious!
Camping (5 E), wide open space.

name: Small plot near main road
description:
take the road down to get to the parking lot; you'll see a small open space on the first curve. It's next to the main road but it below its level, so you are not very visible from it.
No sign of any sort, I camped here while all the businesses where close.

name: The Hill Agricamping
description: Very good camping, well organized and maintained with all the facilities, including clean bathrooms with hot showers, disposal area for RVs, all in a privileged area in the middle of the mountains near Ancona. If you come from Greece or Croatia, this is a place to relax after a long journey. ideal for bikepackers, overlanders and families looking for a weekend in the countryside. Highly recommended.

name: Monte Tre Croci - Free Camp
description:
The campsite is located on the top of a hill, right next to the Monte Tre Croci monument. The site is small, suitable for a few cars and small tents (there's room for vans up next to the monument). Enjoy great views of the surrounding towns, a small fireplace and a table up near the monument, there are no other facilities.

Access is mostly bitumen until the last kilometer where it turns to a dirt track. The dirt section is suitable for 2WD cars in vans in dry weather.

name: tent spot at lake
description:
space for a couple of small and middle sized  tents on grassy/rocky terrain.
According to some locals people sleep here regularly. no services at the place, only rubbish bin. 
no space for caravans and motor bikes will need to stay up on the street. bicycles can be carried via some steps down to the beach.
houses around, it is not a hidden spot.

name: countryside fields
description: spot along a dirtroad circling all around Mt. Aragno (the full tour takes 45mins circa). the road starts from aragno right after an elbow turn to the east side. check satellite views! the road is passable in 2wd. there are many spots after this one too where the road fades into open grass fields. you might wake up to cows pasturing around you.

name: Wild Campsite
description:
Small area on a little road that leads to a cemetery. Enough room for a tent and car / camper.
Close to town, can see a house so be quiet and considerate.
Stayed overnight and didn't see a single person or ghost so can confirm not haunted.

name: camping in the fields
description: we camped in a field to the left after a house. there are a few other camping spots earlier after the campground. do not park in plain sight as you might be called to stay at the campsite. and please please please pack it out and leave no trace. leaving your dirty tissues on the ground is disgusting.

name: ticino riverside near Pavia
description: fond a nice place with only pedestrians and cyclist. we set our tent very close to the restaurant but it is possible to go further away. the toilets of the restaurant are outside and open the night.

name: po river side
description: Nice place next to a motocross track. No one around and very quiet except for the numerous small animals around... stayed only for the night. very close to the ciclovia

name: Next to Adige river
description: Next to the cycleway (but hidden from it) there is a designed grill spot that is next to the river. No prohibited signs, probably best to pitch tent when darker

name: Next to cycling path
description: Beautiful hidden grassland next to the cycling path and next to the highway, it can be a bit loud but it really didn't disturb me. The area is big and very flat, plus people don't really pass here

name: Near cycle path
description: Beautiful little spot 3 minutes from cycle path. Normally for campers but I came here with my bicycle and my tent.

name: Next to centa river
description: Perfect place to pitch a tent, there is a car park, tables everywhere, campfires everywhere, and you can stay everywhere along the river, it's massive, a lot of people from the area also stay here or around here for the night

name: On path behind chapel
description: Nice quiet place on a path behind the chapel, it's a path, so there is people walking, better to set the tent by nightfall, next to the chapel there is also a parking spot for the van

name: Baits al Taj
description: Beautiful and small little restaurant in the middle of the mountains. At least outside the main season they let us camp just opposite the restaurant. Great food! All homemade!

name: Next to cycling path
description: Just next to the cycling path there is a small area with a table that is a little bit lower than the path, so that people don't really see you that much. There is actually quite a few places like this along the path

name: Next to cycling path - tents only
description: Nice place with a small table next to the cycling path, but hidden from it.There is also a path that leads lower around what was once a small lake (I think it dries up in summer) where there is a bigger area.

name: Marrubiu (OR) Piazza San Giuseppe
description: Potable water Point useful for portable tanks not for campers

name: Grill picnic area next to cycling path
description: Nice green grill area with a few tables, a grill fireplace with wood already stacked next to it and a fountain. I've camped here one night and nobody bothered me, it's next to the cycling path so in the evening there is basically nobody, plus the street is behind the river so you can only hear the stream.

name: beautiful campspot at river Misa
description:
Sweet little place for a car/camper/tent right next to the river Misa. We stayed here for one night, sleeping in our van. Very quiet, also during the day. Only a few people passed by walking their dogs, they were all very friendly.
We found some spikes of an animal, maybe a porcupine but didn't see any.

name: Agri Camper La Tranquillità di Chicchirinella
description: beautifull and quiet place to camp, next to pomegranate field, very uncomplicated owner, clean toilet and showers, mountain view, 1km next to the sea. A bit farm smell at night

name: Monte Carmelo
description: A parking spot next to a chapel on a mountain top. Awesome view at the sea and the mountains. Very quiet. Windy in the evening. Attention: Narrow turns at the end of the road!

name: lake beach camping
description: I'm not sleeping here tonight, but it looks like plenty of people are camped all around this lake. no facilities. maybe some fish.

name: pic nice area by the river
description: quiet piece of heaven only 7mins from the highway. dirtroad to get there. no big rigs. room for 3/4 campers/vans. Surprisingly no mosquitoes. quiet spot. no rubbish. unreal!

name: Campeggio San Bartolomeo
description: We searched the whole day for a wild camping spot at the slovanian/ italian coast. Found nothing and ended up at this camping place - 25€ incl. a car and two people - very nice staff, italian feeling, easy, nice pizza and a private entrance to the beach :) would recommend!

name: Valle Canatra
description: Green area with drinking trough for animals and barbecue grill. Dirt road. The cell phone does not take the line here. Keep the area clean.

name: Area Archeologica Valesio
description: Quiet place near a building of the archeological center.

name: Rustic picnic tables
description: Nice quite site just off the beach in the pines. About 6-8 old picnic tables. Some trash around. Nobody else here when I came. @lifeofshack

name: Ca' ed Paiarin
description: picnic area with fire ring, table, iconic decorations and a wonderful view over the appennino

name: Campground Fossa Lupara
description:
Nice and quiet campsite (although it's near the highway but you don't hear it !). Not so far from the beach either and from town. 
The flat area for tent doesn't have shade.

I paid 18€/night for 1 person, 1 tent, 1 bicycle in the intermediate season.

Wifi was of course available but I didn't use it so I can't tell about the speed

name: Tent bivouac in the woods
description:
Small wood to pitch your tent, not so far from the road - super quiet at night, very well hidden behind corn fields, relatively flat ground for small tents, accessible only by bicycle 

(leave this place as clean as it is, don't leave toilet paper behind)

name: Tap at parking
description: Slow tap in the parking lot. No hose attachment. One tap at each end of lot.

name: Etna Panorama
description: Absolutely beautiful site with amazing views of Etna. I think this is where they come to take all the photos for the post cards. Best campsite I have seen in all of Italy. ZERO trash, no people, super quiet, peaceful and beautiful. Need good 4x4 to get here.

name: Hidden spot
description:
Quiet hidden place we found on the road to Canzei. It is next to a very small asphalt road and very close to the main road. Also it is possible to use a meadow nearby. Only two people and two cars passed in the morning.
Probably only one big rig can fit here.

name: Beach
description: Good (not great) beach with mix of sand and rocks. Showers and water taps just up from the water.

name: Fountain in the park
description: Good pressure, no hose connections. Several throughout the park.

name: Diga Monte Pranu
description: An abandoned Picnic area, very quiet Place under the trees with a table and bbq spots, no water. We spent a night here.

name: Camping Navene
description: Stayed here for two nights with my motorcycle and tent. 21€\night without electricity. They have bigger places for campers. Toilets and showers are ok, but there is no toilet paper.

name: industry area next to hardware store
description: free parking with lots of trucks - but not so loud as expected

name: Parcheggio Cascata Urlante
description:
Parking lot the locals use to get to a nearby waterfall and hiking routes.

The sign at the parking lot says to pick up your garbage.

name: Camping Lama le Canne
description: Camping Lama le Canne is located SW of Vieste.  It’s a quaint campground among the pine and olive trees.  Camping is available for campers, tents and one can rent bungalows or tiny homes.  There is a restaurant on site as well as children’s playground, basketball and courts.  The owners were very friendly and accommodating.  There are electrical hook-ups and water available.  Hot showers and very clean facilities.  For one night, we paid € 30 for two adults and a 6 m camping van.  A nice hike to the beach.

name: Apeneste Camping
description:
Apeneste Camping has a fantastic location across from the beach and an easy walk into the Vieste historical center.  The campground was clean, well-managed with hot showers, water toilets and adequate sinks for washing dishes or clothes.  Most pitches or sites have electrical and potable water is available as a chemical toilet waste dump.

The address is: Lungomare E. Mattei 42 - Vieste, IT.  The telephone number is: 0884-706287.  Website address:  wwwapeneste.it - info@apeneste.it.

If you are looking for a great place for dinner with delicious pizza, we would recommend Ristorante Guarda Che Luna with a beautiful view of the Adriatic in the historical district.

name: Camp above the sea
description: Wild camping spot above the sea, at the side of the road to alghero. 200m off-road access, the descent a little bit steep for 2wd but not impossibile (i reccomended to walk and check before). We're 2 motorcycles and a tent.

name: Area picnic Acquafrida
description: An abbandoned (I think) pic-nic area. Very big area, lot of space, tables, bbq (there is a sign prohibiting bbq due the high fire danger!), there's two water points. Realy quiet and fresh.

name: Mountainside rivercamp
description:
Big grasarea next to a beautiful mountain river. Its easy to find a flat spot and its perfectly suitable for big rigs and you definitely dont need 4x4. 
From Meran it takes approx 50 min to get here. Almost no traffic during night time, however its quite visible from the road. No toilet or any other infrastructure. 50 meters away there is a small restaurant.

name: Gravel parking with "some" distance from the road.
description: Most parking places are just next to the road. This one has some distance.

name: Piscina comunale
description: Public pool with bathroom and 4 cold showers

name: Parking Rena Majore beach
description:
Parking of the beach (now free, I don't know in high season if you've to pay)
Lots of camper and Van in the area, 500m of super easy dirt road to access.
We've placed hammock on a  structure that we think It will be pull apart for the winter.
Great spot to see the sunset.

name: Car camp location
description: Nice, very large, flat gravel parking right at a sharp bend in a switch back. Even though it’s on the side of the road, the cars move so slow through the switchback that it’s a silent location. There were other boondockers there

name: Big parking front lake
description:
Big parking area front lake S. Croce. Free 19.00-9.00.
From 01/04 to 30/09 you pay 3€/hour, 18 €/day.
I went at the end of September and it was empty and super quiet!

name: New Camping
description: New Camping is located within walking distance to the beach.  It’s not far from AA 16.  A small campground with plenty of room for campers, tents and trailers.  Bungalows are also available.  Hot showers, flush water toilets and helpful, friendly management.  The Reception is open daily until 1600 hours (4:00 pm) and the number to call for reservations or after hours check-in is +3 93299-189500.

name: Merano
description: Parking lot next to road. Very noisy at night and early morning. Stayed one night because I had no other choice

name: Abandoned road with million Euro views
description: By very far the best campsite around. Must have good 4x4 with confident driving skills to get past the first bit. Enter from the top (bottom side is blocked by logs). Then just follow the old road down and around until you hit the pin. “Campsite” is just a bend in the road. Majestic 🤩.  We were here for 3 days and only saw 2 people come by.

name: Tourist Village Rapallo
description: A great find just north of Rapallo, but still within walking distance. The campground has exceptionally clean restroom and shower facilities with actual toilet seats and paper!  The campground has both casitas for rent as well as parking for campervans and trailers in spacious pitches with electrical hook-ups.  There is an amazing swimming pool and sun bathing deck, a pizzeria restaurant open from 7:00 - 9:00 pm, potable water, a dishwashing area, chemical toilet clean-out/wash, There are many permanent-looking casitas attached to trailers that could be for rent, as well.  The only negative is that it’s a bit noisy from Highway noise, but the occasional birdsong makes up for it.  Each pitch is separated by a small hedge and shade trees overhead.  A very comfortable campground with over 70 spaces to choose from.  Worth a visit.

name: Big place for parking along the road
description: Big and for free, along the main road that's crowded by day during the weekend, but super quiet by night and also quiet by day during the week.

name: In the mountains
description: If you come from the Coast there is a gravel road to the left and shortly after another one to the right. Both ways lead to suitable wild camping/ parking options. We choose the one to the right, went up only a few meters and found a flat space to the right to park our Defender. We had a quiet night. Let's keep the place clean :)

name: Aspen grove
description:
Caveats: not sure if this is private property or not….also 4x4 mandatory. 

This place is SUPER beautiful and peaceful. We didn’t see a soul in 2 days. 

If you want to get even further off the “road” there is also an even worse small mud track that goes further into the forest. We walked it and it is very beautiful back there too. If we were staying more days we would go back further. 

You can also see the lake through the trees.

name: Parking area next to Lago di Misurina
description: Big parking area that is free after 8 pm. Nice view on the mountains next to the lake, some cars are passing at night but it didn‘t bother us. Just be careful.. entrance only for cars/small Vans (height limit). Stayed for 2 Nights.

name: Tempio pausania area sosta
description: Area with the possibility of loading and unloading water, electricity, very close to the town centre, surrounded by greenery with concrete pitches

name: R & B camping
description: Simple campsite with view on the lake from some spots.

name: Catacombe dei Cappuccini
description:
The Catacombs of the Capuchins of Palermo are composed of long galleries communicating in the tuff, for an extension of about 300 square meters.   Around 2,000 skeletons and mummified bodies are kept in these rooms, making the Catacombs of Palermo the largest and most extraordinary collection of mummies in the world.

https://www.catacombefraticappuccini.com/en/

name: Area sosta camper Gambassi Terme
description:
Translation: Camper parking area completely free, loading, unloading and electricity.

Area sosta Camper completamente gratuita, carico, scarico e elettricità.

name: Public water fountain/tap
description: Public drinkable water fountain, Italian style. Good for filling up bottles.

name: Pienza Parking Lot
description:
Big paid parking lot from 8h - 22hr. Seems free outside of those hours. We didn’t stay here to fully test it out, but it is 22:05 right now and there are 5 RVs here and more than 20 cars. 

There is also a bathroom still open in the middle including sinks and simple drinking fountain. Bring your own soap and toilet paper. Men’s bathroom has just a squatting stall, women’s a squatting and regular toilet, and then an inconspicuous handicap bathroom in between the two with a regular toilet.

name: Open gravel lot with a view
description:
Open gravel lot past the parking lot for Al Toco restaurant (which has some decent ratings). Had asked someone working there and they said it was good to park. All smooth sailing. Flat ground, lots of space.

I parked to the edge of the lot for the view and was pretty cold at night - late October, sleeping in a station wagon. Would park closer to the trees and less exposed next time. 

There’s a caffè that is unlisted atm out the lot and to the right across from the tabacchi, and an unlisted pasticceria up Str. della Tressa and to the left. Both with bathrooms.

Ciao bellas!

name: Water Station
description:
Free water station with naturale and frizzante. It looks like you have to pay, but it’s free, you just press the green button (left is fizzy=frizzante, right is flat=naturale).  It’s possible the free amount is limited and then you pay, but that didn’t happen for me.

There is also a big tap and yellow hose nearby for maybe filling up a camper with non-drinking water.

name: Marmolada Camping
description: Nice camping , with hot shower, bathroom, everything for 17€ ( 1 person-tent and bike).

name: Offagna
description: Excellent Camper Stop. Close to historical Village. Motor Home only. Grey and Blackwater and waste disposal, fresh water. 5 Euro per night

name: Torre Incina
description: We stayed here for two nights, off season is no problem. during season I don’t know. Very quiet at night. Some anglers come early in the morning.

name: poggio dell'aquila
description: near a secondary road, plenty of space. perfect for tents

name: Torre Calalunga
description: Nice place by the torre, accessible by 4x4. Frequented by local fishermen but quiet enough for an ovenight stay. Great views, could be windy probably but you can sort of hide behind the tower for southern winds.

name: Pineta molinara
description: lot of space along a stone beach, flat ground

name: Parking at Seaside
description: Parking lot between sporting equipment. Big space but only off season from Oktober to May. Lights all night, no trouble.

name: Porto pino
description:
dump Station.
Camper overnight
very easy

name: Small Sheppard hut
description:
Small Sheppard hut. I have been told that it fine to sleep here and it was no problem. There are some cars in the evening and in the morning. Also there are many animals.

no cellphone reception

name: Villa San Sebastiano
description: Small mountain village, very quiet, you can camp in the neighbouring fields.

name: Parking spiaggia di punta negra
description: Small parking space almost empty at night. Plenty of space for vans and big rigs. Good for one night stay.

name: Lavanderia selbst service
description: Good Washing Maschinen and dryer. clean place

name: Parking with a view + water
description:
Elevated parking, on a slant, but with a few flat spots (for cars and small campers).Had a quiet nice night and there’s a drinkable water tap on site (confirmed it’s drinkability with the mayor at the coffee shop on the morning - said not drinkable taps will say so:)

NOTE: google tried to take me up through the city, narrow, and stairs = impossible. You must come up from the “highway” side.

Also, highly recommend a 4min walk down to East side Cafè in the morning for a coffee and the only French croissant and pastries I’ve tasted in Italy over 5 weeks here:)

name: arenella beach
description: flat ground for camper 50 m from sand beach, access thru a small dirt road that might be closed in high season

name: good spot for tent
description:
nice spot for some tents. in the evening you have an awesome sunset and there is also a stone where you can sit and watch the sea.

cellphone connection available but not everywhere.

name: fountain with parking
description: fountain next to a parking lot also there is a nice view

name: wild beach Tindari
description: wonderful beach, flat ground, access with 4x4 and no higher than 2 m 50

name: San foca
description: nice flat space in the mountains, drinkable water at 300 m at liccia ermitage

name: Lago di Fedaia
description:
Parking place close to a restaurant next to Lago di Fedaia. Really beautiful view.
A lot of camping vehicles.

name: ostelo linda
description: nice basic hostel but safe parking for the motorbike

name: Parking lot directly by the sea
description:
Free parking (but not in July-August period) lot directly by the sea. There are public beach showers and toilets (some of them closed, some open.). Supermarket and beach bars nearby. Bus stop is very close by. One-way street with possibility of turning back, no height restrictions. A lot of campervans and motohomes. Spent 2 quiet nights here in November.
>>> Avoid coming here in July-August. Very busy and paid parking. <<<

name: Self service laundry
description:
New place where you can wash and dry your clothes. 
Washer: €5.50 -8 kg, €8.5 - 13 kg
Dryer: €2.50 - 10 mins

Of you have a light synthetic clothes 10 mins will be ok for dryer. But if you have good cotton clothing and jeans, expect to dry for at least 30 mins on high temperature. 

Also possible to wash dogs/cats stuff - separate washer and dryer.

name: Marina San ilario
description: wonderful spot between a pine tree forest and sand beach, close to an abandoned camping, lots of space, and wood for campfire

name: Colina Superga
description:
Parking next to the Basilica of Superga in Turin. A beautiful view of the entire city of Turin. Clean and quiet place to spend the night. It doesn't have any structure, but you can use the toilet outside the church.
.....
Estacionamento vizinho a Basílica de Superga em Torino. Uma linda visão de toda a cidade de Torino. Lugar limpo e tranquilo pra passar a noite. Não tem nenhuma estrutura, mas pode usar o banheiro no lado de fora da igreja

name: foce del crati
description: nice sand beach, desert in November, plenty of space and wood for campfire, paradisiac.

name: Paid water machine
description:
7.5 cents/L
Inexpensive paid water machine with fizzy and natural water. In a parking you could probably park for the night too. There’s some fountains around town, but no indication whether they’re potable or not.

name: Pineta Santa Maria del focallo
description:
Parking, little pine trees park with lots of tables and drinkable water.
Shower few meter away, on the dune side. Access to a long and calm beach (begin of october)

name: Alveare del Pizzi AA camper
description: Very good campsite with all the utilities.Prices are very good. 16eu for a camper per night,  3eu for electricity. Close to the hot springs. When you arruive you can go straight true the entrance where you get a ticket. Like in a carpark. You pay when exiting. Open 24/7 as it is an automated process. Very friendly staff. Restaurant a cross the street, but currently closed (28/11).

name: Seaside road
description: Parking for 20 by the sea.   Permitted off season

name: Restorante Casalta
description: Parking for six campervans close to the restaurant.   Excellent food, reasonably priced.   Friendly welcome and service.   Restaurant customers can park overnight without charge.   A steep driveway to enter the camping area will make it impossible for motorhomes.

name: La Campeggia
description: The new social camping of Costa Vescovato, open also in autumn/winter with limited services. contact us for more info! email, phone, maps, ig @lacampeggia

name: Dry riverbed of Torrente Rubbio
description: After Senise you can camp on the shores of the dry riverbed of Torrente Rubbio after you crossed a rocky and bumpy riverbed. It is really beautiful but only accessible for 4x4 cars with enough ground clearance. It is a moderate to difficult trail, but worth it!

name: City Center
description: Place where you can fill your drinking water

name: Alessandria
description: camper service, water and parking near mc donalds

name: Camping Monte Bianco
description: Nice, small campground with all the facilities.

name: camping village le mimose
description:
Big shady spaces right on the beach or a bit back if you wish. 2 decent sanitary blocks, electricity, free WiFi on the whole campsite. 
Good restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Pizza's from 6 to 10€. Bar with snacks all day, also after peak season. 
Big swimming pool and a small one with slides for the kids.
Free use of bicycles to do the  nice bike path along the Adriatic coast into a nice town with all amenities. 
Mini market on the campsite is well stocked and reasonably priced, but closes after Mid-september. 
25€ for 2 adults, 2 kids, with electricity and WiFi.
25% discount if you stay longer than a week. 

very helpful in good English at the reception.  We had Big issues on the engine of our LandCruiser. They recommended a good garage and took care of follow up and translations.

name: Agricamping su‘e Lentu
description:
Agriturismu which has a small area for campers. Just send a WA message to the owners and they will come an open the gate for you: ‪+39 329 408 5376‬
Beautiful, remote, quiet spot.

10E per adult, children from 2 to 10 years 5E , 5E per place camper plus 5E for elettic connetion. During the stop you will have the opportunity to park in our 6, 5 hectares of land in the shade of a large oak, and to use the connection to electricity, water, use of the kitchen, bathroom, shower, washing machine and Wi-Fi.

name: Campeggio Il Sole
description:
Esrablished campground at La Maddalena.
30€ (low season) for 2p + Camper + dog.

name: Parking lot
description: Parking lot next to the church.  Quiet and flat.

name: spiaggia Puzziteddu
description:
Plane spot for three five vans, 20 meters fron a sand beach. 
Close the spot there are some surf and kite surf schools.

name: Hotel geppi economy hotel with parking moto
description: Family hotel with moto parking inside , breakfast, near to the sea
